Achievements.TITLE[OneofEverything] = One of Everything
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[MyFirstCity] = Build city with residential, commercial and industrial zones, water, and electricity.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TheInspector] = Have a look at each individual info view panel.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[HappytobeofService] = Create a city district and assign a city service to that district.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[RoyalFlush] = Reach enough milestones to unlock all city services in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[KeyToTheCity] = Unlock each building available in the base game.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[SixFigures] = Reach a population of 100,000.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[GoAnywhere] = Have 20 active transport lines. These can be passenger or cargo lines or any mix of the two.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TheSizeOfGolfBalls] = Experience a hailstorm.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[OutforaSpin] = Experience a tornado.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[NowTheyreAllAshTrees] = Experience a forest fire.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[ZeroEmission] = Have a city that produces electricity by only using renewable energy sources.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[UpAndAway] = Build any airport.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[MakingAMark] = Build 5 signature buildings in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[EverythingTheLightTouches] = Unlock 150 map tiles in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[CallingtheShots] = Have 5 city policies active simultaneously.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[WideVariety] = Create 10 different districts in a single city and assign policies to each.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[ExecutiveDecision] = Assign a policy to a city district.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[AllSmiles] = Have at least 1000 citizens and an average happiness rating of 75%.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[YouLittleStalker] = Follow a citizen's lifepath from childhood to old age.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TheGoodStuff] = Listen to two different radio stations around the clock each.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[IMadeThis] = Use the editor to make an asset of any other type than a map.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[Cartography] = Use the editor to make a map.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TheExplorer] = Unlock 50 map tiles in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TheLastMileMarker] = Reach milestone 20.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TheArchitect] = Build 10 signature buildings in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[ThingsAreNotLookingUp] = Experience a rat infestation.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[FourSeasons] = Experience all four seasons by building a city in a climate with a snowy winter.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[Spiderwebbing] = Have 50 active transport lines. These can be passenger or cargo lines or any mix of the two.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[ThisIsNotMyHappyPlace] = Have at least 1000 citizens and an average happiness rating of 25%.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[SimplyIrresistible] = Have at least 1000 citizens and a city attractiveness rating of 90.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[Snapshot] = Use the photo mode to take a screenshot.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TheDeepEnd] = Have a total loan of at least 200,000 in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[Groundskeeper] = Build 10 parks in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[ColossalGardener] = Plant 100 trees or bushes with the landscaping tool in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[StrengthThroughDiversity] = Have buildings from all four zone types in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[SquasherDowner] = Bulldoze a total of 1000 buildings.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[OneofEverything] = Build all unique city service buildings in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[ALittleBitofTLC] = Have 6,000 citizens treated at medical clinics or hospitals in a single city.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[TopoftheClass] = Build a city where at least 15% of the population has a university level of education.
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[WelcomeOneandAll] = Have a total of 6,000 tourist visits in a single city.
Achievements.TITLE[PS5Trophy] = Expert City Planner
Achievements.DESCRIPTION[PS5Trophy] = Earn all the trophies.
Assets.SUB_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[RoadsSmallRoads] = Basic urban streets that allow for low speed traffic.
Assets.NAME[Small Road] = Two-lane Road
Assets.DESCRIPTION[Small Road] = Simple two-lane road that allows traffic in both directions.
Assets.NAME[Small Road Oneway - 1 lane] = One-lane One-way Road
Assets.DESCRIPTION[Small Road Oneway - 1 lane] = Simple one-lane road that allows traffic in one direction.

Assets.DESCRIPTION[Alley] = Narrow two-lane road without sidewalks. Allows traffic in both directions.

Assets.DESCRIPTION[Medium Road Oneway] = Four-lane road that allows traffic in one direction.

Assets.DESCRIPTION[Medium Road Oneway - 5 lanes] = Five-lane road that allows traffic in one direction.

Assets.DESCRIPTION[SolarPowerStation01] = Photovoltaic cells generate electricity from sunlight. It is stored in batteries during daytime and fed into the network during nights. As power is generated from sunlight alone, power output depends on the weather, but the plant also does not produce any ground or air pollution.\r\nCan be upgraded with a backup battery, an advanced tracking system, and high voltage substations.
Assets.UPGRADE_NAME[GeothermalPowerPlant01 Additional Transformer Station] = High Voltage Substation
Assets.UPGRADE_DESCRIPTION[GeothermalPowerPlant01 Additional Transformer Station] = Allows for a new Power Line to be built from the plant.
Assets.DESCRIPTION[GeothermalPowerPlant01] = Electricity is generated from heat drawn from deep underground, so no fuel source is needed for these power plants. As a downside, they are somewhat expensive to build and maintain. Some greenhouse gasses also leak into the atmosphere in the process, causing air pollution. \r\nCan be upgraded with an additional turbine, a more efficient power generation process, and high voltage substations.

CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_DESCRIPTION[Residential] = Residential zones are where different types of housing is constructed.\r\nResidential demand results from workplaces being available in the city.
CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_DESCRIPTION[ResidentialLow] = Residential zones are where different types of housing is constructed.\r\nResidential demand results from workplaces being available in the city.

CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_DESCRIPTION[ResidentialHigh] = Residential zones are where different types of housing is constructed.\r\nResidential demand results from workplaces being available in the city. 
CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_FACTOR_POSITIVE[UneducatedWorkforce] = Labor Availability
CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_FACTOR_NEGATIVE[UneducatedWorkforce] = Labor Availability
CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_DESCRIPTION[Commercial] = Commercial zones are where shops, boutiques, restaurants, hotels and other commercial buildings are built.\r\nCommercial demand rises when citizens require more commercial goods and services.
CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_DESCRIPTION[Industrial] = Industrial zones are used to build factories, workshops, warehouses and other buildings that extract, process, manufacture, and store consumer products and raw materials.\r\nIndustrial demand is driven by commercial companies requiring industrial products.
CityInfoPanel.DEMAND_DESCRIPTION[Office] = Office zones provide buildings for companies that produce immaterial goods and services for use by citizens and commercial companies.\r\nOffice demand is driven by citizens' and commercial companies' need for office products and services.

EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Communications] = Lowering the Communications Service budget will result in reduced network capacity and post vehicle capacity.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Education & Research] = Lowering the Education Service budget will result in fewer students graduating.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Electricity] = Lowering the Electricity Service budget will result in reduced power output levels.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Fire & Rescue] = Lowering the Fire & Rescue Service budget will result in reduced rescue vehicle capacity and shelter capacity.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Garbage Management] = Lowering the Garbage Management Service budget will result in reduced vehicle capacity and processing speed.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Health & Deathcare] = Lowering the Healthcare Service budget will lower the treatment bonuses as well as the number of Healthcare vehicles.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Parks & Recreation] = Lowering the Parks & Recreation Service budget will reduce the attractiveness and entertainment values of parks, plazas, recreational facilities and tourist attractions.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Police & Administration] = Lowering the Police & Administration Service budget will reduce the number of police vehicles, the Welfare Offices provide less well-being, and the likelihood of returning to crime after a prison sentence is raised.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Roads] = Lowering the Roads Service budget will reduce road maintenance vehicle capacity.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Transportation] = Lowering the Transportation Service budget will result in lowered vehicle capacity and longer maintenance times.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_DESCRIPTION[Water & Sewage] = Lowering the Water & Sewage Service budget will result in lowered pumping station processing capacity.

EconomyPanel.LOAN_PAGE_TITLE = Loans
EconomyPanel.LOAN_PAGE_DESCRIPTION = If your are short on money, you can take a loan to finance the expansion of your city.\r\n\r\nIn return, you will have to pay **interest** every month until you repay the loan by moving the loan slider back to 0.\r\n\r\nYour **borrowing limit** will increase with every milestone. The closer you get to the limit, the higher the **interest rate** will be.\r\n\r\nThe interest rate can be decreased by placing a **City Hall** or **Central Bank** in city.
EconomyPanel.LOAN_FORM_LIMIT = Limit: {LOAN_LIMIT}

EconomyPanel.SERVICES_LABEL_WAGES = Wages
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Roads] = Road Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Roads] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects how many **road maintenance vehicles** are currently in use.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Electricity] = Electricity Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Electricity] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects the electricity **output levels** of power plants and the **charging rate** of batteries in battery stations.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Water & Sewage] = Water & Sewage Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Water & Sewage] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects the **water output** levels of water pumping stations as well as the **sewage treatment** levels of sewage buildings.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Health & Deathcare] = Healthcare & Deathcare Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Health & Deathcare] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency**.\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects citizens' **recovery from illnesses and injuries**. It also affects how many **ambulances** are currently in use.\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects how many **hearses** are currently in use as well as the **processing speed** of bodies in the Crematorium.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the **city-wide effects** of the Disease Control Center and Health Research Institute.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Garbage Management] = Garbage Management Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Garbage Management] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects the **processing speed** of garbage as well as how many **garbage trucks** are currently in use.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the **electricity output** level of the Incineration Plant and the **city-wide effects** of the Industrial Waste Processing Site.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Education & Research] = Education & Research Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Education & Research] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects the **graduation chance** of students.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the **city-wide effects** of the Technical University, Medical University, Radio Telescope, Geological Research Center, and the Large Hadron Collider.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Fire & Rescue] = Fire & Rescue Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Fire & Rescue] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects how many **fire engines** are currently in use.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the **city-wide effect** of the Early Disaster Warning System.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Police & Administration] = Police & Administration Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Police & Administration] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects how many **police cars** are currently in use.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the **city-wide effects** of the Central Intelligence Bureau Field Office, City Hall, and the Central Bank.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Transportation] = Transportation Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Transportation] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects how many **public transportation vehicles** are currently in use.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the **city-wide effect** of the ChirpX Space Center.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Parks & Recreation] = Parks & Recreation Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Parks & Recreation] = The service budget affects service building **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects how many **park maintenance vehicles** are currently in use.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the **attractiveness value** of the buildings.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_TITLE[Communications] = Communications Budget
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION[Communications] = The service budget affects the service buildings' **efficiency.**\r\n\r\nEfficiency affects the range and capacity of networks and how many post vans and trucks are currently in use.\r\n\r\nEfficiency also affects the city-wide effects of the Satellite Uplink.
EconomyPanel.SERVICES_RESOURCE_FEE_DESCRIPTION[Electricity] = Citizens and businesses pay a service fee for using electricity, which offsets some of its production cost.\r\n\r\nThe electricity service fee affects the **overall electricity consumption rate** of the city. It also affects the happiness of citizens and companies' ability to do business.
EconomyPanel.SERVICES_RESOURCE_FEE_DESCRIPTION[Water] = Citizens and businesses pay a service fee for using water, which offsets some its production cost.\r\n\r\nThe water service fee affects the **overall water consumption rate** and **sewage generation** of the city. It also affects the happiness of citizens and companies' ability to do business.
EconomyPanel.TAX_AREA_DESCRIPTION[Residential] = Residential taxes are collected from citizens' monthly wages.\r\n\r\nTax rates can be set individually based on each citizen education level.\r\n\r\nLow taxes encourage citizens to move into the city. Lower taxes also help residential buildings level up faster, since more money is left over after upkeep expenses are paid.\r\n\r\nHigher taxes bring more money into the citys treasury, but can drive away the citizens not willing to pay as much. Higher taxes also slow down residential building level ups, as there is less money left for improvement after expenses are paid. 
EconomyPanel.TAX_AREA_DESCRIPTION[Commercial] = Commercial taxes are collected from companies' monthly profits.\r\n\r\nTax rates can be set individually based on the different types of goods sold.\r\n\r\nLow taxes increase companies' chances of becoming financially successful. Lower taxes also help commercial buildings level up faster, since more money is left over after upkeep expenses are paid.\r\n\r\nHigher taxes bring more money into the citys treasury, but can also cause companies problems by cutting into their profit margin. Higher taxes also slow down commercial building level ups, as there is less money left for improvement after expenses are paid.
EconomyPanel.TAX_AREA_DESCRIPTION[Industrial] = Industrial taxes are collected from companies' monthly profits.\r\n\r\nTax rates can be set individually based on the different types of goods manufactured and sold.\r\n\r\nLow taxes increase companies' chances of becoming financially successful. Lower taxes also help industrial buildings level up faster, since more money is left over after upkeep expenses are paid.\r\n\r\nHigher taxes bring more money into the citys treasury, but can also cause companies problems by cutting into their profit margin. Higher taxes also slow down industrial building level ups, as there is less money left for improvement after expenses are paid.
EconomyPanel.TAX_AREA_DESCRIPTION[Office] = Office taxes are collected from companies' monthly profits.\r\n\r\nTax rates can be set individually based on different types of immaterial goods manufactured and sold.\r\n\r\nLow taxes increase companies' chances of becoming financially successful. Lower taxes also help office buildings level up faster, since more money is left over after upkeep expenses are paid.\r\n\r\nHigher taxes bring more money into the citys treasury, but can also cause companies problems by cutting into their profit margin. Higher taxes also slow down office building level ups, as there is less money left for improvement after expenses are paid.
EconomyPanel.TAX_RANGE = {MIN}{MAX}%
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Taxes] = Taxes
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Taxes] = Taxes are collected from households and companies.\r\n\r\nResidential taxes are based on monthly wages. Company taxes are based on monthly profits.\r\n\r\nLow taxes encourage new citizens to move into the city, and increase companies' chances of becoming successful. Low taxes also help buildings level up faster, as more money is left over after the building upkeep expenses are paid. \r\n\r\nHigh taxes bring in more money for the city, but can drive away citizens, and they cut into companies' profits. High taxes also make building leveling up slower, since there is less cash left after paying for upkeep expenses.
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Fees] = Service Fees
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Fees] = Fees are paid by households and companies in exchange for using various services such as education, healthcare, and utilities.\r\n\r\nHouseholds and companies adjust their service usage based on how high the fees are. While lower fees increase well-being in the city, they may not be enough to cover the services operating cost entirely. This leaves the city to pay for the rest.
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Exports] = Service Trade
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Exports] = Surplus from city services can be traded with surrounding cities in exchange for additional income.\r\n\r\nFor example, visitors can use the citys healthcare services, and vacancies in schools can get filled by students from other cities. Surplus fresh water and sewage treatment capacity as well as excess electricity are automatically sold to surrounding cities as long as the proper utilities connections have been built (pipes for water and sewage, power lines for electricity). 
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Government] = Government Subsidies
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Government] = The government automatically grants the city subsidies depending in its economic situation. A small city in an overall weak financial situation with poor tax revenue and low service fees receives a fair amount of subsidies, while a larger city in a good financial situation with high revenue stream receives only negligible to no subsidies.
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Subsidies] = Subsidies
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Subsidies] = Households and companies will receive city subsidies when their tax rates are set in the negative. This will give them a financial boost and exempt them from paying tax. With subsidies, households have more money to level up their building after paying for expenses. Subsidized companies have higher profit margins, and thus they are also able to spend more money on leveling up their businesses.\r\n\r\nSubsidies can be set on the **Taxation** tab, and they are adjustable based on citizen education levels for households and material and immaterial goods manufactured and sold for companies.
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Upkeeps] = Service Upkeeps
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Upkeeps] = Service upkeep costs consist of the service buildings operating costs (building maintenance and resources used to provide its service such as fuel for a power plant) and the wages of its employees.\r\n\r\nService buildings only provide the amount of each service required by the city at any given time, up to their maximum capacity. Accordingly, they only employ the required number of employees at all times. \r\n\r\nTo save on operating costs, it is possible to lower the quality of a service on the **Services** tab. This decreases the number of employees hired, but will also lead to poorer performance. For example, waiting times for ambulances will be longer, and police and fire departments will have increased response times due to short-staffing.
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Imports] = Service Trade
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Imports] = Certain services can be imported from surrounding cities. These include education, electricity, water and sewage, police and fire services, road maintenance, healthcare services and garbage services.\r\n\r\nImported services cost the city more than having them provided locally, but importing may be useful when the city is low on space, for example. The overall cost of an imported service is determined by actual usage amounts.
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM[Loan Interest] = Loan Interest
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_ITEM_DESCRIPTION[Loan Interest] = If the city takes a loan, it needs to pay monthly interest based on the loaned amount.\r\n\r\nWhenever a new loan is taken, it is combined into any existing loan, and the monthly interest is calculated based on the combined total. Loan interest is a monthly running cost and does not reduce the loaned amount. Loans can be taken and paid back on the **Loans** tab.
EconomyPanel.TAX_AREA_COLUMN_TITLE = Type
EconomyPanel.SERVICES_RESOURCE_FEE_CONSUMPTION[Electricity] = Electricity Consumption
EconomyPanel.SERVICES_RESOURCE_FEE_CONSUMPTION[Water] = Water Consumption

EconomyPanel.SERVICES_RESOURCE_FEE_EFFICIENCY = Company Efficiency
EconomyPanel.TAB[Loan] = Loans
EconomyPanel.BUDGET_SUB_ITEM[FeeWater] = Water Fees
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_FEES_REVENUE_DESCRIPTION = Citizens and companies pay fees for using the city's services. The fees offset some of the service upkeep costs.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_EXPORT_REVENUE_DESCRIPTION = The city gains income from exporting excess services via Outside Connections.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_UPKEEP_EXPENSE_DESCRIPTION = Upkeep consists of building maintenance and resource costs.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_IMPORT_EXPENSE_DESCRIPTION = The city can import services from Outside Connections, but importing incurs expenses.
EconomyPanel.SERVICE_BUDGET_EFFICIENCY = Service Efficiency

Loading.LOADING_TITLE = Loading...
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:0 = Tram tracks can be built directly on top of existing roads. No need to redo anything.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:1 = If you're running out of space to build, see if you can purchase a new Map Tile!
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:2 = When placing a City Service building, you're shown the service coverage area of existing buildings of the same type.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:3 = Outside Connections are any land, sea or air routes out of your city. They handle export, import, and tourist traffic.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:4 = Many tools can be used in different modes. Check the bottom left of the screen for options.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:5 = Residential zones work best near workplaces.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:6 = Commercial zones work best near potential customers.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:7 = Industrial zones work best near resources, but also create pollution.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:8 = Existing zones can be re-zoned by simply assigning a new zone type on top of the old one.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:9 = Reaching new Milestones allows access to new City Services.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:10 = By adjusting taxes, you can decide how much residents, companies and industries pay towards the city budget.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:11 = The budget for each City Service can be individually adjusted in the City Economy screen.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:12 = After each work shift, City Service vehicles need to spend some time out of action for refueling, maintenance, and so on. Some upgrades shorten this period.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:13 = In addition to ground level, roads and tracks can also be built on elevated platforms as well as underground.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:14 = Freshwater can be pumped from underground deposits as well as from rivers and lakes.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:15 = Info Views display information about the city with visual overlays. These help you understand what's happening and where.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:16 = Zoned buildings have 5 development levels. Higher level buildings have increased upkeep costs, but also produce less garbage and pollution. They also consume less water and electricity.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:17 = Natural disasters may strike the city at random. Warning systems and emergency shelters can help your citizens when that happens. Natural Disasters can also be disabled from the options menu.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:18 = Natural resources are used by the local industry. When you have active Agriculture, Forestry, Oil Drilling or Mining industries, other related industries also appear.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:19 = Each citizen, vehicle and building can be individually selected. This opens an info panel that shows you more information.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:20 = Advanced forms of City Service buildings can be unlocked in the Milestone panel, under their specific development trees.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:21 = Keep an eye on Chirper, the social media feed. Your citizens are sure to write when things are going well. Or poorly.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:22 = You can pause or speed up the flow of time whenever necessary. The controls are in the bottom left corner of your screen.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:23 = Most City Service buildings can be further upgraded after being built. Upgrades enhance the operating capacity of the building or provide additional functionalities.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:24 = You can enact Policies to change how certain things in the city function. Citywide policies can be activated on the City Info panel, and district policies from the Info Panels of individual districts.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:25 = Weather and traffic cause wear on roads, which leads to lower driving speeds and makes accidents more likely. Road repairs are handled by the Road Maintenance city service.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:26 = Access to Medical, Police, and Firefighting helicopters is granted by building the Helipad upgrade on relevant City Service buildings.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:27 = Most buildings need a road connection, since roads come with integrated electricity and water infrastructure.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:28 = Pay attention to groundwater deposit locations to avoid polluting them when placing industrial zones or fuel burning power plants.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:29 = All in-game guidance texts are collected in the Advisor panel in the top right corner of your screen, so you can return to them whenever necessary.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:30 = Purchasing new Map Tiles requires both money as well as enough Expansion Permits.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:31 = Your Global Theme setting defines the default style of buildings and roads. You can always change this in-game if you wish.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:32 = The parallel mode in tool options allows you to build two sets of roads or tracks next to each other.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:33 = Existing City Service and Signature buildings can be moved to a new location by opening the building info panel and selecting Relocate.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:34 = Electric buses are available through a Bus Depot upgrade.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:35 = If you want a City Service to only work inside a certain district, open the building info panel and select Operating Districts.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:36 = Pay attention when building water pumping stations. Polluted water will make citizens sick.
Loading.HINTMESSAGE:37 = The number of turning lanes in an intersection is affected by the road types. Try using asymmetric roads where you need more turning lanes.

Maps.RESOURCE[Forest] = Forest
Maps.RESOURCE[Oil] = Oil
Maps.RESOURCE[Ore] = Ore
Climate.SEASON[Summer] = Summer
Climate.SEASON[Winter] = Winter
Climate.SEASON[Autumn] = Fall
Climate.SEASON[Spring] = Spring
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Delta] = A large, snaking river splitting into a delta is the centerpiece of this map. Surrounded by hills, the terrain is mostly flat, with large contiguous land masses offering plenty of buildable area. The delta, while seemingly tricky to navigate, grants great access to shipping traffic and a natural way to create outside connections.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Lakeland] = Lakeland
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Mountain Village] = Mountain Village

Maps.MAP_TITLE[Archipelago] = Archipelago Haven
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Archipelago] = A chain of islands enveloped by water, this map comprises atolls, lagoons, and peninsulas. A highway running across the map connects some of the larger islands while also providing a connection to the outside world. The buildable area is split over several pieces of land, which offers a range of options for traffic over land, water and air.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Delta] = River Delta
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Mountain Village] = Grassland plains in the midst of a mountain range. Water flowing from the hills creates a river valley in the center of this map with a breathtaking view in every direction. The buildable area between the mountains is fairly flat, but space is at a premium here, so careful planning will be of the essence.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Highlands] = Great Highlands
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Highlands] = Craggy hills and flat-topped mountain ranges dominate this map. Long, narrow lakes split the land in places, while plateaus between the mountains offer suitable locations for city building. The coastline, while dotted by rocky islands, affords traffic by sea.
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Lakeland] = Beautiful and serene landscape filled with lush forests, sparkling lakes, and rolling hills. Breathtaking views create a delightful backdrop to any city built here, and the low height variation of the terrain ensures there is plenty of space to build. The two existing highways are connected to each other, which allows for plenty of truck traffic into the city early on.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Coast] = Twin Mountain
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Coast] = A small river splitting the map in two runs between flat-topped, steep-sided mountain formations. A gentle slope runs from the mountains to eventually turn into a wide ocean coastline dotted with numerous cliffs and beaches. Without any pre-existing train tracks, a railway connection must be created from scratch.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Fjords] = Windy Fjords
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Fjords] = Reaching the coastline requires careful navigation past several long and narrow inlets surrounded by steep cliffs. Luckily, the inland is comfortably flat with plenty of space for expansion, and multiple small rivers offer more than enough options to solve the city's water needs. Highways and train tracks occasionally need tunnels in order to cross the massive cliffs dominating the area.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[River Valley] = Waterway Pass
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[River Valley] = Two colossal mountain ranges create a natural border from two sides, while providing ample flat space for building between them. A large, meandering river flows in the middle of the map joined by a few smaller brooks from the mountains. Train tracks run across the entire area, making it easy to tap into the existing railway network for quick outside access.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Plains] = Sweeping Plains
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Plains] = The vast ocean can be accessed from multiple smooth beaches nestled between rising cliffs. Opposite the ocean, a long and tall mountain range creates a marvelous landscape. A broad expanse of flat land provides plenty of buildable space between the ocean and the mountains. A single highway runs through the entire length of the map.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Barrier Island] = Barrier Island
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Barrier Island] = A long chain of barrier islands has huge potential for prime real estate right from the start. Highway and railway tracks follow the coastline on the mainland, which is separated from the islands by a large bay. An existing shipping lane runs across the bay and connects to the open ocean.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[San Francisco] = San Francisco
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[San Francisco] = The iconic peninsula characterized by steep hills and sweeping views of the bay. The map is surrounded by water, with the Pacific Ocean to the west and the San Francisco Bay to the east. The Golden Gate Bridge spans the strait, connecting San Francisco to Marin County.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Tampere] = Tampere
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Tampere] = Tampere, home of Colossal Order, is known for its stunning natural beauty and waterways. The map is located on an isthmus between two large lakes, Nsijrvi and Pyhjrvi, which are connected by a river. The surrounding landscape is characterized by lakes, rolling hills and dense forests. Three linked highway connections can easily form the backbone of the city's traffic.
Maps.OUTSIDE_CONNECTIONS[Electricity] = Electricity Connections
Maps.OUTSIDE_CONNECTIONS[Water] = Water & Sewage Connections
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Corral Riches] = Corral Riches
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Corral Riches] = A vast coastline expanse filled to the brim with natural resources. The center is dominated by a large lake, accompanied by sizable islands suitable for building. Multiple outside connections provide additional opportunities for resource production and transportation of goods.
Maps.MAP_TITLE[Sunshine Peninsula] = Sunshine Peninsula
Maps.MAP_DESCRIPTION[Sunshine Peninsula] = A peninsula comprising a plateau and some islands, basking in the eternal sunshine and the warm sea breeze. The terrain provides a lot of easily buildable space to found a thriving city. With literally no rain and steady warm temperatures throughout the year, this is an ideal choice for those loving the sun.

Options.WARN_TOOLCHAIN_INSTALL = Unity {UNITY_VERSION} will be downloaded from {HOST} and installed on your machine.\r\nYou need to activate a Unity license (Personal license is free) then a Unity project will be opened in the editor and synchronize the required packages to compile and post process Code Mods.\r\nThe process takes a while but only needs to be done once.
Options.WARN_TOOLCHAIN_UNINSTALL = Unity {UNITY_VERSION} will be uninstalled from your machine and related files deleted.\r\nReinstall the toolchain if you wish to develop Code Mods in the future.

Paradox.ERROR[NotAuthorized.ExpiredRefreshToken] = The user needs to do a full user login using credentials again.
Paradox.ERROR[NotAuthorized.ExpiredSessionToken] = The user needs to use the refresh token to create a new session token.
Paradox.ERROR[NotAuthorized.SessionTooLowTrustLevel] = The session doesnt have high enough trust level, login again with credentials that gives higher trust level.
Paradox.ERROR[NotAuthorized.InvalidAuthentication] = The supplied authentication does not validate.
Paradox.ERROR[NotAuthorized.RejectedByThirdParty] = Authentication was rejected by a third party: Steam, PSN, Twitch, etc.
Paradox.ERROR[NotAuthorized.ForbiddenAccess] = Trying to access data that is forbidden for this session.
Paradox.ERROR[NotAuthorized.AutomaticLoginFailure] = The Account.Startup() was not able to automatically login the user. Do a manual Account.Login(Credentials) call instead.
Paradox.ERROR[NotFound.NoAccount] = Cannot find the account.
Paradox.ERROR[NotFound.NoDocument] = Cannot find the document.
Paradox.ERROR[NotFound.NoMergeTask] = Cannot find the merge task.
Paradox.ERROR[NotFound.NoMod] = Cannot find the mod.

Paradox.ERROR[NotFound.NoResource] = Cannot find the requested resource.

Paradox.ERROR[BadUserInput.UA] = You are not eligible to create an account.
Paradox.ERROR[BadUserInput.InvalidEmail] = The email is not valid or its blacklisted.
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidInput.MissingParameter] = Obligatory parameter is missing, details should contain what is missing.
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidInput.InvalidType] = Parameter contains invalid type, details should contain the affected parameters.
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidInput.InvalidLength] = Parameter is either too long or too short, details should contain the affected parameters.
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidInput.InvalidFormat] = Parameter is in a bad format, details should contain what parameters are affected.
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidInput.AuthMissing] = Auth is needed for this endpoint but it is missing.
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidInput.InvalidHeader] = Header is invalid.

Paradox.ERROR[DuplicateEntry.DocumentExists] = This document already exists in the backend.

Paradox.ERROR[InvalidState.TelemetryDisabled] = Telemetry can not be sent in this state,
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidState.NotLoggedIn] = No account is logged in to the SDK. Please call Account.Login or Account.Startup first.

Paradox.ERROR[InvalidState.MalformedJSON] = The JSON body of the response could not be parsed.

Paradox.ERROR[InvalidState.NetworkSendError] = Errors related to general data send.
Paradox.ERROR[InvalidState.TaskTimeoutError] = Errors related to tasks timing out waiting for a response.

CinematicCamera.PLAYBACK_DURATION = Playback Duration
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.focalLength] = Focal Length
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.focalLength] = Defines the distance between the sensor and the camera lens. This determines the vertical field of view. Smaller focal lengths result in a larger field of view, and vice versa.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Position] = Position
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PositionX] = Horizontal (x)
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PositionY] = Vertical (y)
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PositionZ] = Horizontal (z)
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Rotation] = Rotation
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[RotationX] = Vertical
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[RotationY] = Horizontal
PhotoMode.TAB[Camera] = Camera
PhotoMode.TAB[Lens] = Lens
PhotoMode.TAB[Color] = Color
PhotoMode.TAB[Environment] = Environment
PhotoMode.ENVIRONMENT_DISCLAIMER = Changing environment properties such as time of day or cloudiness may affect simulation
PhotoMode.RESET_PROPERTY_TOOLTIP = Reset
PhotoMode.ENABLE_PROPERTY_TOOLTIP = Enable/Disable
PhotoMode.CAPTURE_PROPERTY_TOOLTIP = Capture Keyframe for Cinematic Camera
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.sensorSize] = Sensor Size
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.sensorSize] = Defines the width and height of the sensor that captures the image in millimeters. These affects the aspect ratio.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.lensShift] = Lens Shift
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.lensShift] = Offsets the camera's lens from its sensor horizontally and vertically. This allows to change the focal center and reposition a subject in the frame with little to no distortion.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.aperture] = Aperture
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.aperture] = Defines the f-stop (f-number) of the lens. Lower values give a wider lens aperture.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.bladeCount] = Blade Count
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.bladeCount] = Defines the number of blades in the lens aperture. Higher values give a rounder aperture shape.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.curvature] = Curvature
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.curvature] = Controls the curvature of the lens aperture blades. The minimum value results in fully-curved, perfectly-circular bokeh, and the maximum value results in visible aperture blades.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.barrelClipping] = Barrel Clipping
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.barrelClipping] = Controls the self-occlusion of the lens, creating a cat's eye effect.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.anamorphism] = Anamorphism
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.anamorphism] = Stretches the sensor to simulate an anamorphic look. Positive values distort the Camera vertically, negative will distort the Camera horizontally.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.iso] = Iso
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.iso] = Sets the light sensitivity of the Camera sensor.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.shutterSpeed] = Shutter Speed
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.shutterSpeed] = Defines the amount of time in seconds the camera sensor is capturing light.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.gateFitMode] = Gate Fit
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhotoModeRenderSystem.gateFitMode] = Determines how the rendered area (resolution gate) fits into the sensor area (film gate).
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.lensShift/x] = Horizontal Shift
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.lensShift/y] = Vertical Shift
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.curvature/x] = Minimum
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.curvature/y] = Maximum
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.sensorSize/x] = Width
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhotoModeRenderSystem.sensorSize/y] = Height
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.focusMode] = Focus Mode
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.focusMode] = Sets the focus mode for the depth of field. Physical or manual.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.focusDistance] = Focus Distance
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.focusDistance] = Sets the distance of the focus plane from the camera. Only used with physical focus mode.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.nearFocusStart] = Near Range Start
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.nearFocusStart] = Sets the distance from the camera at which the near field blur begins to decrease in intensity. Only used with manual focus mode.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.nearFocusEnd] = Near Range End
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.nearFocusEnd] = Sets the distance from the camera at which the near field does not blur anymore. Only used with manual focus mode.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.farFocusStart] = Far Range Start
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.farFocusStart] = Sets the distance from the camera at which the far field starts blurring. Only used with manual focus mode.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.farFocusEnd] = Far Range End
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.farFocusEnd] = Sets the distance from the Camera at which the far field blur reaches its maximum blur radius. Only used with manual focus mode.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.m_NearMaxBlur] = Max Near Blur
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.m_NearMaxBlur] = Sets the maximum radius the near blur can reach.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField.m_FarMaxBlur] = Max Far Blur
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField.m_FarMaxBlur] = Sets the maximum radius the far blur can reach.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[MotionBlur.intensity] = Intensity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[MotionBlur.intensity] = Sets the intensity of the motion blur effect. Acts as a multiplier for velocities.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[MotionBlur.minimumVelocity] = Minimum Velocity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[MotionBlur.minimumVelocity] = Controls the minimum velocity, in pixels, that an object must have to contribute to the motion blur effect.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[MotionBlur.maximumVelocity] = Maximum Velocity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[MotionBlur.maximumVelocity] = Controls the maximum velocity, in pixels, that an object must have to contribute to the motion blur effect.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[MotionBlur.depthComparisonExtent] = Depth Comparison Extent
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[MotionBlur.depthComparisonExtent] = Value used for the depth based weighting of samples. Tweak if unwanted leak of background onto foreground or viceversa is detected.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Bloom.threshold] = Treshold
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Bloom.threshold] = Set the level of brightness to filter out pixels under this level. This value is expressed in gamma-space. A value above 0 will disregard energy conservation rules.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Bloom.intensity] = Intensity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Bloom.intensity] = Controls the strength of the bloom filter.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Bloom.scatter] = Scatter
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Bloom.scatter] = Sets the radius of the bloom effect.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.intensity] = Intensity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Vignette.intensity] = Controls the strength of the vignette effect.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.color] = Color
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Vignette.color] = Specifies the color of the vignette.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.color/r] = Red
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.color/g] = Green
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.color/b] = Blue
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.center] = Center
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Vignette.center] = Sets the center point for the vignette in device coordinates [0-1].
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.center/x] = X
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.center/y] = Y
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.smoothness] = Smoothness
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Vignette.smoothness] = Controls the smoothness of the vignette borders.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.roundness] = Roundness
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Vignette.roundness] = Controls how round the vignette is, lower values result in a more square vignette.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette.rounded] = Rounded
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Vignette.rounded] = When enabled, the vignette is perfectly round. When disabled, the vignette matches shape with the current aspect ratio.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[FilmGrain.intensity] = Intensity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[FilmGrain.intensity] = Set the strength of the film grain effect.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[FilmGrain.response] = Response
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[FilmGrain.response] = Controls the noisiness response curve. The higher this value, the less noise in brighter areas.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[FilmGrain.type] = Type
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[FilmGrain.type] = Specifies the type of grain to use.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PaniniProjection.distance] = Distance
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PaniniProjection.distance] = Controls the panini projection distance. This controls the strength of the distortion.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PaniniProjection.cropToFit] = Crop To Fit
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PaniniProjection.cropToFit] = Controls how much cropping is applied to the screen with the panini projection effect. A value of 1 crops the distortion to the edge of the screen.
PhotoMode.GATEFITMODE[None] = None
PhotoMode.GATEFITMODE[Vertical] = Vertical
PhotoMode.GATEFITMODE[Horizontal] = Horizontal
PhotoMode.GATEFITMODE[Fill] = Fill
PhotoMode.GATEFITMODE[Overscan] = Overscan

PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.postExposure] = Post Exposure
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ColorAdjustments.postExposure] = Adjusts the brightness of the image just before color grading, in EV.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.contrast] = Contrast
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ColorAdjustments.contrast] = Controls the overall range of the tonal values.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.colorFilter] = Tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ColorAdjustments.colorFilter] = Specifies the color of the tint.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.colorFilter/r] = Red
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.colorFilter/g] = Green
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.colorFilter/b] = Blue
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.hueShift] = Hue Shift
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ColorAdjustments.hueShift] = Controls the hue of all colors in the render.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments.saturation] = Saturation
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ColorAdjustments.saturation] = Controls the intensity of all colors in the render.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[WhiteBalance.temperature] = Temperature
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[WhiteBalance.temperature] = Controls the color temperature HDRP uses for white balancing.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[WhiteBalance.tint] = Tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[WhiteBalance.tint] = Controls the white balance color to compensate for a green or magenta tint.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ShadowsMidtonesHighlights.shadows] = Shadows
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ShadowsMidtonesHighlights.shadows] = Controls the brightness of the shadows.

PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ShadowsMidtonesHighlights.highlights] = Highlights

PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[DepthOfField] = Depth Of Field
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[DepthOfField] = Collection of properties that controls the depth of field effect.\r\nDepth of field is used to make near and far objects out of focus look blurry.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[MotionBlur] = Motion Blur
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[MotionBlur] = Collection of properties that controls the motion blur effect.\r\nMotion blur is used to mimic streaking of moving objects.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Bloom] = Bloom
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Bloom] = Collection of properties that controls the bloom effect.\r\nBloom is used to mimic fringes of light extending from the borders of bright areas in an image.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ShadowsMidtonesHighlights] = Brightness
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ShadowsMidtonesHighlights] = Collection of properties that controls the brightness of Shadows, Midtones and Highlights.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[FilmGrain] = Film Grain
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[FilmGrain] = Collection of properties that controls the film grain effect.\r\nFilm grain is used to simulate the noisy look of processed photographic celluloid.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Vignette] = Vignette
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Vignette] = Collection of properties that controls the vignette effect.\r\nA vignette is a darker border at the periphery of the frame.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PaniniProjection] = Panini Projection
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PaniniProjection] = Collection of properties that controls the panini projection.\r\nA panini projection is a cylindrical projection that helps keep vertical straight lines straight and vertical.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[WhiteBalance] = White Balance
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[WhiteBalance] = Collection of properties that controls the image white balance.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[ColorAdjustments] = Color Adjustments
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[ColorAdjustments] = Collection of properties that controls the image colors.

PhotoMode.TAB[Weather] = Weather
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer] = Distance clouds
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer] = Collection of properties that controls the look of distance clouds.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds] = Volumetric clouds
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds] = Collection of properties that controls the look of volumetric clouds.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky] = Atmosphere
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky] = Collection of properties that controls the look of the sky and atmosphere.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog] = Fog
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog] = Collection of properties that controls the look of the fog.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.opacity] = Opacity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.opacity] = Sets the global opacity of the distance clouds. A value of 0 makes clouds completely transparent.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.altitude] = Altitude
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.altitude] = Sets the altitude of the distance clouds in meters. This value is used to calculate the sun light attenuation.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.tint] = Tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.tint] = Sets a tint to the distance clouds.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.exposure] = Exposure
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.exposure] = Sets the exposure compensation of the clouds in EV relative to the sun light.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.rotation] = Rotation
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.rotation] = Sets the angle in degrees to rotate the distance clouds.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.thickness] = Density
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.thickness] = Sets the density of the distance clouds.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityR] = Cumulus clouds opacity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityR] = Sets the opacity of the cumulus distance cloud layer.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityG] = Stratus clouds opacity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityG] = Sets the opacity of the stratus distance cloud layer.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityB] = Cirrus clouds opacity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityB] = Sets the opacity of the cirrus distance cloud layer.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityA] = Wispy clouds opacity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[CloudLayer.layerA.opacityA] = Sets the opacity of the wispy distance cloud layer.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.densityMultiplier] = Density
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.densityMultiplier] = Controls the global density of the cloud volume.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.shapeFactor] = Shape factor
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.shapeFactor] = Controls the larger noise passing through the cloud coverage. A higher value will yield less cloud coverage and smaller clouds.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.shapeScale] = Shape scale
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.shapeScale] = Controls the size of the larger noise passing through the cloud coverage.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset] = Shape offset
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset] = Controls the world space offset applied when evaluating the larger noise passing through the cloud coverage.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.erosionFactor] = Erosion factor
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.erosionFactor] = Controls the smaller noise on the edge of the clouds. A higher value will erode clouds more significantly.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.erosionScale] = Erosion scale
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.erosionScale] = Controls the size of the smaller noise passing through the cloud coverage.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.erosionNoiseType] = Erosion noise type
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.erosionNoiseType] = Controls the type of noise used to generate the smaller noise passing through the cloud coverage.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.bottomAltitude] = Bottom altitude
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.bottomAltitude] = Controls the altitude of the bottom of the volumetric clouds volume in meters.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.altitudeRange] = Altitude range
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.altitudeRange] = Controls the size of the volumetric clouds volume in meters.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.numPrimarySteps] = Number of primary steps
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.numPrimarySteps] = Controls the number of steps when evaluating the clouds' transmittance. A higher value results in a lower noise level and longer view distances.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.numLightSteps] = Number of light steps
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.numLightSteps] = Controls the number of steps when evaluating the clouds' lighting. A higher value will lead to smoother lighting and improved self-shadowing.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.sunLightDimmer] = Sunlight dimmer
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.sunLightDimmer] = Controls the influence of the sun light on the cloud volume. A lower value will suppress the sun light and produce darker clouds overall.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.erosionOcclusion] = Erosion occlusion
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.erosionOcclusion] = Controls how much erosion factor is taken into account when computing ambient occlusion.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.scatteringTint] = Scattering tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.scatteringTint] = Specifies the tint of the cloud scattering color.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.powderEffectIntensity] = Powder effect intensity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.powderEffectIntensity] = Controls the amount of local scattering in the clouds. A higher value may produce a more powdery or diffused aspect.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.multiScattering] = Multi scattering
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.multiScattering] = Controls the amount of multi-scattering inside the cloud.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.shadowOpacity] = Shadows opacity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.shadowOpacity] = Controls the opacity of the volumetric clouds shadow.
PhotoMode.CLOUDEROSIONNOISE[Worley32] = Worley
PhotoMode.CLOUDEROSIONNOISE[Perlin32] = Perlin
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.meanFreePath] = Attenuation distance
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.meanFreePath] = Controls the density at the base of the fog and determines how far you can see through the fog in meters. At this distance, the fog has absorbed and out-scattered 63% of background light.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.baseHeight] = Base height
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.baseHeight] = Sets the height of the boundary between the constant (homogeneous) fog and the exponential fog.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.maximumHeight] = Maximum height
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.maximumHeight] = Controls the rate of falloff for the height fog in meters. Higher values stretch the fog vertically. At this height , the falloff reduces the initial base density by 63%.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.maxFogDistance] = Maximum fog distance
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.maxFogDistance] = Controls the distance in meters.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.tint] = Tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.tint] = Sets a multiplier for the sky color.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.albedo] = Volumetric fog albedo
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.albedo] = Sets the color of the volumetric fog.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.depthExtent] = Volumetric fog distance
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.depthExtent] = Controls the distance in meters at which the volumetric fog section of the frustum ends.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[Fog.anisotropy] = Volumetric fog anisotropy
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[Fog.anisotropy] = Controls the angular distribution of scattered light. 0 is isotropic, 1 is forward scattering, and -1 is backward scattering.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.auroraBorealisEmissionMultiplier] = Aurora intensity
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.auroraBorealisEmissionMultiplier] = Controls the intensity of aurora borealis.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.airMaximumAltitude] = Maximum air altitude
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.airMaximumAltitude] = Sets the depth in meters of the atmospheric layer, from sea level, composed of air particles. This controls the rate of height-based density falloff. 
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.airDensityR] = Air density (Red)
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.airDensityR] = Sets the red color channel opacity of air at the point in the sky directly above the observer (zenith). This directly affects the color of air at the zenith.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.airDensityG] = Air density (Green)
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.airDensityG] = Sets the green color channel opacity of air at the point in the sky directly above the observer (zenith). This directly affects the color of air at the zenith.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.airDensityB] = Air density (Blue)
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.airDensityB] = Sets the blue color channel opacity of air at the point in the sky directly above the observer (zenith). This directly affects the color of air at the zenith.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.airTint] = Air tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.airTint] = Controls the single scattering albedo of air molecules (per color channel). A value of 0 results in absorbing molecules, and a value of 1 results in scattering ones.\r\n
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolMaximumAltitude] = Maximum aerosol altitude
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolMaximumAltitude] = Sets the depth in meters of the atmospheric layer, from sea level, composed of aerosol particles. This controls the rate of height-based density falloff.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolDensity] = Aerosol density
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolDensity] = Sets the opacity of aerosols at the point in the sky directly above the observer (zenith). This directly affects the color of aerosols at the zenith.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolTint] = Aerosol tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolTint] = Controls the single scattering albedo of aerosol molecules (per color channel). A value of 0 results in absorbing molecules, and a value of 1 results in scattering ones.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolAnisotropy] = Aerosol anisotropy
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.aerosolAnisotropy] = Specifies the direction of anisotropy:\r\n Set this value to 1 for forward scattering.\r\n Set this value to 0 to make the anisotropy almost isotropic.\r\n Set this value to -1 for backward scattering.\r\nFor high values of anisotropy:\r\n If the light path and view direction are aligned, you see a bright atmosphere/fog effect.\r\n If they are not aligned, you see a dim atmosphere/fog effect.\r\n If anisotropy is 0, the atmosphere and fog look similar regardless of view direction.\r\n
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.colorSaturation] = Color saturation
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.colorSaturation] = Controls the saturation of the color of the sky.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.alphaSaturation] = Alpha saturation
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.alphaSaturation] = Controls the saturation of the opacity of the sky.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.alphaMultiplier] = Alpha multiplier
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.alphaMultiplier] = Sets a multiplier to the opacity of the sky.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.horizonTint] = Horizon tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.horizonTint] = Specifies a color used to tint the sky at the horizon.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.horizonZenithShift] = Horizon Zenith shift
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.horizonZenithShift] = Controls how the blends between the horizon tint and zenith tint is performed. For a value of -1, the zenith tint expands down to the horizon. For a value of 1, the horizon tint expands up to the zenith.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[PhysicallyBasedSky.zenithTint] = Zenith tint
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[PhysicallyBasedSky.zenithTint] = Specifies a color used to tint the point in the sky directly above the observer (the zenith).\r\n
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset/x] = X offset
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset/x] = Controls the world space X component offset applied when evaluating the larger noise passing through the cloud coverage.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset/y] = Y offset
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset/y] = Controls the world space Y component offset applied when evaluating the larger noise passing through the cloud coverage.
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TITLE[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset/z] = Z offset
PhotoMode.PROPERTY_TOOLTIP[VolumetricClouds.shapeOffset/z] = Controls the world space Z component offset applied when evaluating the larger noise passing through the cloud coverage.

PhotoMode.TAKE_PHOTO = Take Photo
PhotoMode.HIDE_UI = Hide UI

PhotoMode.TOGGLE_ORBIT_MODE = Toggle Orbit Mode
CinematicCamera.LOOP = Loop
PhotoMode.TOGGLE_FIRST_PERSON_MODE = Toggle First Person Mode
CinematicCamera.SEGMENT_DURATION = Segment Duration
Policy.TITLE[Out of Service] = Out of Service
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Out of Service] = The building becomes non-operational. Only maintenance personnel visit the building anymore, so upkeep cost, electricity and water consumption drop to a very low level.
Policy.TITLE[Lot Parking Fee] = Parking Fee
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Lot Parking Fee] = A fee is charged for parking on this lot. The cost of parking can be adjusted with the slider.
Policy.TITLE[Advanced Pollution Management] = Advanced Pollution Management
Policy.TITLE[Recreational Use] = Recreational Use
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Recreational Use] = Increases the city attractiveness for adult tourists and increases the well-being of the residents in the affected area. 
Policy.TITLE[Fire Safety Sprinkler System] = Fire Safety Sprinkler System
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Fire Safety Sprinkler System] = Reduces the fire hazard of buildings in the affected area, but increases the level up cost.
Policy.TITLE[Recycling] = Recycling
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Recycling] = Citizens in the area are encouraged to recycle. This will reduce the amount of used resources but decreases free time.
Policy.TITLE[Roadside Parking Fee] = Roadside Parking Fee
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Roadside Parking Fee] = A fee is charged for parking on the roadside. The cost of parking can be adjusted with the slider.
Policy.TITLE[Small Business Enthusiast] = Small Business Enthusiast
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Small Business Enthusiast] = Slightly reduces the tax paid by Low Density Businesses within the district.
Policy.TITLE[Speed Bumps] = Speed Bumps
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Speed Bumps] = Reduces the speed of vehicles driving within the district. This lowers the chance of accidents and brings noise pollution down significantly.
Policy.TITLE[Combustion Engine Ban] = Combustion Engine Ban
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Combustion Engine Ban] = Fuel burning vehicles are forbidden from entering unless they belong to district residents or businesses. This reduces noise and air pollution within the district. 
Policy.TITLE[Heavy Traffic Ban] = Heavy Traffic Ban
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Heavy Traffic Ban] = Trucks and other heavy vehicles are forbidden from entering the district. This reduces noise and air pollution and can help traffic congestion. Highways remain unaffected.
Policy.TITLE[Gated Community] = Gated Community
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Gated Community] = Only people living or working within the district are allowed in. This increases the well-being of its residents and reduces crime in the area. Does not affect City Services.
Policy.TITLE[High-Speed Highways] = High-Speed Highways
Policy.DESCRIPTION[High-Speed Highways] = Removes highway speed limits. Traffic flows faster, but noise pollution increases, and traffic accidents are slightly more likely.
Policy.TITLE[Energy Consumption Awareness] = Energy Consumption Awareness
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Energy Consumption Awareness] = Citizens are advised to pay attention to their use of electronic devices. Electricity consumption is reduced by 5%.
Policy.TITLE[Route Vehicle Count] = Vehicles
Policy.TITLE[Route Ticket Price] = Ticket price
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Route Ticket Price] = Modify the line's ticket price.
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Advanced Pollution Management] = Industrial filters reduce air and ground pollution in industrial zones, but produce more garbage.
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Route Vehicle Count] = Modify the number of vehicles on the line.\r\nNote that it takes a while for the new vehicles to be prepared in the depot before they are sent out.
Policy.TITLE[PreRelease Programs] = Pre-Release Programs
Policy.DESCRIPTION[PreRelease Programs] = Prisoners are enrolled in educational programs before they are released from prison. This helps them integrate back into society and reduces the likelihood of committing crimes again.
Policy.TITLE[Taxi Starting Fee] = Taxi Minimum Fare
Policy.DESCRIPTION[Taxi Starting Fee] = A minimum charge is applied for each taxi ride. This is added to the fare based on the actual distance traveled. 
Policy.TITLE[City Promotion] = City Promotion
Policy.DESCRIPTION[City Promotion] = Advertising increases the city's Attractiveness, which brings in more tourists. This unfortunately also increases the crime rate around tourist attractions.

Progression.NODE_DESCRIPTION[ParkingAreasNode] = Cars need parking spaces, and areas of high activity can benefit from dedicated parking areas.

Progression.NODE_DESCRIPTION[AutomatedParkingBuildingNode] = An automated parking garage that uses elevators to lift and stack vehicles in small slots on top of each other. This saves plenty of street level space.

Services.DESCRIPTION[Communications] = Post offices, mail delivery, mobile networks and wireless broadband all fall under the Communications services.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Districts] = City Districts are defined areas inside the city that can have specific policies, architectural styles and city services assigned to them.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Education & Research] = Schools, colleges and universities that provide education and prepare citizens for different jobs, and research facilities that make progress easier.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Electricity] = Electricity can be produced in various ways and distributed throughout the city with different means.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Fire & Rescue] = Fires, accidents and natural disasters are all handled by the Fire & Rescue services.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Garbage Management] = Waste produced by the citizens is collected, stored and processed by the Garbage Management service.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Health & Deathcare] = Healthcare services keep citizens healthier by preventing disease and by treating the sick and injured. Deathcare services handle citizens who have passed on.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Landscaping] = The ground can be shaped and formed, vegetation and decorations added and pedestrian traffic options built with Landscaping tools.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Parks & Recreation] = Recreational areas and facilities make the city a more pleasant place to live in.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Police & Administration] = The Police enforce the law and apprehend criminals, while Administration handles the courts, banking and welfare.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Transportation] = Moving passengers and cargo by land, sea or air are all covered by the Transportation services.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Water & Sewage] = Buildings and pipes to pump and deliver fresh water to the city and remove sewage.
Services.DESCRIPTION[Zones] = Zoning determines what kinds of buildings are allowed to be built and where. Zones can be assigned next to roads, and they are divided into different types.
Services.NAME[Signatures] = Signature Buildings
Services.DESCRIPTION[Signatures] = Signature buildings are special unique buildings that grant XP awards and provide various benefits to their surroundings.
SubServices.NAME[SignaturesCommercial] = Commercial Signature Buildings
SubServices.NAME[SignaturesIndustrial] = Industrial Signature Buildings
SubServices.NAME[SignaturesResidential] = Residential Signature Buildings
SubServices.NAME[SignaturesOffice] = Office Signature Buildings
SubServices.NAME[SignaturesLandmarks] = Landmarks
SubServices.NAME[RoadsIntersections] = Intersections
SubServices.NAME[RoadsRoundabouts] = Roundabouts
SubServices.NAME[RoadsParking] = Parking Spaces
Services.NAME[Areas] = Areas
Services.DESCRIPTION[Areas] = Tools to define Districts and Specialized Industry areas.
SubServices.NAME[SignaturesResidentialMixed] = Mixed Residential Signature Buildings

SubServices.NAME[SportsParks] = Sports Parks
SubServices.NAME[LargeSportsParks] = Large Sports Parks
SubServices.NAME[TouristAttractions] = Tourist Attractions
UpgradesMenu.TITLE = Upgrades
SubServices.NAME[Areas] = Areas
Services.DESCRIPTION[Roads] = Roads are the main city infrastructure. Most of them come with underground utility networks that handle electricity, water and sewage.
