Infoviews.PARKING_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Available parking spots across all parking buildings and parking lots in the city and the combined income from parking fees. \r\nWithout available parking spaces, citizens are forced to park by the roadside, potentially far away from their destination.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[ParkingFacility Buildings] = Parking lots and parking buildings are used by citizens to park their vehicles as they go about their daily activities. Parking fees for the lots and buildings are adjustable.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[MaintenanceDepot Buildings] = **Maintenance Depots** function as the base of operations for Road Maintenance Vehicles. The vehicles visit their depots to restock and refuel between every work shift.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Road Maintenance Vehicles] = Road Maintenance Vehicles currently operating in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Road Condition] = Traffic and weather make road surfaces deteriorate over time. Lowered road condition forces traffic to slow down and increases the chance of road accidents.
Infoviews.TRAFFIC_FLOW = Traffic flow indicates how well the current road network serves the needs of traffic on average across the whole city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Traffic Flow] = Traffic flow indicates how well vehicles are able to get around. Road segments with bad flow are places where vehicles are forced to **slow down** and the likelihood of **traffic jams** is high. These locations require larger roads or additional road connections.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Traffic Volume] = Traffic volume indicates the number of vehicles using the roads. Upgrading heavily used, high volume roads to larger ones and adding new arterial and collector roads helps traffic flow smoother.
Infoviews.ELECTRICITY_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Electricity currently produced and consumed in the city. When consumption is higher than production, power outages will occur.\r\nThe current **air temperature**, **electricity fees** and some **policies** affect the amount of electricity consumption.
Infoviews.ELECTRICITY_TRADE_TOOLTIP = The amount of electricity currently being **imported** or **exported**. When there is a deficit in local electricity production, the city needs to purchase electricity from neighboring cities. When local production is at a surplus, it is sold to neighboring cities for profit.
Infoviews.BATTERY_CHARGE_TOOLTIP = The total amount of electricity currently stored in the batteries of the city's power plants. Batteries are used as backup sources when electricity generation gets halted for whatever reason.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Battery Buildings] = Batteries store electricity for later use. They get charged as power plants generate electricity, and will feed the electric grid when electricity production falls below demand.
Infoviews.ELECTRICITY_TRANSMISSION_TOOLTIP = The percentage of available electricity that reaches consumers. Rates below 100% indicate a bottleneck in the power grid. Such spots in the network can be circumvented by building **Transformers** in the affected area and connecting them to a power plant with a **Power Line**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Powerplant Buildings] = Power plants produce electricity and feed the citys electricity grid with high voltage **Power Lines** that connect to **Transformers** and with low voltage **Electric Cables** that connect directly to the road infrastructure.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Transformer Buildings] = **Transformers** convert the high voltage current, which is carried by **Power Lines**, into low voltage current that is usable by buildings. Transformers can be used to circumvent potential electricity bottlenecks by routing power directly from power plants to the affected area.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[HighVoltage Flow] = High voltage electricity is generated by power plants and carried over high voltage **Power Lines**, which have a high transfer capacity.\r\nThe higher the flow, the closer a **Power Line** is to its maximum electricity transfer capacity. If demand increases, a bottleneck may form in the electric grid at such places.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[LowVoltage Flow] = Low voltage electricity is fed into the electric grid by power plants directly or via **Transformers** and is usable by buildings. It is carried over low voltage **Electric Cables**, most of which are built into roads.\r\nThe higher the flow, the closer an **Electric Cable** is to its maximum electricity transfer capacity. If demand increases, a bottleneck may form in the electric grid at such places.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Electricity Consumption] = The electricity consumption of a building is determined based on its size and function and, in the case of zoned buildings, its **level**. Higher level buildings consume less electricity.
Infoviews.WATER_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Fresh water currently pumped and consumed in the city. The lack of fresh water affects citizen **well-being** and company **efficiency**.
Infoviews.WATER_TRADE_TOOLTIP = The amount of water currently being **imported** or **exported**. When there is a deficit in local water production, the city needs to purchase water from neighboring cities. When the local production is at a surplus, it is sold to neighboring cities for profit.
Infoviews.SEWAGE_TREATMENT_TOOLTIP = Sewage currently generated and processed in the city. If sewage generation exceeds the processing rate, raw sewage starts backing up in the pipes, which will cause **health** issues for citizens.
Infoviews.SEWAGE_TRADE_TOOLTIP = The amount of sewage currently being sent out of the city for processing. Buying sewage services from other cities incurs a cost.
Infoviews.WATER_STORAGE_TOOLTIP = Fresh water can be stored for use during a water shortage. **Households**, **businesses** and **city services** can function normally using stored water as long as the storages last.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[FreshWater Buildings] = Access to fresh water is important for both **households** everyday life as well as the for the operating of **businesses** and **city services**. \r\nFresh water facilities pump water out of water sources and into the citys water pipe network. \r\nIf a water source is **polluted**, and the contaminated water is pumped into the network, citizens will become **sick**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Sewage Buildings] = Sewage facilities process **sewage** and release it back into the environment. \r\nCertain facilities are able to purify sewage to some extent, making it less **polluted** before it exits the sewer network. \r\nSewage facilities should be placed away from fresh water facilities to avoid contaminating fresh water sources.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Waterpipe Flow] = The water network consists of pipes built underground, connecting buildings to fresh water and sewage facilities. Most water and sewage pipes are integrated into roads, but pipes can also be built separately to connect distant locations or facilities to the network.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[WaterFlowInfomode] = Surface water flows downstream and mixes with areas of still water. \r\nCurrents can carry polluted water a great distance. As **water pollution** spreads, it also dilutes and eventually disappears by mixing in with fresh water.
Infoviews.HEALTHCARE_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Availability of medical treatment and the number of **sick** and **injured** in the city, with the average health across all citizens as well as the number of citizens currently receiving inpatient care. \r\nProviding sufficient healthcare improves citizens' lives and allows them to return to work faster after being sick or injured.
Infoviews.CREMATORIUM_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Availability of crematoriums and the current monthly **death rate**. \r\nCrematoriums require time to handle the deceased, and if the death rate is higher than available capacity, hearses are unable to pick up all of the bodies.
Infoviews.CEMETERY_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Availability of cemetery space. \r\nCemeteries only have a limited number of burial plots, and once they are all filled, a new cemetery or other deathcare facility needs to be built.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Hospital Buildings] = **Medical Clinics** and **Hospitals** provide overall health benefits to their surroundings and emergency medical services to the **sick** and **injured**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Deathcare Buildings] = Deathcare provides citizens their final resting place. The **Cemetery** offers a place for the living to visit those who have passed.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Ambulance Vehicles] = Ambulances transport **sick** and **injured** citizens. One ambulance can transport a single citizen at a time.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Hearse Vehicles] = Hearses transport **deceased** citizens. One hearse can transport a single deceased person at a time.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Health] = Citizens' **health** affects their **happiness**, which in turn affects their work **efficiency** and other behavior. \r\nAreas with bad health indicate the citizens living there dont have sufficient access to healthcare services. \r\nProviding adequate healthcare services and controlling air, ground and water pollution are ways to improve citizen health.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Healthcare Coverage] = Healthcare Coverage represents the areas reached by the passive benefits of healthcare facilities. Living in the vicinity of a medical facility boosts citizens **health**. \r\nHealthcare Coverage also roughly indicates the optimal operational area of healthcare vehicles.
Infoviews.GARBAGE_PROCESSING_STATUS_TOOLTIP = Garbage generated and processed in the city. If the generation rate is higher than the processing rate, Garbage Trucks can't collect all of the garbage from the city. Garbage piling up causes citizens' **health** to decrease.
Infoviews.LANDFILL_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Landfills have a limited capacity to store garbage. Once the capacity is full, the Landfill's **area** needs to be increased or a new **Landfill** to be built. \r\nGarbage in one facility can also be **transferred** to other garbage facilities for processing by opening the facility's info panel and selecting the emptying function on the bottom of the panel.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Garbage Buildings] = Garbage facilities collect, store and process **garbage**. Garbage storing and processing generates **ground** and **air pollution**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Garbage Truck Vehicles] = Garbage Trucks collect garbage from **households**, **companies** and **city service** buildings.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Garbage Accumulation] = Most buildings generate **garbage**. The accumulation is affected by the buildings **zone** type and **level**, its residents **education level**, and the size of the building. **City services** also generate varying amounts of garbage depending on their type.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_FIRE_HAZARD_TOOLTIP = The average likelihood of a **building** or **forest fire** breaking out. The fire hazard can be lowered by building Fire & Rescue facilities such as **Fire Stations** and **Firewatch Towers** around the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[FireStation Buildings] = **Fire Houses** and **Fire Stations** provide overall fire safety benefits to their surroundings. They also send out Fire Engines and Firefighting Helicopters to respond to **building** and **forest fires** and other **disasters**. The **Firefighting Helicopter Depot** houses additional Firefighting Helicopters.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[FirewatchTower Buildings] = **Firewatch Towers** lower the **forest fire hazard** in their vicinity. They also spot forest fires early and thus allow the fire department to respond quickly.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Fire Engine Vehicles] = Fire Engines currently operating in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Firewatch Range] = The range within which **Firewatch Towers** decrease the **forest fire hazard** and detect starting forest fires.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[FireHazard] = **Fire hazard** indicates how likely it is for a **building** or **forest fire** to start. Areas with a high fire hazard are not in effective reach of Fire & Rescue services.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[FireRescue Coverage] = Fire & Rescue Coverage represents the areas reached by the passive fire safety benefits provided by Fire & Rescue facilities. **Fire hazard** is decreased in the vicinity of the facilities.\r\nFire & Rescue Coverage also roughly indicates the optimal operational area of Fire & Rescue vehicles.
Infoviews.SHELTER_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Free shelter space in **Emergency Shelters** and the number of currently sheltered citizens. \r\nWhen shelters are full, the rest of the citizens flee the impending disaster any way they can.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[DisasterFacility Buildings] = The **Early Disaster Warning System** detects approaching **natural disasters** and gives citizens time to prepare and evacuate.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[EmergencyShelter Buildings] = **Emergency Shelters** provide safety for citizens during **natural disasters**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[EmergencyShelter Coverage] = Emergency Shelter Coverage represents the area from which citizens can easily travel or be evacuated and transported to the shelters.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Destroyed] = An **abandoned** building will eventually **collapse** due to no one paying for the building's upkeep costs. A building can also be **destroyed** by a **building fire**, or a **natural disaster** such as a tornado. When a building becomes damaged enough, it collapses. A collapsed building is destroyed and cannot be repaired. It will be demolished in time, or it can be bulldozed manually for immedate removal.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Damage] = A building can become **damaged** due to **natural disasters** and certain **weather conditions**. Hail storms cause minor physical damage, while a tornado can destroy entire buildings as it passes by. **Building fires** can also lead to a building being destroyed if the fire is not put out quickly enough. Damaged buildings are repaired with the rent money paid by the building occupants.
Infoviews.JAIL_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Jails are short term holding cells where the police house **criminals** awaiting sentencing. \r\nDepending on the crime, the criminal is either let go after a while or sent to prison.
Infoviews.PRISON_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Prisons are long term holding facilities for **criminals** serving their sentences. If prison capacity is full, prisoners are sent outside of the city to serve their sentences. \r\nAfter their prison sentence is served, they may return to live in the city.
Infoviews.CRIME_PROBABILITY_TOOLTIP = The average likelihood of a building becoming a target for criminal activity.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[PoliceStation Buildings] = **Police Stations** and **Police Headquarters** provide overall safety benefits to their surroundings. They also send out Police Cars to patrol the city and respond to **criminal activity**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Prison Buildings] = **Prisons** house **criminals** who have been sentenced to serve time. At the end of their sentence, the **citizen** is released and their criminal status is removed. 
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Police Car Vehicles] = Police Cars patrol the city. They decrease **crime probability** in the buildings they drive by, and respond to ongoing **criminal activity**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Prisoner Transport Vehicles] = Prison Vans transport **prisoners** from police buildings to **Prisons**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Crime Probability] = Crime probability indicates how tempting a target a building is for **criminal activity**. Police Coverage and Police Car patrols decrease crime probability. \r\nWhen planning a crime, criminals will more likely choose a building that seems like a good target.\r\nCitizens with low **well-being** are more likely to turn to a life of crime.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Police Coverage] = Police Coverage represents the area reached by the passive safety benefits provided by police facilities. **Crime probability** is decreased in the vicinity of these facilities.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Admin Buildings] = Administrative buildings have a positive effect on **resource trade** by decreasing **import fees** and increasing **export profits**. They also decrease **loan interest rates**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Wellbeing] = A citizen's **well-being** affects their **happiness**, which in turn affects their **work efficiency** and other behavior. \r\nWell-being is lowered when a citizen does not have sufficient access to **leisure** activities or **city services**, or when they feel unsafe due to increased **crime probability** in their neighborhood. Low well-being can also result in citizens becoming **criminals**. \r\nProviding **city services**, **shopping opportunities** and other **leisure activities** as well as safety are ways to improve citizen well-being.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[WelfareOffice Buildings] = **Welfare Offices** increase the **well-being** of citizens whose **happiness** is low. They also decrease the chance of citizens committing **crimes**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Welfare Coverage] = Welfare Coverage represents the area reached by the passive welfare benefits and increased citizen **well-being** provided by the **Welfare Offices**.
Infoviews.ELEMENTARY_SCHOOL_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = The overall student capacity of **Elementary Schools** and the number of eligible students in the city. \r\n**Children** study in elementary schools.
Infoviews.HIGH_SCHOOL_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = The overall student capacity of **High Schools** and the number of eligible students in the city. \r\n**Teens** study in high schools.
Infoviews.COLLEGE_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = The overall student capacity of **Colleges** and the number of eligible students in the city. \r\n**Teens** and **adults** study in colleges.
Infoviews.UNIVERSITY_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = The overall student capacity of **Universities** and the number of eligible students in the city. \r\n**Adults** study in universities.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Education] = Citizen **education** affects their **employment** opportunities and their **consumption** habits. Higher education level allows citizens to seek jobs that pay higher wages. Higher educated citizens also consume less water and electricity and produce less garbage.
Infoviews.EDUCATION_DISTRIBUTION_TOOLTIP = Education levels of all citizens across the city. 
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Education Buildings] = Schools provide citizens with **education**. Different school types are aimed at citizens of different age groups, and each provides one level of education.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[ResearchFacility Buildings] = Research facilities increase students' graduation chances from higher level schools. They also improve **natural resource** yields and industrial and office buildings' **efficiency**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[TransportStation Buildings] = Public transport stations include both **passenger** and **cargo stations**. These stations serve a large number of passengers and handle high quantities of cargo, and some can be upgraded to connect with other types of public transport.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[TransportDepot Buildings] = Public Transport Depots house the various transport vehicles and handle their refueling and maintenance. Transport lines cannot function without their depots. 
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Taxi Stands] = Taxis pick up passengers at **Taxi Stands** and **Taxi Stops**, and can transport citizens anywhere within the city as well as to Outside Connections.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Bus Stops] = **Bus Stops** are the main elements of a **Bus Line**. Buses travel from one stop to the next, picking up and dropping off **passengers** along the way. Multiple lines can use the same stops.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Train Stops] = **Train Stations** and **Cargo Train Terminals** function as stops for **Railway Lines**. Multiple lines can use the same stations. \r\nPassenger trains stop at **Train Stations**, while cargo trains stop at **Cargo Train Terminals**.\r\n**Railway Lines** also require a connection to a **Rail Yard** in order to function.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Tram Stops] = **Tram Stops** are the main elements of a **Tram Line**. Trams travel from one stop to the next, picking up and dropping off **passengers** along the way. Multiple lines can use the same stops. \r\n**Tram Lines** also require a connection to a **Tram Depot** in order to function.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Subway Stops] = **Subway Stations** function as stops for **Subway Lines**. Multiple lines can use the same stations. \r\n**Subway Lines** also require a connection to a **Subway Yard** in order to function.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Ship Stops] = Harbors are the main elements of **Passenger Ship Lines** and **Cargo Ship Routes**. Ships travel between ship piers and Outside Connections, picking up and dropping off **passengers** and **cargo**. Multiple lines can use the same piers.\r\n**Harbors** function as stops for **Passenger Ship Lines**, while **Cargo Harbors** function as stops for **Cargo Ship Routes**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Airplane Stops] = **Airports** are the basis for both **Passenger Airplane Lines** and **Cargo Airplane Routes**. Airplanes travel between airport terminals  and Outside Connections, picking up and dropping off **passengers** and **cargo**. Multiple lines can use the same terminals.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Passenger Transport Vehicles] = Public transport vehicles currently operating in the city. \r\nSelecting an individual vehicle opens its **info panel**, which displays information related to the vehicle and the line it is operating on.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Cargo Transport Vehicles] = Cargo transport vehicles currently operating in the city.\r\nSelecting an individual vehicle opens its **info panel**, which displays information related to the vehicle and the line it is operating on.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Taxi Vehicles] = Taxis currently operating in the city. \r\nTaxis are a flexible way to travel within the city and to Outside Connections, as they do not require transport lines to operate, and carry their passengers directly to their destination.\r\nSelecting an individual vehicle opens its **info panel**, which displays information related to the vehicle and the line it is operating on.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Transport Lines] = Public transport lines and cargo routes currently active in the city. Selecting a line on the map opens its **info panel**, which displays additional information.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Roads] = Roads allow **private vehicles**, **cargo vehicles**, **buses** and **taxis** to travel within the city and to and from Outside Connections. Additional Outside Connections can be created by building a road that is connected to the edge of the map.\r\nRoads within the city can be upgraded with **Tram Tracks** to enable tram traffic.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Train Tracks] = **Train Tracks** allow Passenger Trains and Cargo Trains to travel within the city and to and from Outside Connections. Additional Outside Connections can be created by building **Train Tracks** that are connected to the edge of the map.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Tram Tracks] = **Tram Tracks** allow Trams to travel within the city. **Tram Tracks** can be built on the ground or onto existing **roads**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Subway Tracks] = **Subway Tracks** allow Subway Trains to travel within the city. **Subway Tracks** can be built underground as well as on the ground.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Waterways] = **Seaways** allow Passenger Ships and Cargo Ships to travel within the city and to and from Outside Connections. Additional Outside Connections can be created by building a **Seaway** that is connected to the edge of the map.
Infoviews.MAIL_SERVICE_AVAILABILITY_TOOLTIP = Mail currently being sent and processed in the city. \r\nIf the processing capacity of post facilities is lower than the amount of mail sent, mail is left uncollected for long periods of time. This in turn negatively affects citizens' **well-being** and companies' operational **efficiency**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[PostFacility Buildings] = Post facilities sort and distribute **mail**. \r\n**Post Offices** collect mail from companies with Post Vans and from citizens via **Mail Boxes**. \r\nCollected mail is transported to a local **Post Sorting Facility** to be processed and then delivered locally or forwarded globally via Outside Connections. \r\nIf there is no local **Post Sorting Facility**, all unsorted mail is transported to Outside Connections. Mail transported in from Outside Connections is always sorted and ready to be delivered locally to citizens and companies.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Post Van Vehicles] = Post Vans collect **mail** from companies and **Mail Boxes** and deliver it to the **Post Office**. \r\nPost Trucks transport large quantities of mail between the **Post Office** and the **Post Sorting Facility** and Outside Connections.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Mail Boxes] = Citizens take their mail to **Mail Boxes** or, if they are full, directly to the **Post Office**. Post Vans collect mail from the **Mail Boxes** and deliver it to the Post Office for processing.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Mail Accumulation] = **Companies**, **city services** and **citizens** send and receive **mail**. Businesses, especially commercial and office companies, send and receive more mail than private citizens.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[PostService Coverage] = Post Service Coverage indicates the approximate area where Post Vans operate, collecting **mail** from companies and **Mail Boxes**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[TelecomFacility Buildings] = Telecom facilities provide the city with cellular and wireless **network coverage**, increasing citizen **well-being** and company sales and decreasing material costs for manufacturing. Telecom facilities also work as emergency alert systems, notifying citizens of impending **disasters**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Network Quality] = Network quality is determined by signal strength. When the number of citizens within the Telecom Coverage area increases, more **network capacity** gets used. As the network load increases, the signal's reach at maximum strength decreases.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[TelecomCoverageInfomode] = Telecom Coverage indicates how far the telecom signal reaches and how many households and companies enjoy the passive benefits to **well-being** and company profitability respectively. The more citizens and workers there are within the telecom facilities reach, the quicker the network capacity is used up.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[ParkMaintenance Buildings] = **Park Maintenance Depots** function as the base of operations for Park Maintenance Vehicles. The vehicles visit their depots after every shift to restock and refuel before returning back to work.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Park Buildings] = **Parks** and **Tourist Attractions** provide **leisure** activity options for citizens and grant passive **leisure** bonuses to their surroundings. They also increase the city's **attractiveness**, which draws in **tourists**. Tourists also visit the various parks and attractions while staying in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Park Maintenance Vehicles] = Park Maintenance Vehicles operating in the city. They keep parks and leisure facilities clean and in running order.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[LeisureProvider] = Citizens **well-being** is increased, among other things, by **leisure** activities. Citizens spend time shopping, in parks and at sports venues and city attractions to fulfill their leisure needs.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Park Coverage] = Parks and other recreation buildings provide passive **leisure** benefits to their surroundings. Leisure increases the **well-being** of the citizens who live close to a park or another recreation building.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Signature Buildings] = **Signature Buildings** are special buildings that provide different benefits. Most signature buildings are larger than their regular zoned counterparts, and are unlocked by fulfilling special requirements.
Infoviews.CITY_ATTRACTIVENESS_TOOLTIP = City attractiveness is a measurement of how **tourists** view the city as a potential travel destination. The more attractive the city, the more tourists are drawn to it.\r\nThe seasons also affect tourism, so the number of visitors will vary according to the weather from one time of the year to another.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Hotels] = Tourists live in hotels when staying overnight in the city. When deciding on the **leisure** locations to visit, the distance from their hotel is one determining factor.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[AttractivenessInfomode] = Tourists visit **leisure** destinations while staying in the city. They choose their leisure activities based on how far the destination is from their hotel and how high its **attractiveness** value is. A destination with a high enough attractiveness value can thus be chosen even if it is further away.\r\n\r\nParks and recreation buildings, sports venues and other city attractions increase the citys overall attractiveness. Each buildings attractiveness value also affects where tourists go while staying in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Tourists] = Tourists seek **leisure** activities while in the city. These are found in places such as shops, parks, sports venues and landmarks.\r\nTourists require accommodations such as hotels if they are staying longer than a day. 
Infoviews.IMPORT_DISTRIBUTION_TOOLTIP = Businesses import **products** and **resources** that are not manufactured or produced locally. Importing costs make manufacturing **products** more expensive.
Infoviews.EXPORT_DISTRIBUTION_TOOLTIP = Businesses export **products** and **resources** that are not in high enough demand in the city. The cost of transportation is deducted from company profits.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Road Outside Connections] = Roads carry **citizens**, **tourists** and **resources** to and from the city. Citizens and tourists travel in their own personal vehicles or use public transportation. Resources are transported on Semi Trucks.\r\n\r\n**City service trade** also uses road connections, since Ambulances, Fire Engines and other service vehicles travel into the city from Outside Connections.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Train Outside Connections] = Trains use railways to transport **citizens**, **tourists** and **resources** to and from the city.\r\n\r\nTrains can transport a great number of passengers and large amounts of resources, and can thus alleviate potential traffic congestion caused by road transport.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Ship Outside Connections] = Ships use waterways to transport **citizens**, **tourists** and **resources** to and from the city.\r\n\r\nShips can transport a great number of passengers and large amounts of resources, and can thus alleviate potential traffic congestions caused by road transport.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Airplane Outside Connections] = Airplanes transport **citizens**, **tourists** and **resources** to and from the city.\r\n\r\nAirplanes can transport a great number of passengers and large amounts of resources, and thus can alleviate potential traffic congestion caused by road transport.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Electricity Outside Connections] = **Power Lines** and roads with built-in cabling can transfer electricity between the city and the Outside Connections, enabling electricity trade.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Water Pipe Outside Connections] = **Water Pipes** and **Sewage Pipes** and roads with built-in pipes can carry fresh water and sewage between the city and the Outside Connections, enabling water and sewage trade.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Residential Buildings] = Residential buildings are divided into **single-household** and **multi-household** buildings. Detached and row houses have one household each, while apartment buildings contain multiple households. \r\nSingle household buildings generate less traffic, but are strongly affected by high **land value**, since the building upkeep cost falls on one family. \r\nLarge apartment buildings generate more traffic and **noise pollution**, but are less affected by high land value, since the building upkeep cost is divided between all the households in the building.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Residential Suitability] = Residential Suitability indicates generally good areas for residential zones in terms of **workplace** and **city service** availability. \r\nWhen zoning residential areas, consulting the **zoning factor tooltips** will give additional information about how suitable an area is for the selected zone type.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Commercial Buildings] = Commercial buildings are divided into **low** and **high density** buildings. \r\nLow density commercial buildings house small companies, boutiques and restaurants. High density commercial buildings include supermarkets, department stores and movie theaters. \r\nCommercial companies balance **land value** and customer proximity to keep the costs low and **profitability** high. Tourism also contributes to commercial suitability.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Commercial Suitability] = Commercial Suitability indicates generally good areas for commercial zones in terms of **customers** and **competition** from other commercial companies. \r\nWhen zoning commercial areas, consulting the **zoning factor tooltips** will give additional information about how suitable an area is for the selected zone type.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[CustomersInfomode] = Customers include local **citizens** and visiting **tourists**. Different age and wealth groups have different preferences regarding what products they want to buy and consume.\r\n\r\nAs an example, families with teens are more likely to buy **electronics** compared to the elderly, who in turn are more likely to buy **pharmaceuticals**. All **households** are equally likely to buy **convenience food** while the more wealthy households can afford to buy high quality food and **vehicles** as well as dabble in finances.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Industrial Buildings] = Industrial buildings are either manufacturing or storage buildings. \r\nManufacturing buildings use one or more **resources** to produce another resource, which is then either sold by a **commercial company** or further processed into another resource in a different **industrial company**. Storage buildings store industrial resources that are sold to other industrial or commercial companies or, in the case of surplus, transported and sold to Outside Connections.\r\nIndustrial companies value good **resource availability**, **transport connections** and **available employees**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Industrial Suitability] = **Industrial suitability** indicates generally good areas for industrial zones in terms of **employee** and **resource availability**. \r\nWhen zoning industrial areas, consulting the Zoning Factor tooltips will give additional information about how suitable an area is for the selected zone type.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Office Buildings] = Office buildings are divided into **low** and **high density** office buildings. \r\nLow density office buildings include **small businesses** like music stores and phone companies. High density offices house **large businesses** such as software and finance companies. \r\nOffice companies produce **immaterial goods** that both citizens and other businesses use.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Office Suitability] = **Office suitability** indicates generally good areas for office zones in terms of **employee** and **city service availability**. \r\nWhen zoning office areas, consulting the **zoning factor tooltips** will give additional information about how suitable an area is for the selected zone type.
Infoviews.RESIDENTIAL_LEVEL_TOOLTIP = Residential building levels across the city.\r\nHigher level residential buildings have higher upkeep costs, but they also consume less **water** and **electricity**, and produce less **garbage**. 
Infoviews.COMMERCIAL_LEVEL_TOOLTIP = Commercial building levels across the city.\r\nHigher level commercial buildings produce products more **efficiently**, and use less **electricity**. This makes their products cheaper and draws in more customers compared to their lower level counterparts. 
Infoviews.INDUSTRIAL_LEVEL_TOOLTIP = Industrial building levels across the city.\r\nHigher level industrial buildings have improved **efficiency**, and use less **electricity** per **resource** produced and sold.
Infoviews.OFFICE_LEVEL_TOOLTIP = Office building levels across the city.\r\nHigher level office buildings produce products more **efficiently**, and use less **electricity**. This makes their products cheaper and draws in more customers compared to their lower level counterparts. 
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Level] = Households and companies pay **rent** for the building they reside in. The money left over after the buildings upkeep is paid for is used to upgrade the building to a higher **level**. Wealthier households and successful companies are able to increase the **level** of their building faster.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_LAND_VALUE_TOOLTIP = The average value of a zoned cell of land within the city. \r\n**Land value** is determined by how desirable **households** deem a location to be. \r\n**City service buildings** do not increase land value directly, but raise the value of the location for those households that find the services important.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[LandValueInfomode] = High income households are able and willing to pay **higher rent** and thus seek to live in areas with higher land value. \r\nLow income households prefer to live in areas of low land value, and are able to live with fewer services. They also prefer apartment buildings, as this way building upkeep is divided between multiple households.\r\nCommercial companies balance between land value and **customer vicinity**.\r\nIndustrial companies balance between land value and **good connections** to other companies and Outside Connections.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Building Land Value] = Buildings affect their surroundings. A high **level** building increases the land value in its vicinity. A low level building can bring the surrounding land value down. The building's land value is an indicator to how the area is going to develop in the near future.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_COMMERCIAL_PROFIT_TOOLTIP = Average profitability of commercial zone companies across the city.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_INDUSTRIAL_PROFIT_TOOLTIP = Average profitability of industrial zone companies across the city.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_OFFICE_PROFIT_TOOLTIP = Average profitability of offize zone companies across the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Profitability] = **Company profitability** is calculated by subtracting **worker wages**, **resource prices** and **resource transportation**, **utilities** and building **rent costs** from the companys income. Companies use their **income** and **wealth** to level up their buildings, which increases their **efficiency**.\r\nCompanies evaluate their production from time to time in order to maximize their income. This means adjusting the number of workers according to a profitable production rate.\r\nIf a companys income and wealth are both negative, the company will go bankrupt.
Infoviews.OIL_RESOURCE_TOOLTIP = Oil is a **non-renewable** natural resource that can be extracted by the **Oil Drilling** specialized industry. \r\nThe availability numbers refer to the quantity found within current city limits.
Infoviews.ORE_RESOURCE_TOOLTIP = Ore is a **non-renewable** natural resource that can be extracted by the **Ore Mining** specialized industry. \r\nThe availability numbers refer to the quantity found within current city limits.
Infoviews.WOOD_RESOURCE_TOOLTIP = Wood is a **renewable** natural resource that can be harvested by the **Forestry** specialized industry. \r\nThe availability numbers refer to the quantity found within current city limits.
Infoviews.FERTILE_LAND_RESOURCE_TOOLTIP = Fertile Land is a **renewable** natural resource that can be used by the **Agriculture** specialized industries. \r\nThe availability numbers refer to the quantity found within current city limits.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Extractor Buildings] = **Hub buildings** are the main buildings of the **Specialized Industry** areas. \r\n**Resources** extracted from the area are brought to the hub building and stored there until they are transported further.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[ExtractorLot] = **Areas** are where **Specialized Industries** extract **resources** from.\r\nThe maximum resource yield of an area is based on its size and how much of the given resource there is within the area itself.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[ForestInfomode] = **Forests** are a renewable **natural resource** that can be harvested by the **Forestry** specialized industry. The resulting wood is used in various manufacturing processes to create furniture, building materials and more.\r\nForestry doesnt cause **ground** or **air pollution**, but the heavy machinery used does cause **noise pollution**. \r\nForestry also causes increased heavy traffic as the resources are transported with semi trucks. \r\nForests are susceptible to **ground pollution** and **forest fires** caused by heat waves and drought. Forests ravaged by pollution, fires or excessive harvesting regenerate slowly over time.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[FertilityInfomode] = **Fertile land** is a renewable **natural resource** that can be used by the **Agriculture** specialized industry for various purposes from food to clothes production.\r\nAgriculture doesnt cause **ground** or **air pollution**, but the farm equipment does cause **noise pollution**. Fertile land is susceptible to ground pollution, which decreases its yield considerably. Excess usage of the resource also temporarily depletes it. The resource regenerates quickly after the ground pollution has been removed and production has been slowed down.\r\nBuilding agricultural areas on non-fertile land creates **pastures** for farm animals.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[OilInfomode] = **Oil deposits** are located underground and are non-renewable. Oil is extracted by the **Oil Drilling** specialized industry, and can be used for various manufacturing processes, as well as **fuel** by the citys power plants.\r\nOil Drilling causes large amounts of **ground**, **air** and **noise pollution**. Due to oil being flammable, oil drills and other facilities also have a high **fire hazard**. \r\nOil industry is highly lucrative, and causes increased heavy traffic as the resources are transported with Oil Trucks.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[OreInfomode] = **Ore deposits** are located underground and are non-renewable. Ore is extracted by the **Ore Mining** specialized industry, and can be used for various resource manufacturing processes, and as fuel by the citys power plants.\r\nOre Mining causes large amounts of **ground**, **air** and **noise pollution**.\r\nBuilding ore mining areas on land with no ore deposits creates **stone quarries**, which produce resources for building upkeep and repair.
Infoviews.POPULATION_STATISTICS_TOOLTIP = The city's population consists of people of various ages. Different age groups have differences regarding their **health**, **education** and **work** status, and consumer habits\r\nThe population grows by both new citizens being born within the city and by people moving in from elsewhere. \r\nCitizens can also move out if they cannot find a job, if the city doesn't offer activities they enjoy, or if they simply cannot afford to live there.
Infoviews.POPULATION_DISTRIBUTION_TOOLTIP = Population age across all citizens currently residing in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Citizen Age] = Citizens of different age groups have differences regarding their **health**, **education** and **work** status, and consumer habits. \r\n**Children** and **teens** prefer going to school, but teens not successful in school head for the job market. \r\nWhen they become **adults**, citizens either go to work or apply for further education. Working grants immediate income, while education will potentially lead to a higher paying job after graduation. \r\n**The elderly** are retired from working life and have lots of free time for partaking in various activities in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[PopulationInfomode] = **City service** usage in densely populated areas is usually substantial.\r\nElectricity needs are great, schools fill up with students and there are more citizens who require healthcare and safety. Telecom bandwidth requirements are also increased.\r\nConversely, densely populated residential areas have large numbers of available workers and customers to keep companies profitable and running efficiently.
Infoviews.HAPPINESS_FACTORS_TOOLTIP = Matters that currently affect your citizens' happiness positively or negatively.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Happiness] = **Happiness** is the combination of a citizen's **health** and **well-being**. \r\nCitizen happiness affects their ability to work. \r\nEmployees with high happiness have increased **work efficiency**, which contributes to the companys efficiency.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Wealth] = **Wealth** is calculated per household. It is determined by subtracting the households expenses from its income.\r\nExpenses include **rent**, **taxes**, **service fees** and **transportation** and **shopping** costs.\r\nHousehold income consists of wages for working household members and government subsidies for non-workers (students, the elderly and the unemployed).\r\nHousehold wealth also includes other resources bought from commercial zones.
Infoviews.WORKPLACE_DISTRIBUTION_TOOLTIP = Filled and available workplaces across the city.\r\nDifferent **education levels** relate to the complexity of different jobs. Some jobs only require minimal education, while others need highly skilled labor. \r\nThe number and complexity level of workplaces in a **company** depend on its size, profitability, and building level. The workplaces in **city service buildings** depend on the buildings type.\r\nFilling all the available workplaces is part of maximizing a building's **efficiency**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[WorkplacesInfomode] = Companies and city service buildings require **employees**. \r\n\r\nCitizens choose their workplaces based on the length of their commute and the availability of workplaces matching their education level. Citizens can also change their jobs if a more suitable workplace appears.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Air Pollution Source] = Industry, traffic, garbage management, and certain power plants generate **air pollution**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Net Air Pollution] = Vehicles' combustion engines generate **air pollution**. Roads with heavy traffic are the main source of traffic-based air pollution.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Ground Pollution Source] = Industry, garbage management, and certain power plants generate **ground pollution**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Water Pollution Source] = Sewage processing facilities generate **water pollution**. Water pollution spreads with flowing water.\r\n\r\nPumping polluted water back into the water network contaminates the fresh water and causes a decline in citizens' **health**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Noise Pollution Source] = Commercial areas, certain city services, industry, traffic, and power plants generate **noise pollution**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Net Noise Pollution] = Traffic generates **noise pollution**. Roads with heavy traffic such as highways and arterial roads between urban areas, industrial and commercial centers, and transportation hubs are the main sources of traffic-based noise pollution.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_WATER_POLLUTION_TOOLTIP = The average amount of water pollution across all the households in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[WaterPollution] = **Water pollution** is generated when **sewage** is pumped into surface water, and when a shoreline gets contaminated by **ground pollution**. Water pollution in surface water spreads with the currents and dilutes as it mixes with fresh water.\r\nIf polluted water is pumped into the city's water network, it decreases the **health** of the citizens within the water network's reach.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_GROUND_POLLUTION_TOOLTIP = The average amount of ground pollution across all the households in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[GroundWaterPollutionInfomode] = **Groundwater deposits** become contaminated when they come into contact with **ground pollution**. Pollution in groundwater deposits spreads quickly and always contaminates the entire deposit. \r\nPollution in groundwater deposits dissipates only after the ground pollution in the area is removed and the deposit has had enough time to get replenished with fresh water.\r\nIf polluted water is pumped into the city's water network, it decreases the **health** of the citizens within the water network's reach.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_AIR_POLLUTION_TOOLTIP = The average amount of air pollution across all the households in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[AirPollutionInfomode] = Air pollution is generated mainly by industry and traffic, and it decreases citizens' **health** and **happiness**. It is spread around by the wind, affected by terrain formations such as hills and mountains. \r\nAir pollution dissipates quickly after its source has been removed. Windy and rainy weather further increase the speed at which this happens.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[WindInfomode] = Wind determines which direction and how far **air pollution** spreads. It also affects how effective **Wind Turbines** are at producing electricity. Terrain formations affect the way the wind blows.
Infoviews.AVERAGE_NOISE_POLLUTION_TOOLTIP = The average amount of noise pollution across all the households in the city.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[NoisePollutionInfomode] = **Noise pollution** is generated by traffic, commercial and industrial areas, and leisure buildings. Noise pollution decreases citizen **well-being** and **happiness**. \r\nThe effects can be mitigated by zoning commercial and industrial areas some distance away from residential areas and by routing heavy traffic further away from housing.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[GroundPollutionInfomode] = **Ground pollution** is generated mainly by industry, power plants and garbage management facilities, and it decreases affected citizens' **health** and **happiness**. It spreads onto the land near its source, and contaminates any **groundwater deposits** it comes into contact with. It also reduces the **resource** yields from **forests** and **fertile land**. \r\nGround pollution starts to dissipate after the source is removed, but it takes a long time for it to disappear entirely. Once the pollution is gone, groundwater deposits eventually replenish themselves with fresh water, and the affected resource yields return to normal.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[GroundWaterInfomode] = **Groundwater deposits** are underground water sources. **Groundwater Pumping Stations** can extract the water and pump it into the city's water network. Groundwater deposits are highly susceptible to **ground pollution**.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[WaterPollutionInfomode] = **Water pollution** is generated by sewage or ground pollution mixing with surface water or groundwater deposits. If polluted water is then pumped into the city's fresh water network, it decreases the **health** of the citizens that come into contact with it.\r\nWater pollution in surface water spreads with the currents and dilutes as it mixes with fresh water. Pollution in **groundwater deposits** contaminates the entire deposit, and only begins dissipating once the ground pollution in the area has been removed.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ShelterSection] = Citizens in the shelter are safe from all **disasters** and **major accidents**. While sheltered, they keep consuming the stored **resources**.

SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[UpkeepSection] = Building **upkeep** consists of the combined expenses of building **maintenance**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[UpkeepSectionCoal] = This building burns **coal** to produce electricity. Fuel can be produced locally by setting up mining on **ore deposits** or imported from other cities. Importing is always more expensive than local production.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[UpkeepSectionPetrochemicals] = This building burns natural gas (**petrochemicals**) to produce electricity. Fuel can be produced locally by setting up mining on **ore deposits** or imported from other cities. Importing is always more expensive than local production.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[UpkeepSectionPharmaceuticals] = This building uses different types of medications (**pharmaceuticals**) to treat patients. They can be produced locally by pharmaceutical companies or imported from other cities. Importing is always more expensive than local production.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[UpkeepSectionFood] = This building requires **food** for the citizens inside. Food can be produced locally by setting up agriculture areas or imported from other cities. Importing is always more expensive than local production.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[UpkeepSectionWages] = Wages are calculated based on the number of **employees** and their **education** levels.

The number of vehicles is automatically changed based on the needs of the lines.\r\n\r\nSelecting a vehicle on the list opens its individual info panel.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[VehiclesSectionVehicle] = This building uses **vehicles** to perform tasks around the city. The number of currently operating vehicles is automatically changed based on the city's needs.\r\n\r\nSelecting a vehicle on the list opens its individual info panel.

SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[FireEngine] = Fire Engines respond to **fires** and other **emergencies** within the city. They travel to the location by road and are thus affected by traffic en route.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PostVan] = Post Vans collect and deliver **mail** sent by citizens and companies. They pick up mail from **mail boxes** and directly from **companies**, and deliver it to post offices for further handling and delivery.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PostTruck] = Post Trucks carry large quantities of **mail** on intercity routes. They take all mail to post sorting facilities for handling and further delivery.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[GarbageTruck] = Garbage Trucks pick up **garbage** from the city and bring it to garbage management facilities for processing.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[EvacuationBus] = Evacuation Buses are sent out to **transport citizens** into **shelters** when an impending **natural disaster** is upon the city.

SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MedicalHelicopter] = Medical Helicopters have a large operating radius and they bring **patients** in for treatment from **accident sites** and **remote locations**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[Taxi] = Taxis transport individual **citizens** or small groups to their destination within or outside the city.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MaintenanceVehicle] = Maintenance Vehicles keep infrastructure in working condition.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DeliveryTruck] = Delivery Trucks transport **goods** or **resources** from one place to another within or outside the city.

SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[SewageSection] = Sewage facilities process and store water that is drained from the water network after being used. Sewage causes pollution in the environment, and gets spread further by water currents.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[SewageSectionOutletPurification] = Purifying sewage before releasing it into the environment reduces the amount of water pollution.

SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ActionsSectionStopEmptying] = Halts the emptying process and returns the building to normal operation.

SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ActionsSectionDelete] = Permanently destroy the current selection.

The youth and elderly have fewer chances compared to adults. Age also affects citizen **health**. The elderly are more prone to falling ill.\r\n\r\nCitizens' **education level** affects **wages** and **garbage production**. Higher education equals higher pay and less garbage. The education level also determines the highest **job level** a citizen can have.

SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ColorSection] = Color picker
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ColorSectionLine] = Changing the color of a line can be used to visually organize your public transport network.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ColorSectionRoute] = Changing the color of a route can be used to visually organize your cargo transport network.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySection] = Companies produce **goods** and **services**, both material and immaterial.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySectionRequires] = Industrial manufacturing requires **resources** to produce goods. Resources can be **produced locally** by other companies or **imported** from outside of the city.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySectionProduces] = Goods that the company produces are either **sold locally** or **exported**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySectionSells] = Companies sell their products to retailers or directly to customers.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySectionStores] = Warehouses store locally produced **resources** that they can sell to other companies that in turn use them to produce other more refined **resources** and **goods**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySectionVacantCommercial] = No company has taken interest in renting this building. This may be due to poor connections, a lack of customers or high land price. Higher **commercial demand** will resolve the situation.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySectionVacantIndustrial] = No company has taken interest in renting this building. This may be due to poor connections, a lack of customers or high land price. Higher **industrial demand** will resolve the situation.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[CompanySectionVacantOffice] = No company has taken interest in renting this building. This may be due to poor connections, a lack of customers or high land price. Higher **office demand** will resolve the situation.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DeathcareSection] = Deathcare services prepare **citizens** for their final journey.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DeathcareSectionCemetery] = Cemeteries have a finite number of burial plots. Once the capacity is full, it is necessary to either build a new **Cemetery** or a **Crematorium**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DeathcareSectionCrematorium] = Crematoriums store the deceased until cremation. Afterwards, the ashes themselves do not take up space in the crematorium.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DistrictsSection] = Service buildings can be assigned to **city districts**.\r\nWhen assigned, the building will function as the local service for the **assigned district(s)**.\r\nUnassigned buildings provide their services everywhere within their **operational radius**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[EfficiencySection] = Buildings can lose or gain **efficiency** based on different factors. The default efficiency is 100%. Anything lower means the building is underperforming, while higher percentage means it is performing better than expected.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ElectricitySection] = The amount of **electricity** this building supplies to the power grid. It is dependent on the building's **efficiency**, and is automatically adjusted up to its maximum value to match the city's needs.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ElectricitySectionSolar] = Solar energy output fluctuates according to available **sunlight**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ElectricitySectionWind] = Wind energy output fluctuates according to **wind speed**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ElectricitySectionBattery] = Excess energy is stored in **batteries** and used during periods of reduced production.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ElectricitySectionGarbage] = Incineration energy output is based on the amount of **stored garbage** and **processing speed**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[EmployeesSection] = The maximum number of **employees** in a building is determined by the building's type, size, and zone density.\r\n\r\nOpen workplaces in companies and service buildings get filled whenever there are citizens with matching **education**.\r\n\r\nIf workplaces remain unfulfilled, the building **efficiency** suffers. The higher the education level, the larger the overall effect on building efficiency.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[EmployeesSectionServiceUsage] = The number of workplaces in **service buildings** changes according to service demand.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[GarbageSection] = Garbage management facilities store and process **garbage** collected from the city. Garbage processing speed depends on the building and its extensions.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[GarbageSectionLandfill] = Landfills process garbage at a slow rate. \r\n\r\nGarbage stored in a landfill can be transported to other garbage facilities by selecting the emptying function in the bottom of this panel.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[GarbageSectionIncinerator] = Incineration Plants process garbage at a high rate. Heat from the burning process is turned into **electricity**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[GarbageSectionRecyclingCenter] = Recycling Centers process garbage at a moderate rate and turn it into reusable **materials**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[GarbageSectionHazardousWaste] = Industrial Waste Processing Sites process industrial waste at a high rate.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[HealthcareSection] = The current number of patients out of the maximum treatable.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[IDSection] = Rename the object.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LevelSection] = Money that is left over after paying **rent** and **upkeep** is used by the occupants to **level up** the building. If the occupants' **wealth** declines, the building may end up **abandoned**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LevelSectionResidential] = Higher level residential buildings have higher **upkeep** costs, but they also consume less **water** and **electricity**, and produce less **garbage**.\r\nResidential **wealth** is based on the residents' **employment** situation and **job level**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LevelSectionCommercial] = Higher level commercial buildings have improved **efficiency** and consume less electricity per **resource** produced and sold, making their products cheaper and drawing in more customers than their lower level counterparts.\r\nCommercial **wealth** is based on the **profits** the company makes from selling goods and services to citizens.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LevelSectionIndustrial] = Higher level industrial buildings have improved **efficiency** and consume less electricity per **resource** produced and sold.\r\nIndustrial **wealth** is based on the **profits** the company makes from selling products to retailers.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LevelSectionOffice] = Higher level office buildings have improved **efficiency** and consume less **electricity** per **resource** produced and sold, making their products cheaper and drawing in more customers than their lower level counterparts.\r\nOffice **wealth** is based on the **profits** the company makes from selling immaterial goods and services to retailers and citizens.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LinesSectionTransportLine] = Public transport lines with stops at this station.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LinesSectionTransportStop] = Public transport lines that stop here.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LinesSectionCargoRoute] = Cargo routes with stops at this station.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LoadSection] = Vehicles with cargo space transport materials related to their operations.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LoadSectionWater] = Firefighting units transport water to put out fires. Once the water reserve is used, the unit returns to refuel and restock.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LoadSectionIndustrialWaste] = Industrial waste disposal trucks collect dangerous industrial waste and manufacturing by-products from **industrial buildings**, which decreases the ground pollution caused by industrial zones.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LoadSectionGarbage] = Garbage Trucks collect waste from **households** and **companies** and deliver it to garbage management buildings for processing.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LoadSectionMail] = Post vehicles pick up and carry the city's mail. Post Vans operate within the city delivering **local mail**, while Post Trucks handle **intercity mail** delivery.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LocalServicesSection] = When you assign an **operating district** to a service building, it becomes one of the district's **local services**, only serving the people within the district's borders.\r\n\r\nSelecting a building on the list opens its info panel, where you can see the building's information, build upgrades or unassign the building from a district.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSection] = A well-established postal service increases private citizens **well-being** as it allows them to remain in contact with their friends and families. For **businesses**, the postal service is an important part of running a business smoothly. A lack of service can **negatively affect** companies and decrease their profitability.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSectionSorting] = The facility sorts **intercity mail** by preparing incoming mail to be distributed to local **Post Offices** and outgoing mail to be transported out of the city.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSectionStorage] = All mail is stored in the building's storage rooms.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ParkingSection] = The number of currently parked vehicles out of the maximum capacity.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ParkSection] = Park maintenance is integral to keeping **parks**, **plazas** and other **recreation locations** in good condition.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PassengersSection] = The current number of passengers in the vehicle out of the maximum passenger capacity.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PoliceSection] = Arrested criminals are detained in the building's **jail cells**. Depending on the crime, some criminals are released within a day, while others are sentenced to serve time in **prison**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PollutionSectionGround] = Ground pollution negatively affects citizen **health**. It also destroys **forest** and **fertile land** resources. \r\nWhen ground pollution is removed, these renewable resources will eventually regenerate.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PollutionSectionAir] = Air pollution negatively affects citizen **health**. 
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PollutionSectionNoise] = Noise pollution negatively affects citizen **well-being**. 
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[PrisonSection] = The current number of **prisoners** out of the maximum houseable. \r\n\r\nPrisons hold criminals in custody for long periods of time. Once the sentence is served and the citizen is freed, their **criminal status** is removed.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionResidents] = The number of residents currently living in this building.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionHouseholdMembers] = Households can be made of couples, families, or just a single person.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionHouseholds] = The current and maximum number of households in this building. The size of a building determines the maximum number of households.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionHouseholdWealth] = The financial situation of the household, taking into account each member's **income** and the household's **net worth**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionAverageHouseholdWealth] = The average financial situation of the households in this building, taking into account their members' **income** and the households' **net worth**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionAge] = Citizen age determines their **education** opportunities and whether or not they can **work**. Age also affects citizen **health**. As they grow older, they are more prone to falling ill.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionEducation] = Education level determines the citizen's **job** opportunities, **wages** and their work **efficiency**. Their average education level also affects how much **garbage** they produce.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResidentsSectionResidence] = The **building** this household lives in. Residential buildings are named after the **street** on which they are located. The name can be customized by opening the building **info panel** and selecting the name.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ResourceSection] = Wood available for harvesting by the **Forestry** specialized industry. Wood can be further processed into timber and various consumer goods by other companies.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[RoadSectionLength] = Distance from one end of the road to the other.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[RoadSectionCondition] = The current condition of the road and the average condition over time.\r\n\r\nIf the road surface is in poor condition, vehicles are forced to drive **slower**, and **accidents** become more likely. \r\n\r\nRoad repairs are handled by **Road Maintenance Depots**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[RoadSectionUpkeep] = The cost to keep this section of the road network operational.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[RoadSectionFlow] = Traffic flow is a measure of the road's **efficiency** during different times of day. \r\n\r\nLowered flow percentages indicate that vehicles are forced to drive **slower** than the indicated speed limit. This can eventually lead to **traffic jams**. In such cases, further development of the road network may be needed to suit the **traffic volume**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[RoadSectionVolume] = Traffic volume is the **number of vehicles** using the road at different times of day. \r\n\r\nHigh volume fluctuations can indicate rush hours and potential traffic jams, resulting in lowered **traffic flow**.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[Vehicle] = Vehicle
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[SelectVehiclesSectionTransportLine] = Select a vehicle model for this transport line.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[SelectVehiclesSectionCargoRoute] = Select a vehicle model for this cargo route.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[VehicleCountSectionTransportLine] = Modify the number of vehicles on the line.\r\n\r\nNote that the **maximum** number of vehicles depends on the line's **length**.\r\n\r\nNewly assigned vehicles are not active until they reach the line. Similarly, vehicles undergoing **maintenance** are inactive, but remain assigned to the line.\r\n\r\nTransport line vehicle numbers can be globally adjusted by changing the Transport service budget.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[VehicleCountSectionCargoRoute] = Modify the number of vehicles on the route.\r\n\r\nNote that the **maximum** number of vehicles depends on the line's **length**.\r\n\r\nNewly assigned vehicles are not active until they reach the route. Similarly, vehicles undergoing **maintenance** are inactive, but remain assigned to the line.\r\n\r\nCargo route vehicle numbers can be globally adjusted by changing the Transport service budget.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[TicketPriceSection] = Modify the line's ticket price.\r\n\r\nNote that higher ticket prices may make public transport inaccessible for low income citizens.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ScheduleSectionTransportLine] = Set the operating schedule for the transport line.\r\n\r\nThe vehicles return to the depot during the line's off hours.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ScheduleSectionCargoRoute] = Set the operating schedule for the cargo route.\r\n\r\nThe vehicles return to the depot during the route's off hours.
SelectedInfoPanel.PASSENGERS_TOOLTIP = Passengers
SelectedInfoPanel.CARGO_TOOLTIP = Cargo
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ScheduleSectionPublicTransport] = Set this public transport line to operate in the desired schedule. 
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ScheduleSectionCargoTransport] = Set this cargo route to operate in the desired schedule.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DispatchedVehiclesSection] = Vehicles that have been called or dispatched to this building.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ActionsSectionUnfocus] = Stop the camera from following the selected item.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP_TITLE[Deactivate] = Deactivate
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP_TITLE[Reactivate] = Reactivate
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[Deactivate] = A deactivated building does not **produce** anything or provide any **services**. The inactive building requires only minimal maintenance and thus consumes only 10% of its normal upkeep.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[Reactivate] = Reactivation returns the building back to normal functioning. The building is brought back online as it was before deactivation.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ReactivatePublicTransportLine] = Reactivation returns the transport line back into action. Vehicles are sent out from the depot to operate the line as long as the depot has the required capacity.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DeactivatePublicTransportLine] = Deactivated transport lines send their vehicles back to the depot.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ReactivateCargoRoute] = Reactivation returns the cargo route back into action. Vehicles are sent out from the depot to operate the route as long as the depot has the required capacity.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[DeactivateCargoRoute] = Deactivated cargo routes send their vehicles back to the depot.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[TitleSection] = Select to edit the name.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSectionToDeliver] = Mail to deliver is sorted local mail waiting to be delivered to recipients within the city.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSectionLocal] = Local mail is sorted mail with recipients within the city.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSectionOutgoing] = Global mail is sorted mail with recipients outside of the city.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSectionCollected] = Collected mail is mail collected from the city waiting for transport to a sorting facility.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[MailSectionUnsorted] = Unsorted mail is collected mail waiting to be sorted into local and global mail.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[AverageHappinessSectionDistrict] = The average **happiness** of every household living in the district.\r\n\r\nCitizen happiness is the combination of citizen **health** and **well-being**. Taking care of citizens' basic needs like healthcare increases their health and providing them with **education**, **leisure** opportunities, and safety increases their well-being. Happy citizens also work efficiently and thus increase companies' **efficiency**, as well.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[AverageHappinessSectionBuilding] = The average **happiness** of every household living in this building.\r\n\r\nCitizen happiness is the combination of citizen **health** and **well-being**. Taking care of citizens' basic needs like healthcare increases their health and providing them with **education**, **leisure** opportunities, and safety increases their well-being. Happy citizens also work efficiently and thus increase companies' **efficiency**, as well.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[AverageHappinessSectionHousehold] = The average **happiness** of every household member.\r\n\r\nCitizen happiness is the combination of citizen **health** and **well-being**. Taking care of citizens' basic needs like healthcare increases their health and providing them with **education**, **leisure** opportunities, and safety increases their well-being. Happy citizens also work efficiently and thus increase companies' **efficiency**, as well.

Main.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION_CURRENT_MILESTONE = Advance to the next milestone by earning enough XP.
