TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_CARGO[Train] = Cargo trains transport resources within the city and between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_CARGO[Ship] = Cargo ships transport resources mainly between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_CARGO[Airplane] = Cargo airplanes transport resources mainly between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_CARGO[Total] = The amount of cargo transported during the past month.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Taxi] = Taxis transport citizens and tourists within the city and between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Bus] = Buses transport citizens and tourists within the city and between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Train] = Passenger trains transport citizens and tourists within the city and between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Tram] = Trams transport citizens and tourists within the city.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Subway] = Subways transport citizens and tourists within the city.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Ship] = Passenger ships transport citizens and tourists mainly between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Airplane] = Passenger airplanes transport citizens and tourists mainly between the city and Outside Connections.
TransportInfoPanel.SUMMARY_TOOLTIP_PUBLICTRANSPORT[Total] = The number of passengers, both citizens and tourists, transported during the past month.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LineSectionTransportLine] = Length is the distance from the start of the line to the finish. Determines how many vehicles can be assigned to the line.\r\n\r\nStops is the current number of stops along the length of the line.\r\n\r\nPassengers shows the total number of passengers currently aboard all the vehicles on the line.\r\n\r\nLine usage refers to how busy the line is. Values below 100% mean vehicles are not running at full capacity. Usage at 100% means the line is so busy it might benefit from additional vehicles.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[LineSectionCargoRoute] = Length is the distance from the start of the route to the finish. Determines how many vehicles can be assigned to the route.\r\n\r\nStops is the current number of stops along the length of the route.\r\n\r\nCargo shows the total amount of cargo currently loaded onto the route's vehicles.\r\n\r\nRoute usage refers to how busy the route is. Values below 100% mean vehicles are not running at full capacity. Usage at 100% means the route is so busy it might benefit from additional vehicles.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ProfitabilitySectionCompany] = Profitability indicates how well companies are doing in this location.\r\nIt is calculated by subtracting worker wages, resource prices and resource transportation, utilities and building rent costs from the companys income. Companies use their income and wealth to level up their buildings, which increases their efficiency.\r\nCompanies evaluate their production from time to time in order to maximize their income. This means adjusting the number of workers to achieve a profitable production rate.\r\nIf a companys income and wealth are both negative, the company will go bankrupt.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ProfitabilitySectionDistrict] = Profitability indicates how well companies are doing in this district on average.\r\nIt is calculated by subtracting worker wages, resource prices and resource transportation, utilities and building rent costs from the companys income. Companies use their income and wealth to level up their buildings, which increases their efficiency.\r\nCompanies evaluate their production from time to time in order to maximize their income. This means adjusting the number of workers to achieve a profitable production rate.\r\nIf a companys income and wealth are both negative, the company will go bankrupt.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[VehiclesInMaintenance] = Vehicle currently undergoing maintenance. Building efficiency under 100% will result in vehicles breaking down more and requiring more maintenance.

Main.TOOLTIP_TITLE_DEMAND = Demand
Main.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION_DEMAND = The bars indicate which types of zones are currently needed in your city. The longer the bar, the higher the need for the particular zone. \r\nDemand for zoning fluctuates constantly depending on multiple factors in the constantly evolving city. They are the best indicator of where to focus your building efforts next.
ToolOptions.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[European] = European style architecture.
ToolOptions.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[North American] = North American style architecture.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Water Consumption] = The water consumption of a building is determined based on its size and function and, in the case of zoned buildings, its **level**. Higher level buildings consume less water.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[PipeWater Flow] = Fresh water is delivered into the water network by **Pumping Stations** and **Groundwater Pumping Stations**, and fed to buildings via **Water Pipes**. \r\nThe amount of water in the pipes is displayed as bars of varying lengths.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[PipeSewage Flow] = Sewage is generated by buildings using fresh water. It is drained by **Sewage Pipes** and expelled out of the water network by **Sewage Outlets** and **Wastewater Treatment Plants**.\r\nThe amount of sewage in the pipes is displayed as bars of varying lengths.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Signature Residential] = Signature buildings related to residential zones.

Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Signature Industrial] = Signature buildings related to industrial zones.
Infoviews.INFOMODE_TOOLTIP[Signature Office] = Signature buildings related to office zones.
ToolOptions.TOOLTIP[AutoParent] = Binds overlapping items to a building
ToolOptions.TOOLTIP[LotGrid] = Snap to lot grid
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[EducationSection] = Studying in a school increases the citizen's **education level**. Higher education makes citizens eligible for new job opportunities as well as further education.\r\n\r\nGraduation times depend on the building **efficiency**, student **well-being**, the **school type**, and some **city-wide effects**.\r\n\r\nDropout rates are dependent on the same factors. In addition, students may decide to quit if the school is too far away, their graduation chance is low, if they are too old or if they can earn more money without a degree over their lifetime.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[BatterySection] = Batteries store electricity. They are charged by power plants, and will feed the electric grid when electricity production falls below demand.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ComfortSectionTransportStop] = Higher passenger comfort makes it more attractive for passengers to use public transport lines connected to this stop.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ComfortSectionTransportStation] = Higher comfort makes it more attractive for passengers to use this station. The level of comfort is dependant on the building's efficiency.
SelectedInfoPanel.TOOLTIP[ComfortSectionParking] = Higher comfort makes it more attractive for people to park their cars here. The level of comfort is dependant on the building's efficiency.

Tutorials.INTRO_TITLE = WELCOME
Tutorials.INTRO_SUBTITLE = to Cities: Skylines II!
Tutorials.INTRO = This is the place to build the city of your dreams! Take on in-depth challenges of managing city services and directing traffic flow, and follow the lives of your citizens.\r\n\r\nTutorials are here to guide you as you take your first steps towards building a city. As you progress, more hints and guidance become available in case you need it.
Tutorials.BEGIN_WITH_TUTORIALS = Let's build!
Tutorials.ENABLE_TUTORIALS_CONFIRM = Start the game with tutorials
Tutorials.DISABLE_CONFIRMATION_TEXT = Even with tutorials disabled, you can always access the information from the **Advisor.**\r\n\r\nThe Advisor offers helpful information in case you get stuck, or want more in-depth information on a feature.\r\n \r\nSelect the **?** symbol located in the top right corner of the screen to open the Advisor and browse the content.\r\n\r\n**Are you sure you want to disable tutorials?**
Tutorials.BEFORE_STARTING = Before you start, let's look at how to move about your landscape by using **Camera Controls.**\r\n\r\nIf at any time you feel like turning the **Tutorials off or on** again, you can do so from the **Pause Menu,** the **gear icon** located in the top right corner.\r\n\r\nIn the pause menu you can also save your game and adjust all types of game settings.
Tutorials.BEFORE_STARTING_CONFIRM = Let's get to work
Tutorials.TODO_INTRO = **Great job!** \r\nYou are now ready to start your first city.\r\n\r\nTo guide you through your steps, we have prepared a **Task List** for you. **Start a task by selecting play** and complete the steps to unlock the feature.\r\n\r\nYou will also see **Hints** along the way. They point out useful information.\r\n\r\nYou can proceed at your own pace, and revisit any completed task by selecting play again.\r\n\r\n**Start your first task!**
Tutorials.TODO_INTRO_CONFIRM = OK
Tutorials.TITLE[TutorialsIntroList] = How To Build a City
Tutorials.TASKS = Tasks
Tutorials.TODO_OUTRO = Well Done!\r\n\r\nYou have completed your tasks and now have the basic knowledge of how to build a city.\r\n\r\nGoing forward, more tutorials and hints will pop up to guide you on your way.\r\n\r\nIf you feel like you no longer need the guidance, **you can turn tutorials off in the pause menu.**\r\n\r\nYou can always review old tutorials by **accessing the Advisor with the ? icon.**\r\n\r\n\r\n**Would you like to continue building this city or start a new one?**
Tutorials.TODO_OUTRO_CONTINUE = Continue with this city
Tutorials.TODO_OUTRO_NEW_CITY = Start a new city
Tutorials.ADVISOR_TITLE = Advisor
Tutorials.BUTTON_TOOLTIP_NEXT = Continue
Tutorials.BUTTON_TOOLTIP_PREVIOUS = Go back
Tutorials.BUTTON_TOOLTIP_DONE = Done
Tutorials.LIST_REMINDER_TITLE = Task Reminder
Tutorials.LIST_REMINDER_DESCRIPTION = **There is a tutorial task waiting for you.**\r\n\r\nWhen you're ready, \r\n\r\n**find the blinking play button in the task list** to continue learning how to build a city.
Tutorials.TITLE[ServicesCategory] = SERVICES
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsGroup] = ROADS
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorial] = Road Basics
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialIntro] = Roads
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialIntro] = A city exists around roads.\r\n\r\n**When you build a road, a cell grid appears on the land next to it.** This is the area where you can build on.\r\n \r\n**Most roads also come with a built-in utility network.** \r\n\r\nA network of electric cables and pipes for water and sewage, so all buildings connected to a road with a utility network automatically have a connection to the utilities. 
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialRoadTypes] = Road Types
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialRoadTypes] = Roads come in **different sizes and configurations,** ranging from small alleys and one-way streets all the way to large highways.\r\n\r\nThe larger the road, the higher the speed limit and traffic capacity.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialTwoLaneRoad] = Two-lane Road
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialTwoLaneRoad] = The Two-lane Road is a basic road with two lanes, one in each direction, with street lamps on one side.\r\n\r\nIt is easy to build with, but it can only support a low amount of traffic.\r\n\r\n**When selecting a road, keep an eye on the information panel.**\r\nIt will show you how much the road costs to build and maintain, and how much electricity the built-in utility network can handle.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialToolOptions] = Tool Options
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialToolOptions] = These can be used to help you build exactly how and what you want. \r\n\r\n**Different options are available according to what you are currently building.**
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialToolOptionModes] = Tool Modes
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialToolOptionModes] = **Different modes help you build roads in varying shapes.** \r\n\r\nSelect the mode according to the shape you want. You can always switch to a different mode at any time.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialReplace] = Replace
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialReplace] = This mode can be used to change any road you have already built to a different type.\r\n\r\nNo need for the bulldozer!\r\n\r\n**Turn Replace mode on and  select a new road type from the Roads menu.**\r\n\r\n**When you select a section of an existing road on the map, the new road type will be built in the old one's place.** \r\n\r\nKeep an eye on how replacing affects traffic lanes and existing buildings.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialElevationDown] = Elevation Down
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialElevationDown] = Changing road elevation **down** allows you to construct **tunnels.**\r\n\r\nYou can construct tunnels at different elevations, which allows them to cross each other. This is especially handy when creating public transport lines.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialElevationUp] = Elevation Up
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialElevationUp] = Changing road elevation **up** allows you to construct **overpasses** and **ramps.**\r\n\r\nYou can also use it to bridge gaps in the terrain created by water or other obstacles.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialElevationStep] = Elevation Step
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialElevationStep] = Adjusts **how much the elevation changes** when you use the up or down arrows.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialParallel] = Parallel Mode
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialParallel] = **This mode makes two of the selected roads run perfectly aligned next to each other.**\r\n\r\nYou can increase or decrease the space between the roads once you turn the mode on.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialToolOptionSnapping] = Snapping
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadsTutorialToolOptionSnapping] = These options can help fine-tune the shape and placement of your roads. \r\n\r\n**With snapping on, roads and other objects become magnetic to what snapping modes you have turned on.**\r\n\r\nSnapping options can be turned on and off individually.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadsTutorialPlacement] = Building Roads
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[RoadsTutorialPlacement] = To get your city started and to make it grow, you will need to make it possible for both people and materials to arrive.\r\n\r\n**Look around your map and find the roads that lead in and out of the map area.**\r\n\r\n**Start building your city by connecting to and expanding from these roads.**\r\n\r\nBuild your road with <inputAction:Tool/Apply> \r\n\r\nWhen done, unselect the road tool with  <inputAction:Tool/Secondary Apply> or <inputAction:Tool/Cancel[0]> \r\n\r\nHaving good connections to the outside world is key to your success!\r\n
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[RoadsTutorialPlacement] = To get your city started and to make it grow, you will need to make it possible for both people and materials to arrive.\r\n\r\n**Look around your map and find the roads that lead in and out of the map area.**\r\n\r\n**Start building your city by connecting to and expanding from these roads.**\r\n\r\nBuild your roads with <inputAction:Tool/Apply>\r\n\r\nWhen done, unselect the road tool with <inputAction:Tool/Cancel>\r\n\r\nHaving good connections to the outside world is key to your success!
Tutorials.TRIGGER[RoadsTutorialPlacementTrigger] = Build a Road
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorial] = Road Services
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorialIntro] = Road Services
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadServicesTutorialIntro] = **Road maintenance and extra resources are available through the Road Services.**\r\n\r\nMaintenance is aimed at keeping the roads in good condition, while the resources include things like roadside decorations, sound barriers and traffic signs.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorialDepot] = Road Maintenance Depot
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadServicesTutorialDepot] = **Road Maintenance Depot sends out vehicles to keep roads in good condition.**\r\n\r\nMaintenance vehicles clear roads of snow, wrecked vehicles, debris and do road repairs as needed.\r\n\r\nHaving your roads well-maintained reduces the likelihood of vehicle accidents and traffic jams.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorialTrafficLights] = Traffic Lights
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadServicesTutorialTrafficLights] = **You can set up traffic lights at an intersection to control the flow of traffic.**\r\n\r\nThis can be useful especially in small but busy intersections, where traffic on one side needs to wait for a long time.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorialStopSigns] = Stop Signs
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadServicesTutorialStopSigns] = **You can set up stop signs at an intersection to force traffic to stop before crossing.**\r\n\r\nThis can be useful for allowing traffic from one direction to have more chances of crossing the intersection.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorialNoTurning] = No Turning Left or Right
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadServicesTutorialNoTurning] = **You can control the direction of traffic flow with these signs.**\r\n\r\nPlace the sign on the road section leading to an intersection. Turning in the indicated direction is no longer allowed, and the lane markings change accordingly. \r\n\r\nBoth signs can be placed on the same road, prohibiting turning in the intersection altogether.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorialDecorations] = Roadside Decorations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadServicesTutorialDecorations] = **Decorations can be added onto existing roads to modify their look and feel.**\r\n\r\nYou can add them on one or both sides of the road, and different decorations can be added on top of each other.\r\n\r\n**Choose the type of decoration you want and select the road section and side of the road you'd like to place it to.**\r\n\r\n**Note:** Decorations will replace roadside parking spaces from the selected sections.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadServicesTutorialRemoveSign] = Placing and Removing Signs and Decorations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[RoadServicesTutorialRemoveSign] = Choose the type of decoration you want and select the road section and side of the road you'd like to place it to.\r\n\r\n**Place** signs and decorations with <inputAction:Tool/Apply>\r\n\r\n**Remove** them with <inputAction:Tool/Secondary Apply>\r\n\r\nTo select more then one road section at a time hold down your selection and move over all sections you'd like to select.\r\n
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[RoadServicesTutorialRemoveSign] = Choose the type of decoration you want and select the road section and side of the road you'd like to place it to.\r\n\r\n**Place** signs and decorations with <inputAction:Tool/Apply>\r\n\r\n **Remove** them with <inputAction:Tool/SecondaryApply>
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadLaneDirectionTutorial] = Road Lane Direction
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialIntro] = Road Lane Direction
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialIntro] = Traffic direction on one-way and asymmetric road lanes is assigned when you build the road.\r\n\r\n**Lane markings point from where you start building the road to where it ends.**
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialChange] = Changing Lane Direction
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialChange] = **You can change the direction of lanes by building the same type of road right on top of the old one, but in the opposite direction.**\r\n\r\nBuilding the same type of road on top of an old one doesn't cost you anything.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialOneWayRoad] = One-Way Roads
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialOneWayRoad] = One-way roads have **traffic flowing in a single direction on all lanes.**\r\n\r\nKeep an eye out for dead end roads when building them.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialAsymmetricRoad] = Asymmetric Road
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadLaneDirectionTutorialAsymmetricRoad] = **Asymmetric roads have more lanes going in one direction and fewer in the other.**\r\n\r\nWhen using them, be mindful not to cause traffic to take unnecessary U-turns because of lanes ending abruptly. Also, when connecting them to other road types, try to align them so that there are no unnecessary lane changes required.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityGroup] = ELECTRICITY
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorial] = Electricity
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialIntro] = Electricity Basics
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialIntro] = **Almost everything in the city needs electricity to work.**\r\n\r\nA well-working electricity grid keeps citizens happy and services running.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialSourcesIntro] = Sources of Electricity
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialSourcesIntro] = **There is a variety of ways to generate electricity,** and each choice comes with its own pros and cons.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialCoalPowerPlantIntro] = Small Coal Power Plant
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialCoalPowerPlantIntro] = A Coal Power Plant is a great source of **high voltage electricity,** but it also generates **a lot of pollution.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbineIntro] = Wind Turbine
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbineIntro] = Wind power is a source of **green energy,** but the output is completely **reliant on weather.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialOutsideIntro] = Outside Source
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialOutsideIntro] = Electricity can also be **imported** from neighboring cities by using Power Lines. This requires no maintenance on your part, but buying electricity when the population grows can get  **expensive.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialSources] = Choose a Source of Electricity
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialSources] = **Select the source of electricity you want to start with and close this panel to move on.**\r\n\r\nYou can backtrack back to this panel if you change your mind.\r\n\r\nYou can also  build more and different types of electricity sources as you progress.\r\n\r\n
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialCoalPowerPlantPlacement] = Building a Coal Power Plant
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialCoalPowerPlantPlacement] = **Place the power plant downwind from housing and away from water sources to avoid polluting them.**\r\n\r\nThe visual overlays show wind direction and the locations of groundwater sources. \r\n\r\nAll power plants have an integrated transformer that converts the high voltage electricity produced by the plant into low voltage electricity that is usable by buildings. \r\n\r\n**When the power plant is placed next to a road, the transformer begins feeding the low voltage electric grid automatically through the road's integrated electric cabling.**\r\n\r\nThe plant also has a high voltage connection point at the back, which can be used later to create an efficient power grid by transferring electricity further with Power Lines.\r\n\r\nCoal Power Plants will require a steady supply of coal to remain operational. Good road access keeps the needed supplies coming in.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ElectricityTutorialCoalPowerPlantPlacementTrigger] = Build a Coal Power Plant
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbinePlacement] = Building a Wind Turbine
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbinePlacement] = **Place Wind Turbines somewhere they have enough room and are away from buildings.**\r\n\r\nWind Turbines generate noise pollution that can disturb residents.\r\n\r\n**You can place more than one turbine close to each other to generate more electricity.**\r\n\r\nThe visual overlay displays current wind direction and strength with the arrows' orientation and length.\r\n\r\nOnce built, turbines will turn to face the wind automatically.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbinePlacementTrigger] = Build a Wind Turbine
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialWindElectricCable] = Electric Cable
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialWindElectricCable] = These low voltage cables can be used to **connect the turbines to each other, and to roads.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialWindElevation] = Elevation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialWindElevation] = You can **lower the elevation to run Electric Cables underground.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbineConnection] = Connecting Turbines
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbineConnection] = **Wind turbines produce low-voltage electricity, and can be connected directly to roads with Electric Cables.**\r\n\r\nCables can be run above ground or underground, and turbines can be daisy-chained to each other before connecting the cable to a road.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ElectricityTutorialWindTurbineConnectionTrigger] = Connect the wind turbine to a road with Electric Cable
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialOutsideTransformer] = Connecting to an Outside Source
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialOutsideTransformer] = **To get electricity from an outside source, you need to build a Transformer Station.**\r\n\r\nThey convert the high voltage electricity coming in from the Power Lines into low voltage electricity and then feed it into the electric cables running underneath roads to be used by buildings.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialOutsideTransformerPlacing] = Building a Transformer Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialOutsideTransformerPlacing] = **Place the Transformer Station next to a road in a central location to get equal distribution to buildings.**\r\n\r\nWell placed Transformer Stations can prevent bottlenecks from forming and keep the flow of electricity efficient.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ElectricityTutorialOutsideTransformerPlacingTrigger] = Build a Transformer Station
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialOutsidePowerLine] = High-voltage Power Line
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialOutsidePowerLine] = High-voltage Power Lines have a high capacity, and they are **used to connect Transformer Stations and Power Plants.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialOutsideElevation] = Power Line Elevation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialOutsideElevation] = To avoid going over roads and buildings, **adjust the elevation down to build underground cables.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityTutorialOutsideConnecting] = Connecting Outside Power
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityTutorialOutsideConnecting] = **Move around your starting map tile and find the incoming Power Line somewhere on the edge.**\r\n\r\nRun a Power Line from it to the Transformer Station you built earlier.\r\n\r\nOnce the connection is established, electricity starts flowing in from a neighboring city.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ElectricityTutorialOutsideConnectingTrigger] = Connect Outside Power
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityFlowTutorial] = Electricity Flow
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityFlowTutorialSelectInfoView] = Electricity Info View
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityFlowTutorialSelectInfoView] = **Electricity info view shows an overlay of electricity flow throughout the city, to help you spot weaknesses and solve problems.**\r\n\r\nElectricity panel also shows detailed information about the performance of the electricity grid, conditions that affect it and where your electricity plants are located.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityFlowTutorialElectricityFlowing] = Electricity Flowing
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityFlowTutorialElectricityFlowing] = Electricity flow is animated to show how much electricity is flowing and where it's going.\r\n\r\n**Low amounts of electricity are shown as short bars. When the electricity flow increases, the bars grow longer.**\r\n\r\n**Note:**Individual buildings receive only the amount they need and most homes use only a small amount of electricity.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityFlowTutorialCableCapacity] = Cable Capacity
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityFlowTutorialCableCapacity] = **There is a limit to how much electricity Electric Cables and Power Lines are able to transfer.**\r\n\r\nWhen there is more electricity trying to flow through the cables and lines than they can handle, the electric grid will suffer and result in buildings not getting enough power.\r\n\r\n**Note:** While Electricity info view is active, you can hover over power lines and cables to see how much electricity is being transferred and how much the capacity is.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityFlowTutorialElectricityBottleneck] = Electricity Bottleneck
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityFlowTutorialElectricityBottleneck] = **When an Electric Cable or Line has exceeded maximum capacity, a bottleneck will form.**\r\n\r\nBottlenecks will start to block electricity flow and cause buildings down the line to not receive electricity.\r\n\r\nTo clear the bottleneck and resume electricity service, you will need to bypass the bottleneck by redirecting electricity flow.
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityFlowTutorialDirectingFlow] = Directing Electricity Flow
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityFlowTutorialDirectingFlow] = **Electricity flow can be directed and diverted with Power Lines and Transformer Stations.**\r\n\r\nTransformer Stations can be placed in areas that need electricity, and connected to the Power Plant with Power Lines.\r\n
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityBottleneckTutorial] = Electricity Bottleneck
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialIntro] = Bottleneck has formed
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialIntro] = **Somewhere there are Electric Cables or Lines that have exceeded their capacity and a Bottleneck has formed.**\r\n\r\nBuildings down the line from the bottleneck have been cut off and are not receiving the electricity they need.\r\n\r\n**Find the electric cable or line that is exceeding capacity.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialSolving] = Solving a Bottleneck
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialSolving] = You will need to bypass the bottleneck area **by redirecting electricity flow with a Transformer Station and some Power Lines.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialTransformerStation] = Build a Transformer Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialTransformerStation] = To bypass the affected area you will need to build a Transformer Station.\r\n\r\n**Place the Transformer Station next to a road past the bottleneck, in a central location to the buildings that are not receiving electricity.**\r\n\r\nIf there is a large area that is not receiving electricity, you can place several Transformer Stations throughout the area.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialTransformerStationTrigger] = Build a Transformer Station
Tutorials.TITLE[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialConnectPowerStation] = Connecting to a Power Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialConnectPowerStation] = **Connect the Transformer Station to a Power Plant with a Power Line.**\r\n\r\nWhen connected, the transformer starts feeding the grid beyond the bottleneck directly from the Power Station, and the bottleneck will be cleared.\r\n\r\n**Note:** If there are buildings and roads in the way, it is easier to build the Power Line underground.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ElectricityBottleneckTutorialsConnectPowerStationTrigger] = Connect Transformer Station
Tutorials.TITLE[Water&SewageGroup] = WATER & SEWAGE
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorial] = Water
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialIntro] = Water
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialIntro] = **Every city needs a good water network.**\r\n\r\nHouseholds, companies and industries all need water to operate and survive.\r\n\r\nWhen the water system is working well, citizens stay healthier, and companies and services are able to operate without problems.
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialGroundwaterStation] = Groundwater Pumping Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialGroundwaterStation] = **Groundwater Pumping Station can be used if your current city limits contain underground water deposits.**\r\n\r\nGroundwater Pumping Stations are placed on the surface, above the water deposit  to provide clean water for the city.
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialPumpingStation] = Water Pumping Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialPumpingStation] = **Water Pumping Station can be used if your current city limits has access to open water.**\r\n\r\nWater Pumping Stations are placed on the shoreline of any open water to provide clean water for the city.
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialWaterSources] = Choose a Pumping Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialWaterSources] = **Select the type of pumping station you want to start with and close this panel to move on.**\r\n\r\nYou can come back to this panel if you change your mind. \r\n\r\nYou can also build more and different types of pumps later on.
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialPlaceGroundwater] = Build a Groundwater Pumping Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialPlaceGroundwater] = **Look around the map and find an area with a groundwater deposit.**\r\n\r\nGroundwater deposits are shown on the ground while the Water & Sewage info view is on.\r\n\r\n**Place the Groundwater Pumping Station over the deposit area.**\r\n\r\n**The darkest area is where there is the most water and where you'll be able to extract as much water as possible.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[WaterTutorialPlaceGroundwaterTrigger] = Build a Groundwater Pumping Station
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialConnectGroundwater] = Connecting  Groundwater Pumping Stations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialConnectGroundwater] = **Pumping Stations need a road connection.**\r\n\r\n**If your station is already built next to a road,** you're all set and the station is connected to the roads utility network.\r\n\r\n**If your station isn't connected to a road,** you'll need to build one.\r\n\r\nLook for the Road Required notification and zoom in to see which side of the building it's on, and build your road along that side. \r\n\r\nYou can use any road with a built-in pipe network. When the station is connected to the rest of the road system, water will be connected as well and start flowing.
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialPlace] = Building a Water Pumping Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialPlace] = Look around the map and locate a good water source.\r\n\r\n**Place the Water Pump on the shoreline.**\r\n\r\nMake sure the location is far enough away and upstream from sources of pollution, to keep the water pumped to the city clean and clear of contamination.\r\n\r\n**Arrows in the water show the direction and strength of the water flow.**\r\n\r\n
Tutorials.TRIGGER[WaterTutorialPlaceTrigger] = Build a Pumping Station
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTutorialConnectWater] = Connecting  Water Pumping Stations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WaterTutorialConnectWater] = **Pumping Stations need a road connection.**\r\n\r\n**If your station is already built next to a road,** you're all set and the station is connected to the roads utility network.\r\n\r\n**If your station isn't connected to a road,** you'll need to build one.\r\n\r\nLook for the Road Required notification and zoom in to see which side of the building it's on, and build your road along that side. \r\n\r\nYou can use any road with a built-in pipe network. When the station is connected to the rest of the road system, water will be connected as well and start flowing.
Tutorials.TITLE[SewageTutorial] = Sewage
Tutorials.TITLE[SewageTutorialIntro] = Sewage
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SewageTutorialIntro] = **A good sewage network is essential to a city.**\r\n\r\nIf sewage is not properly managed, it can have negative effects on the city and its citizens.\r\n\r\n**Sewage pipes are included in the road utility network.** Separate pipes can be built to connect sewage outlets that are not connected to a road.
Tutorials.TITLE[SewageTutorialOutlet] = Sewage Outlet
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SewageTutorialOutlet] = As clean water is used, it becomes sewage. \r\n\r\n**Sewage Outlets expel the wastewater from the water network.**
Tutorials.TITLE[SewageTutorialPlaceOutlet] = Building a Sewage Outlet
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SewageTutorialPlaceOutlet] = Find an area with open, flowing water.\r\n\r\n**Place the sewage outlet on the shoreline.**\r\n\r\nTo avoid polluting clean water sources,  place the outlet far from groundwater deposits and downstream from any Water Pumping Stations.\r\n\r\n**Note:** Sewage Outlets don't require electricity or a road connection to operate, but it will need to be connected to the sewage network with a pipe.\r\n\r\n
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SewageTutorialPlaceOutletTrigger] = Build a Sewage Outlet
Tutorials.TITLE[SewageTutorialPipe] = Sewage Pipe
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SewageTutorialPipe] = **A single Sewage Pipe** to connect Sewage Outlets to the roads utility network.
Tutorials.TITLE[SewageTutorialConnectPipe] = Connecting the Sewage Outlet
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SewageTutorialConnectPipe] = **Find the nearest road that has the built in utility network.**\r\n\r\nSewage piping will be highlighted while the Sewage Pipe is selected and Water & Sewage info view is active.\r\n\r\n**Connect the Sewage Outlet to the road utility network with the Sewage Pipe.**\r\n\r\n**Note:** Highways don't have built in utility networks, and you can't connect to an individual building's pipe connection.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SewageTutorialConnectPipeTrigger] = Connect the Sewage Outlet to the existing network.
Tutorials.TITLE[Health&DeathcareGroup] = HEALTHCARE & DEATHCARE
Tutorials.TITLE[HealthcareTutorial] = Healthcare
Tutorials.TITLE[HealthcareTutorialIntro] = Healthcare
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[HealthcareTutorialIntro] = **Good healthcare system helps prevent diseases and untimely deaths by treating the sick and injured.**\r\n\r\nHealthcare services also keep citizens healthier and happier by giving advice and information. 
Tutorials.TITLE[HealthcareTutorialIntroMedicalBuildings] = Clinics and Hospitals
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[HealthcareTutorialIntroMedicalBuildings] = **Sick citizens visit clinics and hospitals for treatment on their own or, if they are in serious condition, an ambulance will be sent out to pick them up.**\r\n\r\nMedical Clinics and Hospitals have a set of ambulances at their disposal, and a limited amount of room for patients. \r\n\r\nMedical buildings can be upgraded to increase the capacity of both.
Tutorials.TITLE[HealthcareTutorialMedicalClinic] = Building Healthcare services
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[HealthcareTutorialMedicalClinic] = **Build medical facilities in central locations, close to the citizens, and with easy road access.**\r\n\r\nIf patients need to travel far to get treatment, it takes them longer to get better and the likelihood of deaths increases.\r\n\r\nEach Clinic and Hospital can only treat and care for a limited number of people. Opening the building info panel will guide you on how well a facility is working.\r\n\r\n**As your population increases, you will need to build more facilities.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[HealthcareTutorialMedicalClinicTrigger] = Build a Medical Clinic
Tutorials.TITLE[DeathcareTutorial] = Deathcare
Tutorials.TITLE[DeathcareTutorialIntro] = Deathcare
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DeathcareTutorialIntro] = Each citizen will eventually pass away. **Deathcare services exist to take care of the deceased.**
Tutorials.TITLE[DeathcareTutorialCemetery] = Cemetery
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DeathcareTutorialCemetery] = **Cemeteries are large, park-like locations where deceased citizens are buried.**\r\n\r\nHearses pick up the deceased and transport them to the cemetery for burial.
Tutorials.TITLE[DeathcareTutorialPlaceCemetery] = Building a Cemetery
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DeathcareTutorialPlaceCemetery] = Citizens like to visit Cemeteries. Cemeteries also increase the well-being of nearby citizens.\r\n \r\n**Find a nice place, close to housing, with good traffic connections to build your cemetery in.**\r\n\r\nEach Cemetery has a limited number of graves, so as your city grows, you will most likely need to build more than one.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[DeathcareTutorialPlaceCemeteryTrigger] = Build a Cemetery
Tutorials.TITLE[GarbageManagementGroup] = GARBAGE MANAGEMENT
Tutorials.TITLE[GarbageTutorial] = GARBAGE MANAGEMENT
Tutorials.TITLE[GarbageTutorialIntro] = Garbage Management
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[GarbageTutorialIntro] = Good Garbage management system keeps citizens healthier and happier.\r\n\r\n**Garbage management facilities send out trucks that collect waste from around the city and bring it back for processing.**\r\n
Tutorials.TITLE[GarbageTutorialIntroLandfill] = Landfill
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[GarbageTutorialIntroLandfill] = Landfill is the basic Garbage Management facility. \r\n\r\n**Collected garbage is stored in the dumping area, also known as a lot.**
Tutorials.TITLE[GarbageTutorialLandfill] = Building a Landfill
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[GarbageTutorialLandfill] = Garbage Management buildings generate pollution in their vicinity, so take care when choosing a location.\r\n\r\n**Place the main building in a location that has plenty of room for the lot starting from the back of the building.**\r\n\r\nThe circle around the building marks how far you can extend the lot from the building.\r\n\r\n**Place the building and define the area for the lot.**\r\n\r\n**Note:** When the lot gets full you will need to start the emptying process from the building information panel. Information panels open by selecting the building.\r\n\r\nHaving a good road network across the city is important to maintain a good Garbage Management process.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[GarbageTutorialLandfillTrigger] = Build a Landfill
Tutorials.TITLE[GarbageTutorialLandfillAdjustment] = Adjusting the lot size
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[GarbageTutorialLandfillAdjustment] = You can increase and decrease the capacity of a lot, or reshape it to manage area pollution.\r\n\r\n**To adjust the lot, select the Lot Tool. Grab a node on the lot and drag it to where you want it.**\r\n\r\nYou can also select the line between nodes to create a new node.\r\n\r\nYou can reshape the lot whenever you want.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[GarbageTutorialLandfillAdjustmentTrigger] = Adjust the Landfill lot
Tutorials.TITLE[EducationGroup] = EDUCATION & RESEARCH
Tutorials.TITLE[EducationTutorial] = Education
Tutorials.TITLE[EducationTutorialIntro] = Education
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EducationTutorialIntro] = **Education city services provide citizens with schools, colleges and universities.**\r\n\r\nCitizen education affects their job position and the income level of their household.\r\n\r\nCitizens have different preferences for their level of education, affected by their well-being and job opportunities in the city.
Tutorials.TITLE[EducationTutorialIntroEducationLevels] = Education Levels
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EducationTutorialIntroEducationLevels] = **Citizens' education is separated into five levels, ranging from Uneducated to Highly Educated.**\r\n\r\nThe types of jobs available in the city and the number of open positions affect which educational services are needed.
Tutorials.TITLE[EducationTutorialIntroEducationPath] = Education Path
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EducationTutorialIntroEducationPath] = **Education Path is citizens schooling from the lowest level to the highest level.**\r\n\r\nTo fill jobs that require a low level of education, the city only needs to provide lower level schooling facilities. \r\n\r\nTo provide employees for jobs with a higher education requirement, citizens need the entire education path from lower level schooling to higher education.
Tutorials.TITLE[ResearchTutorial] = Research
Tutorials.TITLE[ResearchTutorialIntro] = Research Facilities
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ResearchTutorialIntro] = **Research facilities advance and benefit the city in many ways.**\r\n\r\nThey help citizens graduate from higher education and aid in utilising natural resources.
Tutorials.TITLE[ResearchTutorialScientist] = Scientists
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ResearchTutorialScientist] = **Research facilities need highly educated people.** \r\n\r\nFor Research Facilities to function well, it's beneficial for the city to invest in colleges and universities.
Tutorials.TITLE[Fire&RescueGroup] = FIRE & RESCUE
Tutorials.TITLE[FireAndRescueTutorial] = Fire & Rescue
Tutorials.TITLE[FireAndRescueTutorialIntro] = Fire Department
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FireAndRescueTutorialIntro] = The Fire and Rescue city service **responds to fires and accidents, prevents fires from spreading, and safeguards citizens against disasters.**\r\n\r\nThey also search for survivors in collapsed buildings after a disaster.
Tutorials.TITLE[FireAndRescueTutorialFireFighting] = Fire Fighting
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FireAndRescueTutorialFireFighting] = Fires damage buildings and can quickly spread to other buildings nearby.\r\n\r\nIf the response time of the Fire and Rescue service is too long, buildings are at a greater risk of burning down.\r\n\r\n**To ensure the quickest response time, make sure roads stay clear and that there are enough Fire Engines available.**
Tutorials.TITLE[FireAndRescueTutorialFireTrucks] = Fire Engines
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FireAndRescueTutorialFireTrucks] = Fire Houses and Fire Stations house a number of Fire Engines.\r\n\r\n**Fire Engines are able to extinguish multiple fires in succession before returning.**\r\n\r\nFire Engines can also extinguish Forest Fires that are close enough to the road.
Tutorials.TITLE[FireAndRescueTutorialFireDamage] = Fire Damage
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FireAndRescueTutorialFireDamage] = **Buildings that have been damaged but have not collapsed will get repaired automatically.**\r\n\r\nThe cost of repairs is taken from the residents' rent.\r\n\r\nIf a building burns down and collapses, it will be automatically cleared after a time. A new building will get built in its place. \r\n\r\n**You can always bulldoze collapsed buildings manually to speed up rebuilding.**
Tutorials.TITLE[FireAndRescueTutorialFireSafety] = Fire Safety
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FireAndRescueTutorialFireSafety] = **The likelihood of fires in the city depends on the fire hazard levels.**\r\n\r\nYou can increase the safety of your city and its citizens by making sure all areas have good coverage. This means having enough Fire Houses and Stations in close proximity, and upgrading them as needed.\r\n\r\nThere are also Policies that you can activate to increase building safety.
Tutorials.TITLE[DisasterControlTutorial] = Disaster Control
Tutorials.TITLE[DisasterControlTutorialIntro] = Disaster Control
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DisasterControlTutorialIntro] = Disaster Control service buildings **help both in detecting oncoming natural disasters and safely housing citizens** that have been affected by a disaster. 
Tutorials.TITLE[Police&AdministrationGroup] = POLICE & ADMINISTRATION
Tutorials.TITLE[PoliceTutorial] = Police
Tutorials.TITLE[PoliceTutorialIntro] = Police
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PoliceTutorialIntro] = Crime is an unfortunate downside to building a community. \r\n\r\n**The purpose of law enforcement is to both prevent crime as well as to catch criminals.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PoliceTutorialResponse] = Patrol Cars
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PoliceTutorialResponse] = **Police Stations and Headquarters send out police cars to patrol the city and respond to criminal activity.**\r\n\r\nApprehended criminals are brought in and kept in holding cells to wait for further processing, such as a trial.
Tutorials.TITLE[PoliceTutorialCrime] = Crime
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PoliceTutorialCrime] = **Low overall well-being and unemployment increase the likelihood of citizens becoming criminals.**\r\n\r\nSo in addition to investing in the police force, also make sure your citizens are doing well in order to prevent crime.
Tutorials.TITLE[AdministrationTutorial] = Administration
Tutorials.TITLE[AdministrationTutorialIntro] = Administration Buildings
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[AdministrationTutorialIntro] = Administrative buildings **have a positive effect on citizen well-being, policies, trade, taxation, and the economy as a whole.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TransportationGroup] = TRANSPORTATION
Tutorials.TITLE[PublicTransportationTutorial] = Public Transportation
Tutorials.TITLE[PublicTransportationTutorialIntro] = Public Transportation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PublicTransportationTutorialIntro] = Different means of public transportation offer convenient ways for citizens and tourists to move around and for goods to be delivered.\r\n\r\n**Well organised public transportation decreases traffic congestion and lowers the overall cost of transportation.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PublicTransportationTutorialPassenger] = Passenger Transportation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PublicTransportationTutorialPassenger] = **Using Busses,Trains, Ships and Airplanes for passengers lowers the cost of traveling for citizens and tourists.**\r\n\r\nPublic transportation makes it possible for more people to easily visit your city and bring in tourism revenue.\r\n\r\nCitizens using public transportation have more money to use on goods and services and, with good public transportation coverage, people can quickly move to where they need to go.
Tutorials.TITLE[PublicTransportationTutorialCargo] = Cargo Transportation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PublicTransportationTutorialCargo] = **Using Trains, Ships and Airplanes for transporting cargo lowers the cost of shipping goods and materials.**\r\n\r\nThis results in more businesses that are profitable and able to provide jobs and pay taxes. \r\n\r\nWhen the production of goods and materials is going well in the city, any surplus can be exported for further profit.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadTransportGroup] = Road
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorial] = Bus
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialIntro] = Buses
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialIntro] = **Buses are the easiest way to start a public transportation network in your city.**\r\n\r\nThey offer citizens and tourists a convenient way to get around and decrease traffic congestion.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialDepot] = Bus Depot
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialDepot] = **To start a bus service you will first need a Bus Depot.**\r\n\r\nThe depot houses a fleet of buses and has facilities to handle their maintenance.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialPlaceDepot] = Build a Bus Depot
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialPlaceDepot] = **A good place to build your Depot is somewhere away from high traffic, and with room to expand later.**\r\n\r\nDepots don't need to be in the immediate vicinity of the area where your buses operate.\r\n\r\nBus lines do not need to pass through depots, and a single depot can supply buses for multiple lines. \r\n\r\n**Make sure buses going out from the depot have road access to your planned route, and that it's still close enough for efficient operation.**\r\n
Tutorials.TRIGGER[BusTutorialPlaceDepotTrigger] = Build a Bus Depot
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialStation] = Bus Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialStation] = **Bus Stations work as large bus stops, and a single station can accommodate several bus lines.**\r\n \r\nStations can also be upgraded and expanded to include Taxi services. \r\n\r\nBus Stations can handle a high number of passengers, but are not required to start a bus line.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialStop] = Bus Stops
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialStop] = To create a Bus Line you will need Bus Stops, which buses use to pick up and drop off passengers.\r\n\r\n**Bus Stops can be placed on either side of the road,** wherever you want  buses to make a stop along the line.\r\n\r\n**Bus Stops create a short stopping lane on the road** where they are placed.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialShelter] = Bus Shelter
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialShelter] = ** Bus Shelter is an alternative to the Bus Stop,**\r\n\r\nShelters are more expensive to build, but provide passengers with a nicer place to wait for the bus, especially in bad weather.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialStyle] = Bus Stop Style
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialStyle] = **Changing the Theme will also change the style of bus stops and shelters.**\r\n\r\nThe change is not applied to previously built Bus Stops and Shelters.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialStopPlacement] = Bus Stop Placement
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialStopPlacement] = **To make a bus line, you need at least 2 stops.** Place these in locations that are convenient for citizens.\r\n\r\nStops can be either Bus Stops, Bus Shelters or Bus Stations.\r\n\r\n**Keep an eye on which side of the road you place your stops on, as it affects the route buses take.**\r\n\r\nStops can always be moved later in case you misplace them or wish to change where the line runs.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[BusTutorialStopTrigger] = Build at least 2 Bus Stops
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialRoute] = Bus Line Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialRoute] = **Bus Line Tool is used to connect Bus Stops, Shelters and Stations in a loop, creating a bus line between the selected stops.**\r\n\r\nThere is no limit to how many lines are able to use a particular stop, so several different lines can share stops.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialRoutePlacement] = Create a Bus Line
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialRoutePlacement] = **Select each stop, shelter and station, in the order you would like the Bus Line to operate.**\r\n\r\n**Complete the loop by selecting the stop that you started the line with.**\r\n\r\nThe line will automatically follow the correct traffic lanes. If you have stops on opposite sides of the road, the line will turn back around by using the closest available roads. \r\n\r\nWhen you have completed the line, **buses will automatically be sent out from the Bus Depot to begin operating the line.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[BusTutorialRouteTrigger] = Connect your Line
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialAddingStops] = Adding New Bus Stops
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialAddingStops] = You can add more stops to any line you've already created.\r\n\r\n**Place one or more stops or stations to where you wish the route to go.**\r\n\r\n**Then, select the Bus Line tool, grab your existing line at the nearest point to your new stop, and drag the line to the stop.**\r\n \r\nThe line will snap to the stop and the stop is now a part of the line.\r\n\r\nRepeat as needed to include more than one new stop.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialRelocateStop] = Relocating stops
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialRelocateStop] = To relocate a stop, **close the Transportation menu.**\r\n\r\n**Select the stop you want to move.** This will open the Line Information Panel.\r\n\r\nIn the Bus Stop's Information Panel, **select the relocate icon and move the stop to a new location.**\r\n\r\nAll Lines will stay with the stop and adjust according to the new location.\r\n\r\n**Note:**You can also select stops in the Line Information Panel.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialDeletingStops] = Removing Bus Stops
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialDeletingStops] = **You can remove bus stops with the bulldozer.**\r\n\r\nBulldozing a stop **doesn't affect the lines** that were using the stop.\r\n\r\n**Note:** If you have trouble locating the stops on the map, you can use the Line Information Panel to select them.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusTutorialRerouting] = Rerouting Bus Lines
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusTutorialRerouting] = **If you would like your line to follow a different path from the one that is automatically created, you can add waypoints to the line.**\r\n\r\nWaypoints won't pick up passengers and don't need bus stops, they are there to adjust the route the buses take.\r\n\r\n**To add waypoints, select the Bus Line Tool. Then, grab the line at a convenient point,  and drag and drop it to where you want it.**\r\n\r\nA new waypoint is created. \r\n\r\nYou can continue to add and move waypoints by dragging and dropping them.
Tutorials.TITLE[BusOutsideTutorial] = Bus Line Outside Connection
Tutorials.TITLE[BusOutsideTutorialIntro] = Bus Lines to other cities
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusOutsideTutorialIntro] = To alleviate the traffic jams caused by people coming in to the city, **you can make Bus Line connections to the outside world.**
Tutorials.TITLE[BusOutsideTutorialConnect] = Connecting Bus Line to an Outside Connection
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BusOutsideTutorialConnect] = **Move around and locate the outside connection marker at the edge of the map area.**\r\n\r\nYou don't need to own the map tiles all the way to the marker, you just need to have one tile with a part of the road that leads to the marker.\r\n\r\nYou will need at least one bus stop in your city. Make sure your bus stop is on a road that has access to the marker.\r\n\r\n**Select the Bus Line Tool and create a line by selecting one or more bus stops. Include the Outside Connection marker as a stop in your bus line.**\r\n\r\nYou can also add the Outside Connection marker to an existing line by dragging and dropping the line to the connection point.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[BusOutsideTutorialConnectTrigger] = Connect Bus Line to the Outside
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxiTutorial] = Taxi
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxiTutorialIntro] = Taxi Service
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxiTutorialIntro] = Taxis are a good transportation option for places that have no other public transportation nearby.\r\n\r\n**To get a taxi service going, all you need is a taxi depot.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxiTutorialDepot] = Build a Taxi Depot 
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxiTutorialDepot] = **Taxi Depot is the center of operations for taxis.**\r\nIt houses a dispatch office, a fleet of taxis and a repair crew. \r\n\r\n**For good service, place the depot in a central location with room to expand.**\r\n\r\nAfter building a Taxi Depot, dispatchers start sending out taxis to customers. 
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TaxiTutorialDepotTrigger] = Build a Taxi Depot
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxiTutorialStandIntro] = Taxi Stands
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxiTutorialStandIntro] = For faster and more efficient taxi service, **Taxi Stands can be placed by the roadside around the city.** \r\n\r\nStands are a quicker way for customers to get a taxi than waiting for dispatch to send one from the depot.
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxiTutorialStand] = Place a Taxi Stand
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxiTutorialStand] = **Place Taxi Stands in locations where you feel customers might need them most.**\r\n\r\nPlacing a stand will automatically create space on the side of the road for taxis to park there to wait for customers.\r\n\r\n**When a stand is in place, the depot will send out taxis to the stand to wait for customers.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TaxiTutorialStandTrigger] = Place a Taxi Stand
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainGroup] = Trains
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainTutorial] = Trains
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainTutorialIntro] = Train services
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TrainTutorialIntro] = **Trains come in two types, one for passengers and another for cargo.**\r\n\r\nBoth can use Outside Connections wherever they are available. 
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainTutorialRailYard] = Rail Yards
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TrainTutorialRailYard] = **Both passenger and cargo trains require a Rail Yard as a depot.**\r\n\r\nCargo Harbors and Airports also have the option of building an upgrade that allows cargo trains to transport cargo directly to and from them.
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainTutorialPlaceRailYard] = Build a Rail Yard
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TrainTutorialPlaceRailYard] = **To get started with the train service, first build a Rail Yard.**\r\n\r\nMake sure to have plenty of free space around the yard so that you can build your tracks without any tight corners.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TrainTutorialPlaceRailYardTrigger] = Build a Rail Yard
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorial] = Passenger Trains
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorialTrainStation] = Passenger Train Service
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerTrainTutorialTrainStation] = **To get started with the Passenger train service, you will need Train Stations.**\r\n\r\nInside the city, passenger trains use Train Stations as stops. These are where passengers can get on and off the trains.
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorialPlaceTrainStation] = Build a Train Station
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerTrainTutorialPlaceTrainStation] = Place your Train Station at a convenient distance from where people live and work.\r\n\r\nAlso ensure that the station has good access to the road network, so citizens can easily arrive at the station.\r\n\r\n**Leave plenty of room on both ends of the station** so you can build train tracks with gentle, sloping curves.\r\n\r\n**For service within the city, build at least 2 stations.**\r\n\r\nFor train service to the outside world you'll only need 1 station, but check your map first if you have access to tracks going to an outside connection.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[PassengerTrainTutorialPlaceTrainStationTrigger] = Build Train Stations
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorialTracks] = Train Tracks
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerTrainTutorialTracks] = For trains to be able to run from station to station, the stations need to be connected by tracks. \r\n\r\n**Choose the type of train track you'd like to use.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorialCurveTool] = Curve Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerTrainTutorialCurveTool] = When building tracks, remember that trains cannot make tight turns due to their length. \r\n\r\n**To create smooth bends without abrupt corners, use the Curve tool option.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorialBuildTrainTracks] = Building Train Tracks
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerTrainTutorialBuildTrainTracks] = **Now that you have your stations, connect them to each other with Train Tracks.**\r\n\r\nRemember to also connect the rail network to the Rail Yard so that trains dispatched from the yard can reach the stations.\r\n\r\nIf you're aiming for an outside connection, build a connection to the tracks leading to the outside connection.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[PassengerTrainTutorialBuildTrainTracksTrigger] = Build Train Tracks
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorialLineTool] = Passenger Railway Line Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerTrainTutorialLineTool] = Passenger Railway Line Tool **is used to connect existing stations to create a railway line.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerTrainTutorialRailwayLine] = Making a Railway Line
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerTrainTutorialRailwayLine] = **Select each Train Station in the order you'd like the train service to run, making a loop.**\r\n\r\nMake sure trains have access to the platform you have selected, also check that the tracks allow trains to return back to the beginning station.\r\n\r\n**Complete the loop by selecting the station platform where you started from.**\r\n\r\nWhen you have completed the loop,your line is complete and trains will automatically be sent out from the Rail Yard and begin operating the line.\r\n\r\nIf you have access to an outside connection, it can be added to the line as a station.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[PassengerTrainTutorialRailwayLineTrigger] = Make a Railway Line
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainOutsideTutorial] = Passenger Railway Line Outside Connection
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainOutsideTutorialIntro] = Railway Line to Other Cities
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainOutsideTutorialAccess] = Access to an Outside Connection Point
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TrainOutsideTutorialAccess] = **Check to see if the map already has existing tracks that are connected to an Outside Connection Point, and that you own a Map Tile with part of that track in it.**\r\n\r\n**If Yes,** you only need to connect your tracks to the ones leading outside to enable train traffic to and from the outside world.\r\n\r\n**if No,** you will need to buy map tiles to reach either a part of the track leading to the outside connection, or all the way to the edge of the map where the connection point is.\r\n\r\nAs with all tracks, make sure the connection is a smooth curve.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TrainOutsideTutorialAccessTrigger] = Build train tracks to connect with the existing tracks
Tutorials.TITLE[TrainOutsideTutorialConnect] = Connecting a Passenger Railway Line to Outside
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TrainOutsideTutorialConnect] = You will need to have at least one Train Station built in your city.\r\n\r\n**With the Passenger Railway Line Tool, select one or more stations and the Outside Connection Point.**\r\n\r\n**Complete the line by selecting the first station again, creating a loop.**\r\n\r\nKeep an eye on what platforms you have selected, and that trains from those platforms can run to the outside connection.\r\n\r\nOnce finished, trains will automatically be sent out from the Rail Yard and begin operating the line.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TrainOutsideTutorialConnectTrigger] = Connect a Passenger Railway Line to an Outside Connection Point
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorial] = Cargo Trains
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorialTrainTerminal] = Cargo Train Terminals
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainTutorialTrainTerminal] = **To get started with the Cargo train service, you will need Cargo Train Terminals.**\r\n\r\nCargo trains use Cargo Train Terminals to load and unload cargo.
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorialPlacingTerminal] = Building a Cargo Train Terminal
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainTutorialPlacingTerminal] = **Choose a location for the terminal that is close to industrial areas, where materials are needed.**\r\n\r\nAlso ensure that the terminal has good access to the road network, so trucks can easily bring in and take away cargo.\r\n\r\n**Make sure there is plenty of room around the terminal** for you to build train tracks with gentle, sloping curves.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoTrainTutorialPlacingTerminalTrigger] = Build a Cargo Terminal
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorialTracks] = Train Tracks
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainTutorialTracks] = For trains to be able to run from terminal to terminal, the terminals need to be connected by tracks. \r\n\r\n**Choose the type of train track you'd like to use.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoTrainTutorialTracksTrigger] = Connect your Terminals to Form a Loop
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorialCurveTool] = Curve Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainTutorialCurveTool] = When building tracks, remember that trains can't make tight turns due to their length. \r\n\r\n**To create smooth bends without abrupt corners, use the Curve Tool Option.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorialBuildTracks] = Building Train Tracks
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainTutorialBuildTracks] = **Now that you have your terminals, connect them to each other with Train Tracks.**\r\n\r\nTake advantage of elevation and build tunnels or elevated tracks in already populated areas.\r\n\r\nRemember to also connect the rail network to your Rail Yard so that trains can reach the terminals.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoTrainTutorialBuildTracksTrigger] = Build Train Tracks
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorialRouteTool] = Cargo Route Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainTutorialRouteTool] = The Cargo Railway Route Tool **is used to create routes that run from one terminal to the next.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainTutorialMakeRoute] = Making Cargo Routes
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainTutorialMakeRoute] = **Select each Cargo Train Terminal in the order you would like the cargo route to run, making a loop.**\r\n\r\n**Complete the loop by selecting the first terminal again.**\r\n\r\nWhen you have completed the loop, your route is done and trains will automatically be sent out from the Rail Yard and begin operating the route.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoTrainTutorialMakeRouteTrigger] = Make a Cargo Route
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainOutsideTutorial] = Cargo Railway Route Outside Connection
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainOutsideTutorialIntro] = Cargo trains to other cities
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainOutsideTutorialIntro] = To enable cheaper and more efficient delivery of goods and materials in and out of the city, **you can create Cargo Railway Routes to the outside world.**\r\n\r\nUsing cargo trains for import and export lowers the number of delivery trucks on the highways, alleviating traffic jams.
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoTrainOutsideTutorialConnect] = Connecting to Outside Connection
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoTrainOutsideTutorialConnect] = You will need to have at least one Cargo Train Terminal built in your city.\r\n\r\nWith the Cargo Railway Route Tool, **select one or more terminals and the Outside Connection Point.**\r\n\r\n**Complete the route by selecting the first terminal again, creating a loop.**\r\n\r\nOnce finished, trains will automatically be sent out from the Rail Yard and begin operating the route, delivering goods and materials to and from the terminals. Delivery trucks will then handle their further distribution.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoTrainOutsideTutorialConnectTrigger] = Connect Cargo Route
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorial] = Tram
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialIntro] = Trams
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialIntro] = Trams are a handy way of transporting a large number of citizens around the city. \r\n\r\n**Tram tracks can be flexibly built on top of existing streets as well as standalone networks.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialTramDepot] = Tram Depot
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialTramDepot] = **To start a tram line you'll first need a Tram Depot.**\r\n\r\nThe depot houses and maintains a fleet of trams. More can be built as the city and citizen needs grow.
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialTramDepotPlace] = Building a Tram Depot
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialTramDepotPlace] = **Place the Tram Depot next to a road that is large enough to easily accommodate tracks.**\r\n\r\nMake sure the intersection can handle traffic and the trams coming in and out of the Depot.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TramTutorialTramDepotPlaceTrigger] = Build a Tram Depot
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialOneWayTrack] = One-Way Tram Track
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialOneWayTrack] = **The one-way track has one set of rails, with trams traveling in one direction.**\r\n\r\nUseful if you need to navigate through narrow spaces.
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialDoubleTrack] = Double Tram Track
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialDoubleTrack] = **The double track has two sets of rails running in opposite directions.**\r\n\r\nIt's a handy way of building a two-way tram network in just one go.
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialPlaceTracks] = Build  Tram Tracks
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialPlaceTracks] = **Build Tram Tracks to places where citizens would like to go.**\r\n\r\nTrams can navigate corners better than trains, but can still run into trouble if the track has curves that are too tight. \r\n\r\nYou can get creative with the tool modes and build tracks that run in tunnels, or overpasses.\r\n\r\nIf you want the tracks to run on an existing road, use the Replace tool while you have the track selected.\r\n\r\n**Remember to have the tracks connected to the Tram Depot.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TramTutorialPlaceTracksTrigger] = Build a set of Tram Tracks
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialTramStops] = Tram Stops
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialTramStops] = Tram Stops are where trams **pick up and drop off passengers.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialPlaceStops] = Place Tram Stops
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialPlaceStops] = **Stops can be placed on either side of the tracks,** so pay attention when setting them up and planning your tram lines.\r\n\r\nPlace stops in places that are convenient for citizens to get on and off and where you think they benefit the city best.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TramTutorialPlaceStopsTrigger] = Place at least two stops
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialTramLine] = Tram Line Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialTramLine] = Tram Line Tool **is used to connect existing stops to create a tram line.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TramTutorialPlaceTramLine] = Creating a Tram Line
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TramTutorialPlaceTramLine] = **With the Tram Line Tool, select Tram Stops in the order you would like the line to run in, making a loop**\r\n\r\n**To complete the Tram Line, select the first stop again to close the loop.**\r\n\r\nYou can build overlapping lines where the same Tram Stop services many Tram Lines.\r\n\r\nThe Tram Depot does not need to be part of the line. It's enough to have tracks running past it. Trams will start operating automatically once you create your first Tram Line.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TramTutorialPlaceTramLineTrigger] = Make a Tram Line
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorial] = Subway
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialIntro] = Subway
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialIntro] = **Subway trains are a great way to build public transportation in a busy city.**\r\n\r\nUnderground tunnels for Subways can be built anywhere without obstructing other traffic.
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialYard] = Subway Yard
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialYard] = To get started with subways, **first build a Subway Yard,** which will serve as a depot for the trains.
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialPlaceYard] = Building a Subway Yard
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialPlaceYard] = **Find a large enough open area,** somewhere not too far from the area where you plan to build your subway line.\r\n\r\n**Make sure to have free space on both ends of the yard** so you have enough room to build track connections for Subway Trains to come in and go out.\r\n\r\n**Note** that even though subway tracks run underground, there will need to be enough room on the ends of the subway yard tracks to make a low slope upwards or downwards.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SubwayTutorialPlaceYardTrigger] = Build a Subway Yard
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialUndergroundStation] = Underground Subway Stations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialUndergroundStation] = The underground station is a handy way to provide passengers access to the subway.\r\n\r\nThe station entrance only takes a small space above ground, while **most of the station and the tracks are located 20 meters below the surface.**
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialOvergroundStation] = Overground Subway Stations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialOvergroundStation] = The overground station is the cheaper way to provide passengers access to the subway.\r\n\r\nThe station and tracks are placed on the surface, so they **take up more space. You'll need to also leave room for tracks that lead underground.**
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialPlaceStations] = Build Subway Stations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialPlaceStations] = Subway Stations are where passengers can get on and off the trains. Place them in locations where you feel they serve the passengers best.\r\n\r\n**You will need at least 2 subway stations to start a subway line.**\r\n\r\nMake sure to have enough room to slope the tracks up or down as needed.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SubwayTutorialPlaceStationsTrigger] = Build at least 2 Subway Stations
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialDoubleTrack] = Double Subway Track
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialDoubleTrack] = **The double track has two sets of rails running in opposite directions.**\r\n\r\nIt's a handy way of building a two-way subway network in just one go.
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialOneWayTrack] = One-Way Subway Track
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialOneWayTrack] = **The one-way track has a single set of rails, with trains traveling in one direction.**\r\n\r\nUseful if you want to build one-way routes, or build two directions but keep them separate from each other.
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialBuildTracks] = Build Tracks
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialBuildTracks] = **Now that you have your stations placed, connect them with Subway Tracks.**\r\n\r\n**Remember to also build tracks to connect the Subway Yard to the rest of the track network.**\r\n\r\nSubway tracks can run on various elevation levels, so you can build several lines that cross each other underground. You can also build tracks overground to cross over roads and buildings. \r\n\r\nWhen building tracks, remember that trains cannot make tight turns due to their length. To create smooth bends, use the Curve tool option.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SubwayTutorialBuildTracksTrigger] = Build Subway Tracks
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialLineTool] = Subway Line Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialLineTool] = Subway Line Tool **is used to connect existing stations to create a subway line.**
Tutorials.TITLE[SubwayTutorialConnectLine] = Connecting Stations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SubwayTutorialConnectLine] = Use the Subway Line Tool to create a line between your stations.\r\n\r\n**Select the stations in the order you want the line to run, include all stations that you want to be part of the line and complete the loop by selecting the station you started with.**\r\n\r\nOnce the line is complete, subway trains will start operating automatically. You can build new stations, tracks, and lines as needed.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SubwayTutorialConnectLineTrigger] = Create a Subway Line
Tutorials.TITLE[WaterTransportationGroup] = Water
Tutorials.TITLE[SeawaysTutorial] = Seaways
Tutorials.TITLE[SeawaysTutorialIntro] = Ships
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SeawaysTutorialIntro] = **Ships are able to carry a large number of passengers and huge amounts of cargo.**\r\n\r\nThey are a good way to establish tourist routes and cheaper transportation for goods and materials.
Tutorials.TITLE[SeawaysTutorialSeawaySizes] = Seaway
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SeawaysTutorialSeawaySizes] = **Seaways are lanes assigned on the water marking the area where ships are allowed to travel.**\r\n\r\nSeaways have ship traffic going both directions. The wider the lane, the more ships are able to use simultaneously.
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerShipsTutorial] = Passenger Ships
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerShipsTutorialHarbor] = Harbor
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerShipsTutorialHarbor] = **Passenger ships operate from Harbors.** \r\n\r\nPassenger ships can carry a large number of passengers from one Harbor to another as well as to and from Outside Connections.
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerShipsTutorialPlaceHarbor] = Build a Harbor
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerShipsTutorialPlaceHarbor] = **Find a suitable place on the shoreline, with enough room on the water to fit the Harbor.**\r\n\r\nLook around and check how the existing waterways are shaped and where they lead.\r\n\r\nShips might not fit through narrow passages, or under low bridges.\r\n\r\nHarbors will also need a road connection so passengers have access to it.\r\n
Tutorials.TRIGGER[PassengerShipsTutorialPlaceHarborTrigger] = Build a Harbor
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerShipsTutorialPlaceSeaway] = Build a Seaway
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerShipsTutorialPlaceSeaway] = **Choose the size of the seaway to build with.**\r\n\r\nYou can connect different sizes to each other and replace existing ones at any time.\r\n\r\nIf you want to connect to places further away, you'll need to buy enough map tiles with waterways connecting to where you want to go.\r\n\r\n**Note:**When planning your route, you might need to replace low bridges with higher ones to let ships pass under them.\r\n\r\nIf you're aiming for an outside connection, you can connect to a ready-built seaway if part of it is in a map tile you own.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[PassengerShipsTutorialPlaceSeawayTrigger] = Build a Seaway
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerShipsTutorialPassangerLine] = Passenger Ship Line Tool **is used to place waypoints for Passenger Ships to follow.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerShipsTutorialConnectingLine] = Make a Passenger Ship Line
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerShipsTutorialConnectingLine] = **With the Passenger Ship Line Tool, select a Ship Dock in your Harbor, and place waypoints to create a line where you want the ships to go.**\r\n\r\n**Loop back to the Ship Dock you started from to complete the route.**\r\n\r\nIf you have more than one Harbor, you can include them in the line, people can then use the ships as means of traveling.\r\n\r\nYou can also build a sightseeing line by creating a loop with only waypoints in it.\r\n\r\n**Note:** You can add new waypoints and harbors after the line is complete.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[PassengerShipsTutorialConnectingLineTrigger] = Create a Passenger Ship Line
Tutorials.TITLE[ShipOutsideTutorial] = Cruise Line Outside Connection
