Tutorials.TITLE[ShipOutsideTutorialIntro] = Cruise Lines to other cities
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ShipOutsideTutorialIntro] = Cruises are not just fun but useful. Passenger Ships coming in from neighboring cities can carry tourist and people moving into the city.\r\n\r\n**For some fun and taking the pressure off of roads, you can make a Passenger Ship Line to the Outside World.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ShipOutsideTutorialAccess] = Access to an Outside Seaway
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ShipOutsideTutorialAccess] = **Check to see if the map has an existing seaway that connects to an Outside Connection Point.**\r\n\r\n**If you do:**You don't need to own all the tiles to the Outside Connection Point, as long as a part of the existing seaway is in a tile you own, you can connect to it.\r\n\r\n**If you don't:** you'll need to buy map tiles to reach the Outside Connection point and build a seaway to it.\r\n\r\n**Note:** make sure that there are no low bridges on the way, and that there is clear access from the connection point to your harbor.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ShipOutsideTutorialAccessTrigger] = Build a Seaway to Connect with the Outside Connection
Tutorials.TITLE[ShipOutsideTutorialConnect] = Connecting a Passenger Ship Line to the Outside
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ShipOutsideTutorialConnect] = You will need to have at least one Harbor in your city.\r\n\r\n**With the Passenger Ship Line Tool select one or more Harbors and the Ship Outside Connection point.**\r\n\r\n**Complete the line by selecting the first Harbor again, making a loop.**\r\n\r\nWhen you have completed the line Passenger Ships will start operating the line, bringing in tourist and new citizens.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ShipOutsideTutorialConnectTrigger] = Connect a Passenger Ship Line to an Outside Connection Point
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipsTutorial] = Cargo Ships
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipsTutorialHarbor] = Cargo Harbor
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoShipsTutorialHarbor] = **Cargo ships operate from Cargo Harbors.**\r\n\r\nCargo ships can carry immense amounts of cargo aboard just one ship. \r\n\r\nThey are a great way to handle import and export when you have access to an Outside Connection by water.
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipsTutorialPlaceHarbor] = Build a Cargo Harbor
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoShipsTutorialPlaceHarbor] = **Find a suitable place on the shoreline, with enough room on the water to fit the harbor area.**\r\n\r\nLook around to see where the waterways lead, ships might not fit through very narrow passages.\r\n\r\nRemember that the harbour will also need a road connection, so trucks can arrive to load and unload cargo.\r\n\r\n**Note:** You can build the road to go along the front of the harbour building after you have built it, and if you are having trouble getting the road to match, try moving the building.\r\n
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoShipsTutorialPlaceHarborTrigger] = Place a Cargo Harbor
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipsTutorialRoutes] = Cargo Ship Route Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoShipsTutorialRoutes] = Cargo Ship Route Tool **is used to place waypoints for cargo ships to follow.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipsTutorialConnectingRoutes] = Make a Cargo Ship Route
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoShipsTutorialConnectingRoutes] = **With the Cargo Ship Route Tool, select a Cargo Ship Dock in your Harbor, and place waypoints to create a line where you want the ships to go.**\r\n\r\n**Loop back to the Cargo Dock you started from to complete the route.**\r\n\r\nIf you have more than one Cargo Harbor, you can select them as a destination, or build routes to Outside Connection points where you can.\r\n\r\n**Note:**You can add new waypoints and move the existing ones after the route is complete.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoShipsTutorialConnectingRouteTrigger] = Create a Cargo Ship Route
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipOutsideTutorial] = Shipping Route Outside Connection
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipOutsideTutorialIntro] = Shipping Routes to other cities
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoShipOutsideTutorialIntro] = Trucks carrying goods and materials can create lots of noise and traffic jams.\r\n\r\n**For cheaper and more efficient transportation of goods, you can create a Cargo Ship Route to neighboring cities.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoShipOutsideTutorialConnect] = Connecting Shipping Routes to the Outside
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoShipOutsideTutorialConnect] = You will need to have at least one Cargo Harbor in your city.\r\n\r\n**With the Cargo Ship Route Tool select one or more Cargo Harbors and the Ship Outside Connection.**\r\n\r\n**Complete the route by selecting the first Cargo Harbor again, making a loop.**\r\n\r\nWhen you have completed the route, Cargo Ships will start operating the route, transporting goods and materials.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoShipOutsideTutorialConnectTrigger] = Connect a Cargo Ship Route to an Outside Connection Point
Tutorials.TITLE[AirTransportGroup] = Air
Tutorials.TITLE[AirwaysTutorial] = Airways
Tutorials.TITLE[AirwaysTutorialIntro] = Airways
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[AirwaysTutorialIntro] = **Airplanes can carry a large number of passengers or great amounts of cargo** from one place to another very quickly.
Tutorials.TITLE[AirwaysTutorialAirport] = Airport
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[AirwaysTutorialAirport] = To get started and get airplanes flying, **you'll need to build an Airport.**
Tutorials.TITLE[AirwaysTutorialPlaceAirport] = Build an Airport
Tutorials.TRIGGER[AirwaysTutorialPlaceAirportTrigger] = Build an Airport
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerAirlineTutorial] = Passenger Airlines
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerAirlineTutorialLine] = Passenger Airplane Line
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerAirlineTutorialLine] = Passenger Airplane Line Tool is used to connect Airports to each other and **give airplanes a route to follow.**\r\n\r\nPassenger lines between neighboring cities carry tourists and people moving in.\r\n\r\nLarge cities with more than one airport can have Passenger Lines flying within the city.
Tutorials.TITLE[PassengerAirlineTutorialConnectLine] = Connecting Passenger Air Lines
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PassengerAirlineTutorialConnectLine] = **With the Passenger Airplane Line Tool, select a Passenger Airplane Terminal at the Airport.**\r\n\r\n**Then select the Terminals and Outside Connections you want to include in the Line, in the order you want the Line to operate in.**\r\n\r\nFor Outside Connections locate and select the Outside Connection marker somewhere on the edge of the map.\r\n\r\nFor flights within the city, select a Passenger Terminal at the airport you want the line to fly to.\r\n\r\nYou can select as many airports and outside connections as you like.\r\n\r\n**Complete the line by selecting the Passenger Airplane Terminal where you started from.**\r\n\r\n**Note:** You can add more airports to the line and move the existing ones after the line is complete.  Terminals and Outside Connections can have more than one line operating out of them.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[PassengerAirlineTutorialConnectLineTrigger] = Create a Passenger Airplane Line
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoAirlineTutorial] = Cargo Airlines
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoAirlineTutorialCargoRoute] = Cargo Airplane Route
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoAirlineTutorialCargoRoute] = Cargo Airplane Route Tool is used to connect Airports to each other and **give airplanes a route to follow.**\r\n\r\nCargo Routes between neighboring cities carry goods and materials to and from the city.\r\n\r\nLarge cities with more than one airport can have Cargo Routes flying within the city. 
Tutorials.TITLE[CargoAirlineTutorialConnectingRoute] = Connecting Cargo Air Routes
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CargoAirlineTutorialConnectingRoute] = To get Cargo Routes started **you'll need to build a Cargo Terminal Upgrade to your Airport.**\r\n\r\nSelect your airport and find the upgrade in the Upgrades panel.\r\n\r\n**Then, with the Cargo Airplane Route Tool, select a Cargo Airplane Terminal in your new cargo extension of the Airport.**\r\n\r\n**Select cargo terminals in airports you'd like to include in the route, in the order you want the Cargo Route to operate in.**\r\n\r\nFor Outside Connections, locate and select the outside connection marker somewhere on the edge of the map.\r\n\r\nFor flights within the city, select a Cargo Terminal at the airport you want the line to fly to.\r\n\r\nYou can select as many airports and outside connections as you like.\r\n\r\n**Complete the line by selecting the Cargo Airplane Terminal where you started from, to make a loop.**\r\n\r\n**Note:** You can add more airports to the route and move the existing ones after the route is complete. Terminals and Outside Connections can have more than one route operating out of them.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CargoAirlineTutorialConnectingRouteTrigger] = Create a Cargo Airplane Route
Tutorials.TITLE[Parks&RecreationGroup] = PARKS & RECREATION
Tutorials.TITLE[ParksTutorial] = Parks & Recreation
Tutorials.TITLE[ParksTutorialIntro] = Parks & Recreation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ParksTutorialIntro] = **Recreation buildings, areas and parks increase the attractiveness of your city.**\r\n\r\nHaving an attractive city adds to the well-being of citizens and promotes tourism.
Tutorials.TITLE[ParksTutorialMaintanence] = Parks Maintenance
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ParksTutorialMaintanence] = To increase the variety and size of the parks available, **unlock the Park Maintenance Depot in the Progression panel.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TouristAttractionsTutorial] = Tourist Attractions
Tutorials.TITLE[TouristAttractionsTutorialIntro] = Tourism
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TouristAttractionsTutorialIntro] = **Tourism is a great way to generate more income for the city.**\r\n\r\nVisiting tourists bring in money by buying things in shops, eating out, and by staying in hotels, for example.
Tutorials.TITLE[LandmarksTutorial] = Landmarks
Tutorials.TITLE[LandmarksTutorialIntro] = Landmarks
Tutorials.TITLE[LandscapingGroup] = LANDSCAPING
Tutorials.TITLE[TerraformingTutorial] = Terraforming
Tutorials.TITLE[TerraformingTutorialIntro] = Terraforming
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TerraformingTutorialIntro] = **The ground can be shaped** to build gardens, pastures, sanctuaries,  reservoirs, flood channels and more.
Tutorials.TITLE[TerraformingTutorialTools] = Tools
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TerraformingTutorialTools] = There are a variety of different ground shaping tools.\r\n\r\n**Check each tool's description for more information.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TerraformingTutorialBrush] = Brush
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TerraformingTutorialBrush] = **Increase or decrease the brush size** for large scale work or detailed shaping.\r\n\r\nChange the **Brush Strength to control how much the terrain changes** with each application.
Tutorials.TITLE[VegetationTutorial] = Vegetation
Tutorials.TITLE[VegetationTutorialIntro] = Vegetation
Tutorials.TITLE[VegetationTutorialGlobalTheme] = Theme
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[VegetationTutorialGlobalTheme] = **Plants and trees are regional,** so a different set is available based on the currently selected theme.
Tutorials.TITLE[VegetationTutorialToolMode] = Tool Mode
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[VegetationTutorialToolMode] = You can **place plants individually** or use a **brush to distribute larger amounts at once.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PathwaysTutorial] = Pathways
Tutorials.TITLE[PathwaysTutorialIntro] = Pathways
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PathwaysTutorialIntro] = **Pathways are for pedestrians and can be built wherever there is room.**\r\n\r\nWith pathways, you can build nature trails or scenic routes between buildings. Connect your path to a road's sidewalk so that people can access it.
Tutorials.TITLE[PathwaysTutorialTools] = Tool Options
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PathwaysTutorialTools] = Tool options help you bring your vision to life. Get creative with curves and elevations.
Tutorials.TITLE[CommunicationGroup] = COMMUNICATIONS
Tutorials.TITLE[PostServiceTutorial] = Post
Tutorials.TITLE[PostServiceTutorialIntro] = Postal Services
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PostServiceTutorialIntro] = The postal service delivers different types of mail around the city. Mail is an important form of communication for citizens and companies.\r\n\r\n**A well working Post Service will have a positive effect on citizen well-being and the operating efficiency of companies.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PostServiceTutorialPostOffice] = Post Office
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PostServiceTutorialPostOffice] = To get mail delivery going in your city, first build a Post Office.\r\n\r\n**Post Offices handle local mail to and from the residents and local businesses.**\r\n\r\nResidents can visit the office directly to drop off their mail for delivery. 
Tutorials.TITLE[PostServiceTutorialMailBox] = Mail Boxes
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PostServiceTutorialMailBox] = **Mail Boxes can be placed by the side of any road.** They are used by citizens to drop off mail for delivery.\r\n\r\nPlace them in convenient locations around residential areas and places people frequent.\r\n\r\nPost Vans will automatically collect mail from the Mail Boxes.
Tutorials.TITLE[TelecomServiceTutorial] = Telecom Service
Tutorials.TITLE[TelecomServiceTutorialIntro] = Basic Services
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TelecomServiceTutorialIntro] = **Citizens automatically have access to basic radio, TV, and Internet.** \r\n\r\nMore advanced services can be built to better the lives of the citizens.
Tutorials.TITLE[TelecomServiceTutorialAdvanced] = Advanced Wireless Services
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TelecomServiceTutorialAdvanced] = **Telecommunications service buildings provide services like mobile networks and wireless broadband.**\r\n\r\nBuilding Advanced Communication Services to better communications, improve citizen well-being, help Commercial zone sales, and decrease the material costs for Industrial zones.
Tutorials.TITLE[CityCategory] = CITY
Tutorials.TITLE[MapTileGroup] = MAP TILES
Tutorials.TITLE[MapTileTutorial] = Map Tiles
Tutorials.TITLE[MapTileTutorialIntro] = Map Tiles
Tutorials.TITLE[MapTileTutorialNaturalResources] = Natural Resources
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MapTileTutorialNaturalResources] = You can plan out your city's industrial development by expanding to **areas that offer one or more of the natural resources the industry needs.**
Tutorials.TITLE[MapTileTutorialPurchasing] = Purchasing
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MapTileTutorialPurchasing] = **To buy new map tiles, you need both money and expansion permits.**\r\n \r\nExpansion permits are granted whenever you reach a new milestone.
Tutorials.TITLE[OutsideConnectionTutorial] = Outside Connections
Tutorials.TITLE[OutsideConnectionTutorialIntro] = Outside Connections
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[OutsideConnectionTutorialIntro] = Outside Connections are routes to neighboring cities and the rest of the outside world. \r\n\r\n**They can be roads and tracks as well as water or air routes.**\r\n\r\nThey are **used by people moving in as well as visiting tourists.**\r\n\r\nYour **city also imports and exports goods and materials** through these connections.
Tutorials.TITLE[OutsideConnectionTutorialMakingConnections] = Road and Track Connections
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[OutsideConnectionTutorialMakingConnections] = To build a new Outside Connection you need to **expand your city by buying map tiles until you reach the edge of the map.**\r\n\r\nOnce done, **build roads or tracks right up to the edge, and an Outside Connection Point will be established.**
Tutorials.TITLE[OutsideConnectionTutorialWaterRoutes] = Water Routes
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[OutsideConnectionTutorialWaterRoutes] = Connections to the outside world over water **can be created when you have a Seaway that reaches the edge of the map.**\r\n\r\nYou don't need to own all the tiles up to the edge if there is a pre-built Seaway that has a ship-type Outside Connection Point. Buy enough tiles to connect your Seaway to the pre-built one.\r\n\r\nIf no pre-built Seaway exists, you need to buy all the tiles to reach the map edge.
Tutorials.TITLE[OutsideConnectionTutorialAirRoutes] = Air Routes
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[OutsideConnectionTutorialAirRoutes] = **Air connections to the outside world can be created without buying map tiles.**\r\n\r\nPassenger lines and cargo routes can be created directly from an Airport to an airplane-type Outside Connection Point on the map edge to establish the connection.
Tutorials.TITLE[ProgressionGroup] = PROGRESSION
Tutorials.TITLE[DevelopmentTutorial] = Development
Tutorials.TITLE[DevelopmentTutorialIntro] = Development Trees
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DevelopmentTutorialIntro] = **Development trees allow you to access new service buildings and other buildable items for your city.** \r\n\r\nYou can unlock these assets by using development points.
Tutorials.TITLE[DevelopmentTutorialNewFeatures] = New Features
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DevelopmentTutorialNewFeatures] = **Basic Services will be automatically unlocked when you reach new milestones.**\r\n\r\nTo develop and grow the service further, unlock the next item along the tree and build it in your city.\r\n\r\n**Development points are awarded for reaching new milestones.**
Tutorials.TITLE[DevelopmentTutorialServicesTrees] = Services Development Trees
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DevelopmentTutorialServicesTrees] = **Each City Service has its own development tree.**\r\n\r\nYou can focus on specific types of city development by spending your points in the areas that interest you the most.\r\n\r\nExplore the development trees to find what features each service has to offer.
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorial] = Milestones
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorialIntro] = Milestones
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MilestoneTutorialIntro] = **Milestones represent the growth of your city.**\r\n\r\nDevelop your city to reach the next milestone.
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorialCityGrowth] = City Growth
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorialXP] = XP
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MilestoneTutorialXP] = This tracks the amount of Expansion Points (XP) you have, and shows how much you need to gain until you reach the next milestone.\r\n\r\nYou are awarded **XP for building City Service buildings and their upgrades, Signature Buildings, and roads.**\r\n\r\n**Increasing your population numbers and citizen happiness** also grants you XP rewards.
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorialMoney] = Money
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MilestoneTutorialMoney] = **Whenever you reach a new milestone, you will receive a money reward.**\r\n\r\nUse it to build and maintain the city.
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorialDevPoints] = Development Points
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MilestoneTutorialDevPoints] = For each milestone reached you will also be granted development points, which **can be used to unlock advanced services.**
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorialExpPermits] = Expansion Permits
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MilestoneTutorialExpPermits] = Each milestone adds to your existing expansion permits. \r\n**They are needed to expand the city borders.**
Tutorials.TITLE[MilestoneTutorialUnlockedFeatures] = Unlocked Features
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MilestoneTutorialUnlockedFeatures] = **Each milestone unlocks more features** that allow you to build and expand your city in different ways.\r\n\r\nYou can look through the list here.
Tutorials.TITLE[CityInfoTutorial] = CITY INFORMATION
Tutorials.TITLE[CityInfoTutorialDemand] = Demand
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CityInfoTutorialDemand] = Different types of zones are in demand in your city at different times.\r\n\r\nAs people move in and businesses develop, the need for new zoning changes according to their needs.\r\n\r\n**The fuller the bar, the higher the demand for the zone type is.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CityInfoTutorialDemandPlusMinus] = Plus and Minus
Tutorials.TITLE[CityInfoTutorialCityPolicies] = City Policies
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CityInfoTutorialCityPolicies] = You can shape the rules and regulations of your city by enacting city policies.\r\n \r\n**These policies affect the entire city, including all districts and buildings.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CityInfoTutorialCityPoliciesActivate] = Activating City Policies
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CityInfoTutorialCityPoliciesActivate] = **You can activate and deactivate policies any time.**\r\n\r\nSome policies have adjustment sliders to fine-tune their effect.\r\n\r\nSelect a policy to see what its effects are.\r\n\r\nMore policies are unlocked as you reach certain milestones.
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningGroup] = ZONES
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorial] = Zoning Residential
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialIntro] = Zones
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ZoningTutorialIntro] = **Zoning determines which types of buildings are built in the selected area.**\r\n\r\nBuildings in zoned areas **get built automatically** depending on the city's needs.\r\n\r\nAreas that are not zoned will remain empty.
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialZoneTypes] = Zone Types
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ZoningTutorialZoneTypes] = **Zones are divided into groups according to the types of buildings they allow for.**\r\n\r\nThis is your way to allot different areas of the city for different uses. 
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialGlobalTheme] = Theme
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ZoningTutorialGlobalTheme] = You can choose which theme the zoned buildings follow.\r\n\r\n**This affects the visual style of buildings that get built in an area.**\r\n\r\nYou can change the theme at any time. The change will come into effect for any new zoning you apply.
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialToolMode] = Tool Modes
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ZoningTutorialToolMode] = **Different modes help you shape your zones exactly the way you want.**\r\n\r\nKeep in mind that for buildings to get built, the zoned area needs to be adjacent to a road and have enough space on it.
Tutorials.TITLE[ResidentialZoningTutorialLowDensity] = Low Density Housing
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ResidentialZoningTutorialLowDensity] = This zone type is for **single family homes.**\r\n\r\nThey have a positive effect on the residents' happiness, but can become expensive to live in when land value rises. \r\n\r\nDifferent job types and the availability of jobs affect the demand for different types of housing.
Tutorials.TITLE[ResidentialZoningTutorialPlace] = Zoning for Residential
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ResidentialZoningTutorialPlace] = **Zoning an area for residential use will allow people to start moving into your city.**\r\n\r\nFor a happier neighborhood, place your residential areas in suitable locations. People appreciate living away from sources of pollution such as industry and large, noisy highways.\r\n\r\nYou are free to design your residential areas in any way you like. When building roads, you can make use of the grid tool mode to create bigger neighborhoods in an instant, or you can take your time and plan scenic, winding roads along a shoreline. \r\n\r\n**Whatever the design, make sure the area is connected to the rest of your city and the outside world.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ResidentialZoningTutorialPlaceTrigger] = Place a Low Density Housing Zone
Tutorials.TITLE[CommercialZoningTutorial] = Zoning Commercial
Tutorials.TITLE[CommercialZoningTutorialIntro] = Commercial Zones
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CommercialZoningTutorialIntro] = **Commercial zones provide space for different types of business uses.**\r\n\r\nBusinesses provide services and jobs for the residents and increase city income by paying taxes and fees.
Tutorials.TITLE[CommercialZoningTutorialLowDensity] = Low Density Business
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CommercialZoningTutorialLowDensity] = **This zone type is for single story or low-rise buildings for small business.**\r\n\r\nThese businesses provide important local services such as stores, restaurants and gas stations for citizens living nearby.
Tutorials.TITLE[CommercialZoningTutorialPlace] = Zoning for Commercial
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CommercialZoningTutorialPlace] = **Zoning land for commercial space will allow for commercial companies to start up businesses.**\r\n\r\nFor a prospering business area, place it close to where the people are. Close proximity to residential zones benefits both the residents and the businesses.\r\n\r\nA good balance between these two will increase citizen happiness and provide both services as well as jobs.\r\n\r\n**Businesses will continually need new goods and materials. Having good connections to larger roads nearby makes for faster and easier deliveries.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CommercialZoningTutorialPlaceTrigger] = Place a Commercial Zone
Tutorials.TITLE[IndustrialZoningTutorial] = Zoning Industrial
Tutorials.TITLE[IndustrialZoningTutorialIntro] = Industrial Zones
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[IndustrialZoningTutorialIntro] = **Industrial zones provide land for industrial businesses.**\r\n\r\nIndustries provide jobs and increase the city's tax revenue.
Tutorials.TITLE[IndustrialZoningTutorialManufacturing] = Industrial Manufacturing
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[IndustrialZoningTutorialManufacturing] = **This zone type allows for all types of industrial manufacturing buildings and warehouses.**\r\n\r\nIndustrial companies process materials to create material goods, which can be further processed by other industries, sold by commercial businesses, or used by city services.
Tutorials.TITLE[IndustrialZoningTutorialPlace] = Zoning for Industrial Manufacturing
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[IndustrialZoningTutorialPlace] = **Zoning land for industrial use will allow industrial companies to start up businesses.**\r\n\r\nIndustrial companies are dependent on materials, so they work best near resources and benefit greatly from good traffic connections in their immediate vicinity.\r\n\r\n**Manufacturing creates pollution, so it's best to place these zones away from people's homes and groundwater deposits.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[IndustrialZoningTutorialPlaceTrigger] = Place an Industrial Zone
Tutorials.TITLE[OfficeZoningTutorial] = Zoning Office
Tutorials.TITLE[OfficeZoningTutorialIntro] = Office Zones
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[OfficeZoningTutorialIntro] = **Office zones house companies that produce immaterial goods and services.**\r\n\r\nServices such as software and telecommunications for private citizens and other companies.
Tutorials.TITLE[OfficeZoningTutorialLowDensity] = Low Density Office
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[OfficeZoningTutorialLowDensity] = The Low Density Office zone allows for **single story or low-rise buildings for small business.**
Tutorials.TITLE[OfficeZoningTutorialPlace] = Zoning for Office
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[OfficeZoningTutorialPlace] = **Zoning land for office space will allow for businesses creating immaterial goods to start moving in.**\r\n\r\nOffices will continually need new resources, but as these are immaterial goods, physical connections such as large roads are not as important for offices as they are for other zones.\r\n\r\n**Offices will, however, require skilled employees, so having a well-built education system is beneficial.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[OfficeZoningTutorialPlaceTrigger] = Place an Office Zone
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorial] = Specialized Industry
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialIntro] = Specialized Industry
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialIntro] = **Specialized Industry areas can be built wherever relevant natural resources are available.**\r\n \r\nCompanies operating the areas will gather the resources and transport them to be either used within the city or exported outside.
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialAttraction] = Attracting Industries
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialAttraction] = **Active specialized areas will make the city more attractive to industries that can make use of those specific materials.**\r\n\r\nThis means that you will start to see more related industries appearing in industrial zones.
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialHighlight] = Highlighting Resources
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialHighlight] = **When you select a specialization type, related natural resources are highlighted on the map.**\r\n\r\nYou can also turn the highlights for different resources on and off in the related Info View.
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialType] = Available Resources
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialType] = Choose the types of specialization according to the **types of resources you have available on your map.**
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialPlacement] = Build a Hub Building 
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialPlacement] = Place the hub building close to the relevant resource.\r\n\r\n**The circle around the hub building shows how far from the building you can extend the area.**\r\n\r\nRemember that your hub building needs a road connection in the front of the building, and that you can't build roads inside the area.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialPlacementTrigger] = Place an Extractor Building Area
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialArea] = Define the Area
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialArea] = **Define the active area starting from one edge of the building. Place nodes in the shape you want, and complete the area by selecting the opposite edge of the building.**\r\n\r\nYou can adjust the active area with the Area Tool at any time you need to.\r\n\r\nWhen the area is completed, a company will move in and start production.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[SpecialIndustryZoneTutorialAreaTrigger] = Define the active area for the Specialized Industry
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningDemandTutorial] = Zoning Demand
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningDemandTutorialIntro] = Zoning Demand
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ZoningDemandTutorialIntro] = These bars give you at-a-glance info on what types of zones are currently needed in your city. \r\n\r\n**The fuller the bar, the higher the demand is for that zone type.**\r\n\r\nEach bar grows and shrinks constantly according to the city's changing needs  and your zoning efforts.
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialRemoveZone] = Removing and Rezoning
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialRemoveZoneIntro] = Removing Zones
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[ZoningTutorialRemoveZoneIntro] = If you ever feel that a zone is in the wrong place, you can choose to remove the entire zone, or shape it by removing parts of it.\r\n\r\nUse the Tool Mode of your choice and, **while holding down** <inputAction:Tool/Secondary Apply> **paint the area you want to remove.**
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[ZoningTutorialRemoveZoneIntro] = If you ever feel that a zone is in the wrong place, you can choose to remove the entire zone, or shape it by removing parts of it.\r\n\r\nUse the Tool Mode of your choice and, **while holding down**<inputAction:Tool/Secondary Apply> **paint the area** you want to remove.
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialRemoveZoneRezoning] = Rezoning
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ZoningTutorialRemoveZoneRezoning] = If you would like to change an already zoned area to a different type, **you can apply new zoning on top of the old one.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ZoningTutorialRemoveZoneCondemned] = Condemned Buildings
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ZoningTutorialRemoveZoneCondemned] = **Buildings that already exist in the area you are rezoning or removing zoning from will become condemned.** \r\n\r\nCondemned buildings will get automatically demolished over time.\r\n\r\nFor a faster rebuild time, you can bulldoze them yourself to make room for new buildings.
Tutorials.TITLE[AreasGroup] = AREAS
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorial] = Districts
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialIntro] = Districts
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialIntro] = You can create different types of neighborhoods or specialize an area for a specific use with the district tool.\r\n\r\n**Districts let you assign policies and city services to only be in effect inside the district.**
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialDistrict] = District Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialDistrict] = With the district tool you can **create and adjust the borders of a district.**
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialSnapping] = Snapping
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialSnapping] = Different tool snapping modes can help you shape the area.\r\n\r\n**Turn them on or off one by one or use the star button to toggle them all at once.**
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialCreation] = Creating a District
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialCreation] = With the District Creation Tool selected, **create the district border by placing nodes with** <inputAction:Tool/Apply>\r\n\r\n**Complete the area by selecting the node you started with.**\r\n\r\nYou can reshape the completed area with the District Creation Tool at any time by either dragging the existing nodes to new locations or by placing new nodes anywhere on the border line.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[DistrictTutorialCreationTrigger] = Create a District
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialInfo] = District Information
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialInfo] = **First close the Areas Tool Menu and then open the district information panel by selecting the name of the district you created.**\r\n\r\nThe panel contains all the relevant information about the district. The amount of information shown will vary according to what is going on inside the district.\r\n\r\nHovering over the items in the panel will give you more information.\r\n
Tutorials.TRIGGER[DistrictTutorialInfoTrigger] = Select District Name
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialName] = District Name
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialName] = You can **change the name** of the district by selecting the name and typing in a new one.\r\n
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialPolicies] = District Policies
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialPolicies] = **Here you can assign policies that will be in effect inside the district.**\r\n\r\nSee the tooltip for each policy for more information.\r\n\r\nSelecting the icon will toggle the policy on and off.
Tutorials.TITLE[DistrictTutorialDelete] = Delete District
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DistrictTutorialDelete] = **Deleting a district will remove the area boundaries and the policies that were in effect inside the district.**\r\n\r\nServices assigned to the district will reset to city-wide services.\r\n\r\nRemoving a district will not affect zoned buildings, roads, service buildings or any landscaping you might have done inside the area.
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecializationAreaTutorial] = Industrial Specialization Area Tool
Tutorials.TITLE[SpecializationAreaTutorialIntro] = Area Tool
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SpecializationAreaTutorialIntro] = **You can adjust any Specialized Industry area after it has been created.**\r\n\r\nYou can select and move any existing node to adjust the shape or create a new node by selecting the line between existing nodes.
Tutorials.TITLE[SignatureBuildingTutorial] = SIGNATURE BUILDINGS
Tutorials.TITLE[SignatureBuildingTutorialIntro] = Signature Buildings
Tutorials.TITLE[SignatureBuildingTutorialEffects] = Positive Effects
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SignatureBuildingTutorialEffects] = **Many Signature Buildings have a positive effect on the area surrounding it.**\r\n\r\nThese effects and more information about each building are shown when you hover over the building.
Tutorials.TITLE[SignatureBuildingTutorialTypes] = Types of Signature Buildings
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SignatureBuildingTutorialTypes] = Signature Buildings **are organized by the zones** they are related to in the menu, **but they can be placed in any zone** on the map.
Tutorials.TITLE[SignatureBuildingTutorialTheme] = Theme
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SignatureBuildingTutorialTheme] = **Each theme has its own corresponding set of signature buildings.**\r\n\r\nYou can build one of each from both sets.
Tutorials.TITLE[EconomyGroup] = CITY ECONOMICS
Tutorials.TITLE[BudgetTutorial] = Budget
Tutorials.TITLE[BudgetTutorialIntro] = Budget
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BudgetTutorialIntro] = **The budget tab allows you to view your financial situation at a glance.**\r\n\r\nThe numbers are constantly updated according to changes taking place in the city.\r\n\r\n**By selecting a revenue or expense item from the list, you can see further information about it.**\r\n\r\nBreakdown of the selected item is displayed on the right side panel. At the same time, the item's share of the total is highlighted on the bar graph on the left. 
Tutorials.TITLE[BudgetTutorialRevenues] = Revenues
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BudgetTutorialRevenues] = The revenues list shows you the different **sources and amounts of money coming into the city.** 
Tutorials.TITLE[BudgetTutorialExpenses] = Expenses
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BudgetTutorialExpenses] = The expenses list shows you the different **payments made by the city.**
Tutorials.TITLE[BudgetTutorialBalance] = Monthly Balance
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BudgetTutorialBalance] = The monthly balance displays **how much profit or loss your city will generate each month** based on the current revenue and expense values.
Tutorials.TITLE[LoanTutorial] = Loans
Tutorials.TITLE[LoanTutorialIntro] = Loans
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LoanTutorialIntro] = Loans are a great way to finance city building when needed.\r\n\r\nWhen taking out a loan pay attention to the interest rate and the resulting monthly cost so you don't end up overspending.\r\n\r\n**When you have borrowed money, you are only paying the interest every month.**\r\n\r\nIn other words, the loaned amount remains the same until you choose to pay it back.
Tutorials.TITLE[LoanTutorialAdjusting] = Adjusting The Loan Amount
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LoanTutorialAdjusting] = **To take out a loan, move the slider to the right until you reach the desired amount.**\r\n\r\nThe loan interest rate and resulting monthly cost are adjusted automatically.\r\n\r\nYou have an upper limit to how much you can borrow. This increases as you reach milestones.
Tutorials.TITLE[LoanTutorialAccepting] = Accepting The Loan
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LoanTutorialAccepting] = **When you have the desired amount in the Total Loan Amount window, select Accept.**\r\n\r\nAfter accepting the loan your city immediately receives the funds and you can spend them however you like.\r\n\r\nIf you need to borrow more money in the future,  move the slider further right and select Accept again. The new loan is combined with the old one, so in effect you only ever have one active loan and one monthly payment.
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxationTutorial] = Taxation
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxationTutorialIntro] = Taxation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxationTutorialIntro] = The taxation tab allows you to **view and adjust the tax rates** and the resulting revenues or expenses of individual zone types.
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxationTutorialType] = Type
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxationTutorialType] = **You can adjust the Tax Rate to an entire Zone Type with the sliders.**\r\n\r\nFor more precise control, expand a zone type to adjust tax rates based on individual citizen or resource type.
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxationTutorialTaxRate] = Tax Rate
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxationTutorialTaxRate] = **Increasing or decreasing taxes can be beneficial to your city depending on your situation.**\r\n\r\nSetting a negative tax rate means the city pays subsidies. This can be used to attract citizens or businesses into the city.
Tutorials.TITLE[TaxationTutorialEstimate] = Estimate
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TaxationTutorialEstimate] = **This is a projected estimation for monthly tax income based on the current situation.**\r\n\r\nThe total is adjusted constantly according to changes taking place in the city, such as residents moving in and out and businesses being established or closed down.
Tutorials.TITLE[ServicesTutorial] = Services
Tutorials.TITLE[ServicesTutorialIntro] = Services
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ServicesTutorialIntro] = **The services tab shows the current revenues and expenses related to running your city services.**\r\n\r\nIt also allows you to adjust service budgets and related fees to fine-tune your economy. 
Tutorials.TITLE[ServicesTutorialSelection] = Service Selection
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ServicesTutorialSelection] = Select a city service to view the revenues and expenses, and to adjust the budget for the service. 
Tutorials.TITLE[ServicesTutorialBudget] = Budget
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ServicesTutorialBudget] = **Lowering the budget saves money, but the quality of the service also goes down.**\r\n\r\nA higher budget results in better service quality, but will cost more.\r\n\r\nSome services also charge a fee for their use. Higher fees result in more revenue, but will have a negative impact on citizen happiness and business profitability.
Tutorials.TITLE[ProductionTutorial] = Production
Tutorials.TITLE[ProductionTutorialIntro] = Production
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ProductionTutorialIntro] = The production tab shows you how much your city is producing.\r\n\r\n**You can view production from materials, material goods, and immaterial goods.**
Tutorials.TITLE[ProductionTutorialMaterials] = Materials
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ProductionTutorialMaterials] = **Expand the categories and hover over a material to see the production chain on the right panel for that material.**\r\n\r\nThe production chain shows where materials and goods come from and what they are used for, as well as a visual indication of whether you're currently importing or exporting them.
Tutorials.TITLE[TransportationOverviewTutorial] = TRANSPORTATION OVERVIEW
Tutorials.TITLE[TransportationOverviewTutorialIntro] = Transportation Overview
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TransportationOverviewTutorialIntro] = **All transportation lines and routes you have built so far are shown here.**\r\n\r\nThey are divided into the categories of Public Transport Lines and Cargo Routes.\r\n\r\nYou can view and adjust each line and route separately.
Tutorials.TITLE[TransportationOverviewTutorialTypes] = Transport types
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TransportationOverviewTutorialTypes] = Find the right lines and routes by selecting the **type of transportation vehicle** they are related to.
Tutorials.TITLE[CityStatisticsTutorial] = CITY STATISTICS
Tutorials.TITLE[CityStatisticsTutorialIntro] = City Statistics
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CityStatisticsTutorialIntro] = **The statistics panel shows you detailed graphs about the progress of your city.**\r\n\r\nSeeing whether a selected topic is trending up or down can help you steer your city in the direction you want.\r\n\r\n**For example,** if you would like your city to be visited by lots of tourists, and the number of visiting tourists is in decline, you could focus on building more attractions and making sure there are enough hotels for them to stay in. 
Tutorials.TITLE[CityStatisticsTutorialToggles] = Toggling Statistic Views
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CityStatisticsTutorialToggles] = **Select an aspect of the city you would like to see or hide by turning it on or off. The relevant graphs will be shown on the right.**\r\n\r\nSome categories can be expanded to show further options.
Tutorials.TITLE[CityStatisticsTutorialTimeScale] = Time Scale
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CityStatisticsTutorialTimeScale] = **Slide the scale** to view the displayed graph in a **different time frame.**
Tutorials.TITLE[UpgradeTutorial] = BUILDING UPGRADES
Tutorials.TITLE[UpgradeTutorialIntro] = Upgrading Service Buildings
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[UpgradeTutorialIntro] = **Upgrades provide things such as higher capacity or faster and cleaner services.**\r\n\r\nUpgrades are specific to each service building. \r\n\r\n**Select a service building you have built to see what upgrades are available.**
Tutorials.TITLE[UpgradeTutorialUpgrading] = Building an Upgrade
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[UpgradeTutorialUpgrading] = Select the upgrade you want from the menu.\r\n\r\n**Depending on the upgrade, it is added on top of an existing building as an extension, or placed on the side as a separate sub-building.**\r\n\r\nFor the sub-buildings you can choose the location of it yourself.\r\n\r\nMost upgrades can only be applied once to any given building, but there are some you can add multiple times.
Tutorials.TITLE[InfoViewsCategory] = INFO VIEWS & NOTIFICATIONS
Tutorials.TITLE[InfoViewGroup] = INFO VIEWS
Tutorials.TITLE[InfoviewTutorial] = Info Views
Tutorials.TITLE[InfoviewTutorialIntro] = Info Views
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[InfoviewTutorialIntro] = **Info Views display useful information as a visual overlay.**\r\n\r\nThese include things such as traffic flow, natural resource locations, wind speed, water flow, and so on.\r\n\r\nYou can also see statistics about City Service coverage, Citizen Happiness, and more.\r\n\r\n**Selecting a service will also highlight the locations of the City Service Buildings and Service Vehicles.**
Tutorials.TITLE[TourismTutorial] = Tourism
Tutorials.TITLE[TourismTutorialIntro] = Tourism
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TourismTutorialIntro] = Tourism can be an **important source of income for the city and employs a lot of people.** 
Tutorials.TITLE[TourismTutorialAttractivenessValue] = Attractiveness Value
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TourismTutorialAttractivenessValue] = **The Attractiveness value reflects how interesting your city is for tourists.**\r\n\r\n It can be increased by building special attractions.
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TourismTutorialTouristGo] = **Tourists spend their time and money on different types of activities.**\r\n\r\nYou can find them going to places that provide relaxation, visiting attractions, going shopping, doing leisure activities, and staying at hotels.
Tutorials.TITLE[TourismTutorialAttractions] = Attractions
Tutorials.TITLE[TourismTutorialTerrain] = Attractive Terrain
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TourismTutorialTerrain] = **Some terrain features have a further positive effect on the attractiveness value of the buildings in their vicinity.**\r\n\r\nFeatures such as sea shores, forests, mountains and special features like ruins.
Tutorials.TITLE[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorial] = Outside Connections
Tutorials.TITLE[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialIntro] = Outside Connection Points
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialIntro] = **Outside Connections are routes to and from the world outside the map.**\r\n\r\nYour most important Outside Connection is the highway. It allows for new citizens to move in, for tourists to visit the city, and for the import and export of resources, goods, and even some City Services. 
Tutorials.TITLE[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialMap] = Map Connections
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialMap] = **All maps come with at least one road-based connection to the outside world, but as soon as you unlock enough tiles to reach the edge of the map, you can build new ones.**\r\n\r\nNew connections can be roads, railways or seaways.\r\n\r\nAn Outside Connection Point is created automatically when the traffic network in question is extended to the edge of the map.
Tutorials.TITLE[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialTrade] = Trading
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialTrade] = **Trading is the importing and exporting of goods and services.**\r\n\r\nCity Services available for import or export are Electricity, Water & Sewage, Road Maintenance, Healthcare, Garbage Management, Fire & Rescue, Police, and Education.
Tutorials.TITLE[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialElectricityTrade] = Electricity Trade
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialElectricityTrade] = Electricity trade is made possible by the map's existing Power Line connection.\r\n\r\n**To start trading, connect a power station to the Power Line connection.** \r\n\r\nMore connections can be built as desired.
Tutorials.TITLE[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialWaterTrade] = Water and Sewage Trade
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LocateOutsideConnectionsTutorialWaterTrade] = Water & Sewage Service can also be opened for trading.\r\n\r\n**To start trading, build water and sewage pipes from the city to the map edge.**
Tutorials.TITLE[BuildingLevelTutorial] = Building Level
Tutorials.TITLE[BuildingLevelTutorialIntro] = Building Levels
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BuildingLevelTutorialIntro] = Each zoned building has a level between 1-5. \r\n\r\n**The level affects the functionality and rent of the building.**\r\n\r\nRent is used to pay for building upkeep, and any remaining money is used for improving the building, i.e. leveling up. 
Tutorials.TITLE[BuildingLevelTutorialEfficiency] = Building Efficiency
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BuildingLevelTutorialEfficiency] = **Higher level buildings consume less and produce less waste.**\r\n\r\nConsumption of water and electricity per household or per resource produced or sold is less.\r\n\r\nThere is less garbage and pollution produced by the building.\r\n\r\nAlso higher level industrial buildings have a more efficient output.
Tutorials.TITLE[BuildingLevelTutorialStyle] = Building Level Style
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[BuildingLevelTutorialStyle] = **Higher level buildings are also visually distinct** from their lower level counterparts.
Tutorials.TITLE[LandValueTutorial] = Land Value
Tutorials.TITLE[LandValueTutorialIntro] = Land Value
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LandValueTutorialIntro] = **Land Value is a tool you can use to find out where citizens wish to live and where companies want to set up their businesses.**\r\n\r\nNearby City Service Buildings will increase Land Value, but only if the citizens find the services useful. 
Tutorials.TITLE[LandValueTutorialWealth] = Wealth and Land Value
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LandValueTutorialWealth] = **Wealthier citizens and profitable companies are willing to move to areas of higher Land Value.**\r\n\r\nHigher Land Value also means the area is more costly, so poorer citizens and companies will gravitate towards areas of lower Land Value.
Tutorials.TITLE[CompanyProfitabilityTutorial] = Company Profitability
Tutorials.TITLE[CompanyProfitabilityTutorialIntro] = Company Profitability
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CompanyProfitabilityTutorialIntro] = **Company profitability is based on how much money it has left after paying its running costs.**\r\n\r\nCompanies use their income and wealth to level up their buildings, which increases their efficiency.
Tutorials.TITLE[CompanyProfitabilityTutorialWorkers] = Number of Employees
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CompanyProfitabilityTutorialWorkers] = **Companies attempt to maximize their income. This means they adjust the number of employees according to how well the company is doing.**\r\n\r\nIf a companys income and wealth are both negative, the company will go bankrupt.
Tutorials.TITLE[NaturalResourcesTutorial] = Natural Resources
Tutorials.TITLE[NaturalResourcesTutorialIntro] = Find Natural Resources
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[NaturalResourcesTutorialIntro] = **Different types of natural resources are available based on the map you are building your city on.** \r\n\r\nResources are highlighted on the map in different colors.
Tutorials.TITLE[NaturalResourcesTutorialIndustry] = Specialized Industry Areas
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[NaturalResourcesTutorialIndustry] = **These areas can be placed on natural resources to benefit from them. Choose the type of industry according to the resources available.**\r\n\r\nHaving specialized industries using the resources also leads to your city having more industrial manufacturing that relate to the resource. 
Tutorials.TITLE[PopulationTutorial] = Population
Tutorials.TITLE[PopulationTutorialIntro] = Population View
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PopulationTutorialIntro] = The population view shows a number of different **statistics regarding your citizens.**\r\n\r\nThe numbers give a breakdown of how the city is doing in terms of **births and deaths, people moving in and out, and the status of employment.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PopulationTutorialDemographic] = Age Demographic
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PopulationTutorialDemographic] = **The age demographic of your population can be used to guide city development.**\r\n\r\n**For example,** children and seniors cannot work jobs. Only adults can reach the highest education levels, and the elderly require more healthcare.\r\n\r\nThe heat maps can be used to plan which City Services to build and where they would be most beneficial.
Tutorials.TITLE[HappinessTutorial] = Happiness
Tutorials.TITLE[HappinessTutorialIntro] = Happiness
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[HappinessTutorialIntro] = **This view shows a quick breakdown of the types of things your citizens like and dislike in your current city.**\r\n\r\nPay special attention to the negative factors. These show you what your city is currently lacking or where problems lie.
Tutorials.TITLE[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorial] = Workplace Availability
Tutorials.TITLE[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialIntro] = Workplace Availability
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialIntro] = **Workplaces are supplied by companies and City Service buildings, which require varying numbers of employees to function.**\r\n\r\nJobs are divided into levels that match education levels.\r\n\r\nAn employee can work any job that is at or below their education level.
Tutorials.TITLE[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialPositions] = Citizens Looking for Jobs
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialPositions] = **Citizens evaluate open positions based on the job level, distance from their home, and the number of already existing employees in the building.**\r\n\r\nThey prefer jobs that match their education level, are closer to home, and have fewer employees.
Tutorials.TITLE[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialUnemployed] = Citizens Choosing Jobs
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialUnemployed] = **If a citizen feels that there are no good jobs available, they can also choose to stay unemployed, hoping to find something better later on.**\r\n\r\nEmployed citizens will also occasionally compare their current job to open positions, and change jobs if they find a better one.
Tutorials.TITLE[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialOpenJobs] = Jobs and Education Level
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[WorkplaceAvailabilityTutorialOpenJobs] = If you find there are plenty of open jobs at a particular education level, consider building more education services that match that level.
Tutorials.TITLE[CitizenWealthTutorial] = Citizen Wealth
Tutorials.TITLE[CitizenWealthTutorialIntro] = Citizen Wealth
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CitizenWealthTutorialIntro] = Citizens have varying amounts of money on hand depending on their wage, household rent and other expenses.
Tutorials.TITLE[CitizenWealthTutorialHeatmap] = Areas by Wealth
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CitizenWealthTutorialHeatmap] = **The heatmap is useful for gaining a general idea of the wealth of your citizens as well as pinpointing areas where citizens might be struggling.**\r\n\r\nLowering taxes and building Welfare Offices can be used to help struggling citizens.
Tutorials.TITLE[NotificationsGroup] = NOTIFICATIONS
Tutorials.TITLE[NotificationTutorial] = Notifications
Tutorials.TITLE[NotificationTutorialIntro] = Notifications
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[NotificationTutorialIntro] = **Notification icons are shown to highlight different situations.**\r\n\r\nSome guide you in placing buildings and building roads. Others are signs of a problem in an area or a building.\r\n\r\n**Select the icon to see more information.**\r\n\r\nOnce the situation is cleared, the notification also disappears.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadRequiredTutorial] = Road Required
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadRequiredTutorialIntro] = A City Service building has no road access
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadRequiredTutorialIntro] = Your **service buildings need to be situated next to a road** for them to receive electricity, and for materials and employees to be able to move in and out.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadRequiredTutorialBuildRoad] = Build a road for Service Building
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadRequiredTutorialBuildRoad] = You can fix the issue by **building a road along the front of the building** and connecting that road to the existing road network.\r\n\r\nYou can locate the front of the building by looking for the Road Required notification icon.
Tutorials.TITLE[RoadRequiredTutorialRelocate] = Relocate a Service Building
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RoadRequiredTutorialRelocate] = You can also solve the issue by relocating the building next to an existing road.\r\n\r\n**Selecting the building opens the building information panel. Select the relocate icon at the bottom,** and you can move the building to a new location.
Tutorials.TITLE[TrafficAccidentTutorial] = Traffic Accident
Tutorials.TITLE[TrafficAccidentTutorialIntro] = There has been a traffic accident
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TrafficAccidentTutorialIntro] = Help is on the way! \r\n\r\n**The Police, Fire & Rescue, and Healthcare service buildings send out vehicles to the site as needed to handle the situation.**\r\n\r\nTo make accident clearance as efficient as possible, make sure your city has these services available and that police cars, fire engines and ambulances have a clear path to the accident site.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[TrafficAccidentTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Fire & Rescue Info View
Tutorials.TITLE[AirPollutionTutorial] = Air Pollution
Tutorials.TITLE[AirPollutionTutorialIntro] = The air is getting polluted
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[AirPollutionTutorialIntro] = **Air Pollution is affecting the Health of citizens.**\r\n\r\nAir Pollution is created mainly by industrial zones, some City Service buildings, and by traffic. It spreads across the map in the air, affected by wind and weather, but fades away quickly once its source is removed. \r\n\r\n**Find polluting City Service buildings and consider upgrading them with filtering systems where you can, or relocate the buildings. Existing industrial zones can be recreated in locations that are further away from people's homes.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[AirPollutionTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Air Pollution Info View
Tutorials.TITLE[GroundPollutionTutorial] = Ground Pollution
Tutorials.TITLE[GroundPollutionTutorialIntro] = The ground is getting polluted
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[GroundPollutionTutorialIntro] = **Ground Pollution is affecting the Health of citizens.**\r\n\r\nGround pollution is created mainly by industrial buildings and some City Service buildings. It spreads on the ground close to its source, and the main danger it poses is contaminating groundwater. If any part of a groundwater deposit becomes affected by Ground Pollution, all of the water within becomes contaminated. If the contaminated water is then pumped into the city, citizens consuming it will become sick.\r\n\r\n**The pollution in groundwater deposits will eventually fade away once its source is removed.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[GroundPollutionTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Ground Pollution Info View
Tutorials.TITLE[NoisePollutionTutorial] = Noise Pollution
Tutorials.TITLE[NoisePollutionTutorialIntro] = There is too much noise
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[NoisePollutionTutorialIntro] = **Noise Pollution is affecting the wellbeing of citizens.**\r\n\r\nNoise Pollution is created by vehicles, some City Service buildings, and abandoned buildings containing squatters.\r\n\r\nNoise pollution is a temporary effect, so it doesn't accumulate, but the effects from multiple sources do stack.\r\n\r\n**Noise pollution is instantly removed when the source is removed.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[NoisePollutionTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Noise Pollution Info View
Tutorials.TITLE[DirtyWaterTutorial] = Water Pollution
Tutorials.TITLE[DirtyWaterTutorialIntro] = The water supply is getting polluted
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[DirtyWaterTutorialIntro] = **Polluted water in the water network is making citizens sick.**\r\n\r\nLook for a sewage outlet that might be overflowing or a water pumping station that might be pumping from a polluted water source.\r\n\r\n**The pollution in the water supply will eventually fade away once its source is removed.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[DirtyWaterTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to Water Pollution Info View
Tutorials.TITLE[MedicalClinicTutorial] = Medical Clinic required
Tutorials.TITLE[MedicalClinicTutorialIntro] = A Medical Clinic is needed
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MedicalClinicTutorialIntro] = Citizens are getting sick and there's nowhere to treat them. \r\n\r\n**Build a Medical Clinic!**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[MedicalClinicTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Healthcare Service
Tutorials.TITLE[CemeteryTutorial] = Cemetery required
Tutorials.TITLE[CemeteryTutorialIntro] = A Cemetery is needed
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CemeteryTutorialIntro] = Citizens have passed away, but there is no place to bury them. \r\n\r\n**Build a Cemetery!**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[CemeteryTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Deathcare Service
Tutorials.TITLE[FireTutorial] = Building Fire
Tutorials.TITLE[FireTutorialIntro] = A building is on fire
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FireTutorialIntro] = Fires in buildings are a danger both to the buildings themselves as well as the residents inside. \r\n\r\n**Don't worry, fire engines have been dispatched to put it out.**\r\n\r\nHowever, if the response time of the Fire & Rescue service is too long, the fire can begin to spread to nearby buildings. The longer the fire goes on, the higher the probability of spreading becomes.\r\n\r\n**Check that your city has the required services available and that the service vehicles have a clear path to the accident site.**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[FireTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Fire & Rescue Service
Tutorials.TITLE[ForestFireTutorial] = Forest Fires
Tutorials.TITLE[ForestFireTutorialIntro] = The forest is on fire
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ForestFireTutorialIntro] = Fires in a forest destroy the wood resources as trees burn down. The fire can spread rapidly, and if there are buildings next to the burning trees, they may catch fire as well.\r\n\r\n**Extinguishing forest fires requires firefighting helicopters,** since fire engines cannot reach areas outside of the road network.\r\n\r\nIf the fire reaches a road, fire engines can help in controlling the fire and keep it from spreading further. \r\n\r\n**Firewatch Towers work as an early warning system** and will help to alert the Fire & Rescue services as soon as a forest fire breaks out in their vicinity.\r\n\r\n**Make sure your city has all the necessary services available.**\r\n
Tutorials.TRIGGER[ForestFireTutorialIntroTrigger] = Navigate to the Fire & Rescue Service
Tutorials.TITLE[CitizensCategory] = CITIZENS
Tutorials.TITLE[ChirperTutorial] = CHIRPER
Tutorials.TITLE[ChirperTutorialIntro] = Chirps
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ChirperTutorialIntro] = **Citizens, city services and companies chirp about their situations and opinions.**\r\n\r\nChirps are **often about  problems and successes** in the city and reflect how your citizens are feeling. \r\n\r\nYou can use this to guide your city development decisions.
Tutorials.TITLE[ChirperTutorialChirperInfo] = Chirper Information
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[ChirperTutorialChirperInfo] = Selecting the **chirp writer's name** will open a panel with more **information** about them.
Tutorials.TITLE[FollowingCitizensTutorial] = FOLLOWING CITIZENS
Tutorials.TITLE[FollowingCitizensTutorialIntro] = Following Citizens
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FollowingCitizensTutorialIntro] = You can choose to follow citizens and get updates on their lives.\r\n\r\nAdding them to this panel makes it easy to check up on them whenever you want.
Tutorials.TITLE[FollowingCitizensTutorialFollowNow] = Follow a Citizen
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[FollowingCitizensTutorialFollowNow] = **Move around the city and find someone to follow.**\r\n\r\nSelecting is easier when the simulation is paused.\r\n\r\nWhen you select a citizen, their information panel opens.\r\n\r\n**Find the Follow button in the bottom of the citizen information panel, and select it to add the citizen to your list.**\r\n\r\nYou can use the list later to find them anywhere in the city as well as see any events that have taken place in their life.
Tutorials.TITLE[EventJournalTutorial] = EVENT JOURNAL
Tutorials.TITLE[EventJournalTutorialIntro] = Events
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EventJournalTutorialIntro] = The Event Journal is a running collection of events that have taken place in the city.\r\n\r\nThese are things such as **accidents, fires, storms, and celebrations.**
Tutorials.TITLE[EventJournalTutorialFiresAndAccidents] = Fires and Accidents
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EventJournalTutorialFiresAndAccidents] = If you find that the number of **road accidents is high,**  check the condition of your roads and **build Road Maintenance Depots as needed.**\r\n\r\nWhen there is a **high number of building fires** it can be an indication that the **Fire & Rescue services in your city are insufficient.**
Tutorials.TITLE[EventJournalTutorialNaturalDisasters] = Natural Disasters
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EventJournalTutorialNaturalDisasters] = If you're seeing **lots of citizens hurt by natural disasters,** it might be beneficial to **build more Emergency Shelters,** so citizens can take cover when needed.
Tutorials.TITLE[EventJournalTutorialCelebrations] = Celebrations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EventJournalTutorialCelebrations] = Celebration events show you how many people took part in the event.
Tutorials.TITLE[RadioTutorial] = RADIO
Tutorials.TITLE[RadioTutorialIntro] = Radio
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RadioTutorialIntro] = Choose the tunes to listen to.
Tutorials.TITLE[RadioTutorialNetwork] = Broadcasting Network
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RadioTutorialNetwork] = **Radio Networks** are listed here.\r\n\r\nEach network has a selection of radio stations to choose from.
Tutorials.TITLE[RadioTutorialStations] = Stations
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RadioTutorialStations] = The **Radio Stations** available in the network are listed here.
Tutorials.TITLE[RadioTutorialVolume] = Volume
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RadioTutorialVolume] = Adjust the **volume up or down** to your liking.
Tutorials.TITLE[RadioTutorialAds] = Radio Commercials
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[RadioTutorialAds] = Don't like commercials interrupting your music?\r\n\r\nYou can **turn ads on or off** here.
Tutorials.TITLE[Interface&ToolsCategory] = INTERFACE & TOOLS
Tutorials.TITLE[KeyboardCameraTutorial] = CAMERA CONTROLS
Tutorials.TITLE[KeyboardCameraTutorialMove] = Moving the Camera
Tutorials.TRIGGER[KeyboardCameraTutorialMoveTrigger] = Move the camera with the <inputAction:Camera/Move> keys.
Tutorials.TITLE[KeyboardCameraTutorialRotate] = Rotating the Camera
Tutorials.TITLE[KeyboardCameraTutorialZoom] = Zooming with Camera
Tutorials.TRIGGER[KeyboardCameraTutorialZoomTrigger] = Zoom in and out with <inputAction:Camera/Zoom[1]> and  <inputAction:Camera/Zoom[0]> or by scrolling with the mouse wheel.
Tutorials.TITLE[GamepadCameraTutorial] = CAMERA CONTROLS
Tutorials.TITLE[GamepadCameraTutorialMove] = Moving the Camera
Tutorials.TRIGGER[GamepadCameraTutorialMoveTrigger] = Move the camera with <inputAction:Camera/Move>
Tutorials.TITLE[GamepadCameraTutorialRotate] = Rotating the Camera
Tutorials.TRIGGER[GamepadCameraTutorialRotateTrigger] = Rotate the camera with <inputAction:Camera/Rotate>
Tutorials.TITLE[GamepadCameraTutorialZoom] = Zooming with Camera
Tutorials.TRIGGER[GamepadCameraTutorialZoomTrigger] = Zoom in and out with <inputAction:Camera/Zoom>
Tutorials.TITLE[PauseMenuTutorial] = PAUSE MENU
Tutorials.TITLE[PausemenuTutorialIntro] = Settings, options and more
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PausemenuTutorialIntro] = You can visit the pause menu at any time. \r\n\r\nTo Save and Load your game.\r\n\r\nUnder Options you will find settings for Graphics, Audio, Tutorials and more.  \r\n\r\n**The game will be paused while the menu is open.**\r\n\r\n
Tutorials.TITLE[SimulationSpeedTutorial] = SIMULATION
Tutorials.TITLE[SimulationSpeedTutorialIntro] = Simulation
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SimulationSpeedTutorialIntro] = **Pausing the simulation will temporarily stop time.**\r\n\r\nThis allows you to build, plan and find solutions at your own pace. \r\n\r\nOnce you're done, **unpause the game to resume the flow of time** so that life in the city will continue.
Tutorials.TITLE[SimulationSpeedTutorialIntroSpeed] = Simulation Speed
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SimulationSpeedTutorialIntroSpeed] = If you feel time is going by too slowly or passing by too quickly, you can **switch between three different simulation speeds.**
Tutorials.TITLE[BulldozerTutorial] = BULLDOZER
Tutorials.TITLE[BulldozerTutorialIntro] = Bulldozer
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[BulldozerTutorialIntro] = Made a mistake? Don't worry, you can bulldoze it. \r\n\r\nSelect the bulldozer and use\r\n\r\n<inputAction:Tool/Apply> **to remove objects and get a refund.**
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[BulldozerTutorialIntro] = Made a mistake? Don't worry, you can bulldoze it. \r\n\r\nSelect the bulldozer and use\r\n\r\n<inputAction:Tool/Apply> **to remove objects and get a refund.**
Tutorials.TITLE[UndergroundTutorial] = UNDERGROUND VIEW
Tutorials.TITLE[UndergroundTutorialIntro] = Underground view
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[UndergroundTutorialIntro] = You can **turn the underground view on and off** here at any time.\r\n\r\nTurning on the underground view makes it easier to build at different depths and to find connection points.\r\n\r\nYou can also use it while replacing or bulldozing roads and pipes that are built underground.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeGroup] = PHOTO MODE
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorial] = CINEMATIC CAMERA
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialIntro] = Cinematic Camera
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialIntro] = **Make a video!**\r\n\r\nMake your camera move through your city, change the time of day as the camera moves and add camera effects.\r\n\r\nCapture the video with your favorite software.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialTimeLine] = Timeline
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialTimeLine] = **This is the Timeline for your video.**\r\n\r\nStart with the marker at the beginning of the timeline.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialCaptureKey] = Capture Key
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialCaptureKey] = **Tracking your camera movement is done by placing Capture Keys to the timeline.**\r\n\r\nEach Capture Key records the place of the camera at the moment you select the Key.\r\n\r\nStart by moving your camera to where you want to start from and add a Capture Key.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialCurves] = Curves
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialCurves] = **Capture Keys will appear here on the curve.**\r\n\r\nThis is the representation of your camera position.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialTimeLineMove] = Moving on the Timeline
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialTimeLineMove] = **Move the Timeline marker forward.**\r\n\r\nthis is the amount of time that elapses between the Capture Keys.\r\n\r\n**Move your camera and add your next Capture Key.**\r\n\r\nRepeat this as many times as you want, to create the camera movement you want.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialAdjustingKeys] = Adjusting Keys
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialAdjustingKeys] = **Capture Keys can be adjusted on the curve.**\r\n\r\nTo adjust and edit your camera position and movement, you can select Capture Keys on the curve and move them.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialDeleteKeys] = Deleting Keys
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialDeleteKeys] = Select the Capture Key you want to remove on the curve, the Capture Key icon will change to show a minus sign.\r\n\r\n**Delete the Capture Key by selecting the Capture Key icon.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialSegmentDuration] = Segment Duration
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialSegmentDuration] = **To view your timeline in a different length of time,** move the slider back and forth here.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialPreview] = Preview 
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialPreview] = **To preview your camera movement or view what position your camera is in a CaptureKey,** move the Timeline marker back and forth on the Timeline.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialAddingCameraEffects] = Adding Camera Effects
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialAddingCameraEffects] = **You can use any of the Camera Effects in your video.**\r\n\r\nTurn on the camera option you want by selecting the checkbox, adjust the effect, and **add it to your Timeline by selecting the Capture Key Icon next to the checkbox.**
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialAdjustingCameraEffects] = Adjusting Camera Effects
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialAdjustingCameraEffects] = **Camera effect Capture Keys will appear here on a curve.**\r\n\r\nTo make changes like moving from day to night during your camera movement.\r\n\r\nSelect and adjust the camera option you want, add the camera capture key at the beginning of the Timeline, move the Timeline marker to when you want to effect to be different and add a Capture Key with different settings.
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialPlay] = Play
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[CinematicCameraTutorialPlay] = **To play the camera movement, select play.**\r\n\r\nThis will show you the camera movement you have made, without any icons or panels on the screen.\r\n\r\nReturn normal view with <inputAction:Tool/Cancel[1]> 
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[CinematicCameraTutorialPlay] = **To play the camera movement, select play.**\r\n\r\nThis will show you the camera movement you have made, without any icons or panels on the screen.\r\n\r\nReturn normal view with <inputAction:Navigation/Back> 
Tutorials.TITLE[CinematicCameraTutorialSaveAndLoad] = Save and Load
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CinematicCameraTutorialSaveAndLoad] = Save and Load the Camera Movement and settings you have made.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorial] = PHOTO MODE
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialIntro] = Taking Pictures
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PhotoModeTutorialIntro] = **Take a snapshot or spend some time and delve into the art of photography.** \r\n\r\nYou can use the default camera or fine tune it with lots of options.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialCamera] = Camera
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PhotoModeTutorialCamera] = **Build the camera you want.**\r\n\r\nChange the sensor size, Blade Count and more.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialLens] = Lens
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PhotoModeTutorialLens] = **Tune your Camera Lens.**\r\n\r\nVignette, Bloom and others, get the effect you want.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialColor] = Color
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PhotoModeTutorialColor] = **Get the colors just right.**\r\n\r\nBright and saturated, black and white and everything in between, make it happen here.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialWeather] = Weather
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PhotoModeTutorialWeather] = **Move the clouds and color the sky.**\r\n\r\nClouds not in the right place for the perfect shot or the tint of the sky not what you want? You can fix it here.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialEnvironment] = Environment
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PhotoModeTutorialEnvironment] = **Change the time of day.**\r\n\r\nDon't wait around for the right moment in time, choose it here.
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialActivateFeature] = Activating Camera Features
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[PhotoModeTutorialActivateFeature] = **Select the check box next to each feature to turn it on.**\r\n\r\nTo change the value, hover over the option and drag the arrows left or right with <inputAction:Tool/Apply>\r\n\r\nYou can also enter the value manually, using a keyboard.
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[PhotoModeTutorialActivateFeature] = **Select the check box next to each feature to turn it on.**\r\n\r\nTo change the value of the feature\r\n\r\nMove to the value with <inputAction:Navigation/Move Horizontal>\r\n\r\nActivate the value by selecting it with <inputAction:Tool/Apply>\r\n\r\n**Use keyboard to change the value.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialTakePhoto] = Take a Photo
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[PhotoModeTutorialTakePhoto] = Take Photo button **captures a picture without any of the UI elements and saves it to the Screenshots folder.**
Tutorials.TITLE[PhotoModeTutorialHideUI] = Hide UI
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[PhotoModeTutorialHideUI] = **Hide UI button hides all icons, panels and notifications, including the Photo Mode panel.**\r\n\r\nThis is useful for fine tuning your image composition without obstructions to the view.\r\n\r\n**While in Hide UI mode, take a picture with** <inputAction:Shortcuts/Take Photo>\r\n\r\n**Return to normal view with** <inputAction:Tool/Cancel[1]> 
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[PhotoModeTutorialHideUI] = **Hide UI button hides all icons, panels and notifications, including the Photo Mode panel.**\r\n\r\nThis is useful for fine tuning your image composition without obstructions to the view.\r\n\r\nWhile in Hide UI mode, **take a picture with** <inputAction:Shortcuts/Take Photo>\r\n\r\n**Return to normal view with** <inputAction:Navigation/Back>
Tutorials.HINTS_TITLE = Hints
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[MilestoneTutorialCityGrowth] = Track how your city is growing and how far you have to go to reach the next milestone.\r\n\r\n**Milestones unlock new features, dev points and more.**
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_KEYBOARD[MapTileTutorialIntro] = **Purchasing new map tiles expands the area you can build on.**\r\n\r\nYou can select tiles with <inputAction:Tool/Apply> and deselect them with <inputAction:Tool/Secondary Apply> \r\n\r\nTo select or deselect multiple tiles at once, **hold down the button, drag and release.**\r\n\r\nYou can make your city any shape you like. **Tiles don't need to be connected, but it is easier to grow your city if they are.**
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION_GAMEPAD[MapTileTutorialIntro] = **Purchasing new map tiles expands the area you can build on.**\r\n\r\nYou can select tiles with <inputAction:Tool/Apply> and deselect them with <inputAction:Tool/Secondary Apply>\r\n\r\nTo select or deselect multiple tiles at once, **hold down the button, drag and release.**\r\n\r\nYou can make your city any shape you like. **Tiles don't need to be connected, but it is easier to grow your city if they are.**
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[AirwaysTutorialPlaceAirport] = Airports are some of the largest service buildings, and need a lot of room.\r\n\r\n**Look for a large, flat area to build your Airport on, and keep an eye on the airport airspace.**\r\n\r\nAirspace is room for airplanes to climb after takeoff and for approaching the airport for landing.\r\n\r\nRemember to also build road access to the Airport so that passengers and cargo can move in and out without problems.
Tutorials.DISABLE_CONFIRMATION_TEXT_GAMEPAD = Even with tutorials disabled, you can always access the information from the **Advisor.**\r\n\r\nThe Advisor offers helpful information in case you get stuck, or want more in-depth information on a feature.\r\n \r\nPress <inputAction:Shortcuts/Advisor> to open the Advisor and browse the content.\r\n\r\n**Are you sure you want to disable tutorials?**
Tutorials.TODO_OUTRO_GAMEPAD = Well Done!\r\n\r\nYou have completed your tasks and now have the basic knowledge of how to build a city.\r\n\r\nGoing forward, more tutorials and hints will pop up to guide you on your way.\r\n\r\nIf you feel like you no longer need the guidance, **you can turn tutorials off in the pause menu.**\r\n\r\nYou can always review old tutorials by accessing the Advisor with <inputAction:Shortcuts/Advisor>.\r\n\r\n\r\n**Would you like to continue building this city or start a new one?**
Tutorials.TRIGGER[KeyboardCameraTutorialRotateTrigger] = Rotate the camera with <inputAction:Camera/Rotate[2]> and <inputAction:Camera/Rotate[3]> \r\nTilt the camera with <inputAction:Camera/Rotate[0]> and <inputAction:Camera/Rotate[1]> \r\nor hold down the middle mouse button and move the mouse.
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TrainOutsideTutorialIntro] = To decrease the highway traffic caused by visiting tourist and people moving into the city, **you can create Passenger Railway Lines to the outside world.**
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[LandmarksTutorialIntro] = **Landmarks make the city an attractive destination for tourists, and increases the happiness of citizens.**\r\n\r\nLandmarks are somewhat expensive to upkeep. Place them thoughtfully and keep an eye on their numbers.
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[VegetationTutorialIntro] = Trees, bushes and other greenery can be used to decorate your city.\r\n\r\n**Trees grows with the passing of time.**
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[CityInfoTutorialDemandPlusMinus] = **Plus signs indicate an abundance of the described resource or labor force type** in your city, which increases demand for the zone type.\r\n\r\n**Minus signs indicate a lack of the described resource or labor force type** in your city, which lowers demand for the zone type.
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[SignatureBuildingTutorialIntro] = **These are unique buildings that unlock one by one as you fulfill requirements specific for each building.**\r\n\r\nOnce unlocked, you can build one of each of the Signature Buildings.\r\n\r\nBuilding a Signature Building grants you XP.
Tutorials.TITLE[TourismTutorialTouristGo] = Where tourists go
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[TourismTutorialAttractions] = **Attractions are buildings with an Attractiveness value.**\r\n\r\nThese include **Parks & Recreation** buildings, and some **Signature Buildings.**
Tutorials.TITLE[EducationTutorialIntroEducationElementary] = Elementary School
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EducationTutorialIntroEducationElementary] = **Elementary schools provide the beginning of the education path for citizens.**\r\n\r\nElementary Schools provide a passive well-being bonus to nearby families with children.
Tutorials.TITLE[EducationTutorialIntroEducationElementaryBuild] = Building an Elementary School
Tutorials.DESCRIPTION[EducationTutorialIntroEducationElementaryBuild] = **Build elementary schools in areas with families.**\r\n\r\nChildren will start attending the nearest school to their home, no matter how far it is.\r\n\r\n**Keep in mind that if children need to travel too far to attend elementary school, it will negatively affect their families well-being.**\r\n\r\nSchools can hold a limited amount of students, so you will need to build more schools as the population grows.
Tutorials.TRIGGER[EducationTutorialIntroEducationElementaryBuildTrigger] = Build an Elementary School
ZoningFactors.PANEL_TITLE = Zoning Factors
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[Workplaces] = nearby workplaces
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[Services] = nearby services
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[Competitors] = no competitors
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[Customers] = nearby customers
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[OutsideConnections] = nearby outside connection
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[Workplaces] = no nearby workplaces
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[Services] = no nearby services
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[Competitors] = lots of competitors
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[Customers] = no nearby customers
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[OutsideConnections] = no nearby outside connection
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[Inputs] = good resource availability
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[Inputs] = poor resource availability
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[Pollution] = no pollution
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[Pollution] = high pollution
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[LandValue] = cheap land
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[LandValue] = expensive land
ZoningFactors.POSITIVE[Employees] = nearby employees
ZoningFactors.NEGATIVE[Employees] = no nearby employees
Editor.CHECKLIST = Checklist
Editor.CHECKLIST_REQUIRED = Required
Editor.CHECKLIST_OPTIONAL = Optional
Editor.CHECKLIST_STARTING_TILES = Select starting tiles
Editor.CHECKLIST_WATER = Have surface or ground water in the starting area
Editor.CHECKLIST_ROAD_CONNECTION = Have an outside road connection
Editor.CHECKLIST_TRAIN_CONNECTION = Have an outside train connection
Editor.CHECKLIST_AIR_CONNECTION = Have an outside airplane connection
Editor.CHECKLIST_OIL = Have oil areas in your map
Editor.CHECKLIST_ORE = Have ore areas in your map
Editor.CHECKLIST_FOREST = Have forest areas in your map
Editor.CHECKLIST_FERTILE = Have fertile areas in your map
